Capitol City Brewing Company downtown 16oz ($3.50hh): Pours a darkish golden color with a nice looking head. Aroma is of sourdough, hops, and some other fancy jawns. Anyway, the taste was pretty legit. Moderate bitterness, definitely short of what pilsner could be, but enough to give it flavor. Some bread is up there. Wonderfully smooth and crisp. This is a beer worth having.

Sampled at 4th NoVA Summer Brewfest. Pours lightly hazy gold with a medium, fizzy white head, medium retention with good lacing. Aroma is heavy malt (straw, meal, cereal), light hops (spicy), notes of corn, and a clean lager character. Flavor is malt dominant with light spicy hops; clean character. Light body and warmth, medium carbonation with a dry finish.

Shirlington Location. Orange color. Slightly sour aroma, nice hop aroma. Frankly I’m not a huge fan of lager type beers for the most part, but this one was just amazing. Flavor was smooth, and the aftertaste was fantastic.

Very cloudy orange - rich in color - with a small white head. A bit of a sour grain nose, whiffs of rye, wheat, sourdough… stenchy, sweaty hops as well... quite nice though, almost some sour lactic yeast qualities as well… just a really strange aroma but nice – smells like a harvest, like fresh cut crops. More sour grains and rye tastes, starchy and parched palate, with some old fruit – old oranges – and dough and a nice rough, grainy hop pellet bitterness. Very good after a whole pint, I definitely warmed up to this one, and it’s unique and tasty.

Clear, golden to amber color, lots of carbonation and weak head. Aroma of malt with hints of white wine, some grapes and apples. Taste is bitter-sweet, but the carbonation is balanced. Some fermented fruits and a very nasty wet cardboard-like taste. Dry finish, a rough bitterness, short.
Taste was good.Little bitter but it is fine than other beer.Price was also cheap than other beer.
Bottle brought by my mom from Nepal. Golden color, white head. Pretty common lager, refreshing but not special

Bomber poured and shared by Eric. Dude, this is awesome. I saw this sitting across the room and I said, "what do you have here?!?". He replies " I don't know... Let's find out.". I nerd out over rare country lagers more than rare whales. Cheers to that! I was just swinging by to grab a growler. Not anymore. Pours a clean, shiny golden pour, plenty of carb, a decent amount of active fizz head. A cornish grain on the nose, which had me worried, but the flavor on this blows away all expectations from an international pale lager. Barely a corn grain, a slight sweet malt. Interesting enough hops added to this. Am I supposed to like this this much? Either way, I do.
Bottle. Pours a light yellow colour with a thin white head, the aroma is light hops, the taste is medium bitterness and with a dry bitter finish.
Bottle in Pokhara. Light body, little to no head. hay, soft malts, light sweetness. Thirst quenching.

650ml bottle [Thanks Steffi!]. Clear, yellow-ish, golden colour with small to average, thick, frothy, half-way lasting, minimally lacing, snow-white head. Strawy, grainy aroma, a mild touch of silage. Taste is minimally sweet pale malty, grassy hoppy overtones, some malt spiciness, moderate hop bitterness; slightly watery. Clean and well balanced.
Bottle bought in Leuven from Asian bottle shop. Nice golden body with slight head. Nose is grainy, malty and eggy. Taste of malts, rice, spices. Cream texture. Papery thin.

Bottle received as a gift from a friend. Thank you! 650 ml. bottle sampled @ home. BBF 02/16. Sticker on the back states that this was imported into Belgium. Surprised that there is a market big enough for this in Belgium to warrant shipping this across the globe. Clear golden, disappearing paper-white head. Nose is nasty corn, huge vegetable oil, very sweet industrial corn & eggs. Taste is sweet empty corn, vegetable oil, low mineral, big sweet corn, basic weird sweetener & corn sweetness, vegetables, starch, hay,… Oily, tad watery, quite industrial sweet,.. Very basic sweetness, no real bad flavours,… Not very good but I have definitely had worse, I expected this one to be worse.
Butelka wypita w Nepalu w 2014r.. Kolor z³oty, klarowne, piana s³aba szybko znika.Aromat lekko s³odowe, smak chmielowy ledwo wyczuwalny, s³odkie, nic szczególnego.

Draft sample at the Michigan Brewers Guild Fall Fest. Listed as "Saison du Bastone". Cloudy straw color with frothy white head. Nice aroma of citrus, spices, and some barnyard. Crisp refreshing mouthfeel. A pretty nice example of the style!
I don’t see this one listed by Bastone, so I added it. Had it a month or so ago. Fairly plain, not a very good saison. After trying it out, I switched to the IPA.

Sampled on tap at Willimantic Brewing Company. Pours a murky golden color with a light head. Aroma very faint on hops with malt being more prominent. Flavor too. Some hops and alcohol on the finish. Average body. I would like to try the brewery’s other IPAs, because this one didn’t really do it for me.

Serving: Draft at the brewpub. It pours a cloudy amber orange with a small, white head. The nose is filled with citric hops, sweet malt, and tropical notes. The taste brings some earthy and herbal notes to the party with the tropicals and citrus notes coming back for an encore. Medium bodied with low carbonation and a long, bitter finish. Quite a nice IPA!
Pours amber with a thin white head. Smells of citrus, resin, peppery. Tastes spicy and sticky with some resiny ints on the finish.

column2: Red Bank, New Jersey, United States
column5: from the same day-pours a retaining off white head that laces and cloudy brown/orange color. Aroma is wet cardboard, faint chocolate-malt. Taste starts with a hint of chocolate-malt, quickly balanced by earthy/spicy-hops. Lacks nuttiness and roastiness but enough hoppiness it comes across as a porter light. Mild carbonation. 2.9 OK second pint had nuttiness and roastiness. 3.4

It pours golden and clear with a white head. Head retention is good. It has aromas of apple and spice. There are some light honey notes with bread dough. There are some brandy flavors with apple. It has some spice to it with a bit of honey. It has some doughy elements in the background. It has a medium full body with noticeable alcohol which is pleasant and warming. Overall, the apple brandy element brings this tripel a new dimension which is quite good.

Pint can, 2017 vintage. Sweet apple aroma with notes of brandy, vanilla, oak, booze and some banana. Pours cloudy golden colored with a thin off white head that has good retention and some lacing. Starts with sweet apple, banana and oak flavors as well as having a rich full body and boozy mouthfeel. Finishes smooth with brandy and vanilla flavors as well as a good dose of warming booze. Really nice, but hard to tell if it’s a tripel.
On tap at Man in the Moon. Golden with a white head. Sweet with fruit, yeast, some esters and oak. The body was full and the finish with warming alcohol.

Clear deep golden with a thin foamy white head. Nice boozy full golden malt aroma that’s semisweet with tones of apple and brandy. Smooth full warming flavor that’s boozy, apple fruity, spirited like brandy or light whiskey, with a golden malty sweet finish.
On tap at Randolph Williamsburg. Pours gold. Brandy, boozy, orange peel, banana, boozy heat to finish. Medium body. Better than those notes imply.
Hazy straw yellow pour with a white head. Aroma of apple, raisin, and brandy. Sweet apple flavor with tropical fruit and hint of brandy. Warm creamy finish. Nice.

16 oz single can from Two Angels Liquors. Golden to light orange colored appearance with slight haze and a white head. Aroma of apple pie, tropical fruit, fruity esters, toasted malt and light herbal/floral notes. Similar flavor, rich, fruity and sweet with moderate sweetness. Medium to full body with a lingering finish. Interesting.

Pours clear pale golden with a one finger, white head. Aroma is apples, brandy, raisins and light hops. Taste is apple and light caramel, moving strong hop backbone. Finish is hoppy. This is a hops lovers tripel.

Some of my favorite stouts are aged in brandy barrels, so I was really looking forward to trying this beer. I don’t think this Belgian ale holds up as well to the barrel as stouts do. Most of what might’ve made the beer distinct is lost in the boozy swell of the brandy character. This beer pours golden yellow in color with very little foam. The aroma is a little bit of cracker malt, but mostly just boozy notes from the brandy barrel. Those brandy notes dominate the flavor. There isn’t much else to say about it. It doesn’t taste bad if you like apple brandy. but I was hoping for a beer that would impart the barrel without completely surrendering to it.

2018 edition, now 11%. $4.75 pint can, Beer Run. Pours slightly hazy golden with a small white head. Aroma is fresh cut flowers, apple cider, barrel, yeast. Flavor is apple brandy - very boozy tasting, along with barrel, yeast, cider, green grapes, earth, licorice.

12 year old Bottle shared by alexsdad06 pour opaque cola brown with minimal head. Nose big red raspberry light caramel. Taste still big red raspberry, hides the alcohol amazingly well, tastes like a light fruited beer. Held up amazingly well

Nip bottle recently shared with drsordr (I had this on draft when it was originally released at the Kuhnhenn Solstice party and forgot to rate). Pours a dark reddish brown color with very little head. The aroma and flavor have chocolate covered raspberries, caramel, very little sign of the abv, I enjoyed this fresh and was shocked by how well that it held up since 2007.

At a tasting, small bubbly head, clear deep brown color, some red hues, aroma of cassis and raspberries with some biscuit behind, red fruit jam flavors, sweet and cloying with a hint of dark chocolate. completley over the top, too sweet and quite difficult to drink,
Bottle sample at a tasting at troubles' place. Thanks Tom L. Clear reddish amber. Lots of cassis, candy-ish, malt, caramel, very sweet, syrupy, some alcohol. Over the top.
At Dror's place, pours red to brown with a beige head, aroma of marmalade, strawberry, flavor of marmalade, strawberry, chocolate, medium bodied

12 ounce bottle into snifter, 2015 vintage. Pours hazy dark ruby red, light copper/brown color with a 1 finger dense and rocky light khaki head with great retention, that reduces to a thin lace cap that lingers. Nice spotty soapy lacing clings on the glass, with a fair amount of streaming carbonation. Aromas of big juicy/tart/tangy red currants, fruit skin/seeds, raisin, plum, prune, cherry, fig, date, apricot, red apple, red grape/wine, caramel, brown sugar, toffee, toasted biscuit, and brown bread/crust; with lighter notes of molasses, vanilla, cocoa, smoke, leather, tobacco, wood, herbal, grass, pepper, and yeast/toasted earthiness. Damn nice aromas with great balance and complexity of currants, fruity yeast, dark/bready/light roasted malts, and light-moderate earthy hop notes; with big strength. Taste of huge juicy/tart/tangy red currants, fruit skin/seeds, raisin, plum, prune, cherry, fig, date, apricot, red apple, red grape/wine, caramel, brown sugar, toffee, toasted biscuit, and brown bread/crust; with lighter notes of molasses, vanilla, cocoa, smoke, leather, tobacco, wood, herbal, grass, pepper, and yeast/toasted earthiness. Light-moderate herbal, woody, grassy, peppery bitterness; and fruit tang/tartness on the finish. Lingering notes of tart/tangy currants, fruit skin/seeds, raisin, plum, prune, cherry, fig, date, apricot, red apple, red grape/wine, caramel, brown sugar, toffee, toasted biscuit, brown bread/crust, molasses, vanilla, cocoa, smoke, leather, tobacco, wood, herbal, grass, pepper, and yeast/toasted earthiness on the finish for a while. Amazing complexity, robustness, and balance of currants, fruity yeast, dark/bready/light roasted malts, and light-moderate earthy hop flavors; with an amazing malt/bitterness, and tart/tangy fruit balance; with no cloying/astringent flavors after the finish. Lightly increasing dryness from lingering bitterness and tart/tangy fruit. Medium carbonation and very full body; with a very smooth, creamy/silky/bready, fairly sticky/acidic/tangy/tannic, and lightly slick mouthfeel that is fantastic. Minimal warming alcohol for 16.5%. Overall this is an amazing fruited old ale! All around incredible complexity, robustness, and balance of currants, fruity yeast, dark/bready/light roasted malts, and light-moderate earthy hop flavors; very smooth and dangerously easy to drink for the huge ABV, with the mellowly bitter/tart/tangy/drying finish. Amazingly soft feel for the big ABV. Perfectly balanced between jammy currants, fruity yeast, and rich dark/bready malt complexity; with nice earthy hop presence. Light residual sweet with lingering dryness. A highly enjoyable offering, and amazing style example as expected. Never had the base beer; but this is perfectly balanced between old ale and fruit character.

18.02.2019, 6 oz bottle (2007 vintage) shared @ BBGTC tasting: Flat, dark reddish amber color. Aroma is slightly sweet concentrated fruity, dried dark fruits, minerals, hay, sour dark berries, dusty cellar, toasted honey, fruit stones, soil, bark, butterscotch. Taste is slightly dry sour-ish fruity, sour dark berries winegum, fruit stones, bark, minerals, alcohol, soil, toasted honey, sour grass, chocolate, butterscotch, weeds. Medium bitterness, slightly harsh sour-ish fruity mouthfeel. Fair enough.

Thanks Gregg. Dark red ruby some reddish foam on top. Huge currant jam nose, sweet and full on flavourful. Taste is sweet, black currants bitterness, super juicy and jammy. Bitter background but overall quite smooth. Tasty but maybe not too well balanced.

12 oz. bottle. Pours deep brown. Smells of strong currant and rich caramel and leathery malt. Tastes of tart currants right up front. Earthy malts and turn sweet. Brown sugar and tart currant finish. Medium body. No way is this 15% ABV. Very tasty and surprisingly easy to drink.
Big bold currant flavour. Above average mouthfeel. Thanks for sharing, Brian. Alcohol well hidden. Satisfying.

Murky brown pour, really nice tan head and some lace. A nice looking beer. Nose is full of problems. Butter, a little buggy, there is rye and some floral hops. But this is a mess. A little tart, buttery, buggy, vegetal. So many problems in this that it almost tastes like they meant it to be this way. There is rye, that’s cool, and there is a good deal of bitterness.this beer has problems.

Draught @ Brouwer’s Café: &nbsp Deep amber, fairly dark, moderate to large foamy off-white head, so-so lacing. &nbsp Meaty nose, biscuity, some caramel notes. &nbsp Faint hop aspects, otherwise this feels like an American Strong Ale. &nbsp Rather malty on the tongue, sweet, minor citusy aspects, caramel notes, with very subtle Rye. &nbsp This is rather tasty. &nbsp Good balance of sweetness and bitterness. &nbsp Body and mouthfeel are moderate to full. &nbsp Lingering bitterness at the finish, but a nice sweet caramel malt base. &nbsp Good stuff! 7/3/7/3/14

Draft at Brouwer’s. Pours hazy medium orange-ish. Thin but moussy off-white head. Bready, lightly sweet-fruity nose. Not much rye sourness happening here. Medium body, carb is tangible, almost firm, but not intrusive. Nice sour bready rye blasts right off the attack and carries through the mid-palate and the finish. Finishes clean with some lightly peppery hop. Tasty stuff. I’ll definitely seek this out again.
at the tap roomCloudy light amber colour. Quite a bit of tropical fruit aroma. Very sweet, floral, also quite spicy. Rye shows in the tannic finish.

column1: Water Street Mayor McPriors Irish Stout
column5: tap at water street brewpub. pours black, tan head, sweet lace. notes of coffee, toasted, androasted malts. milk chocolate. smooth. nice light roasty bitter bite. pretty good. easy does it.

column1: Water Street Mayor McPriors Irish Stout
column5: Black, loose tan head. Light roasty brown sugar nose. Light thin coffee roast profile. Seriously undercarbonated

column1: Water Street Mayor McPriors Irish Stout
column5: Draught @ the brewpub. Rating #2700. Pours a black color with a creamy tan head. Has a roasted malty chocolate aroma. Roasted malty chocolate and coffee flavor. Has a roasted malty finish with some hints of chocolate in the aftertaste.

column1: Water Street Mayor McPriors Irish Stout
column5: On tap at Water Street Brewing in Port Townsend, WA--Poured a watery yet dark brown-black body. Big coffee presence in the nose with some light chocolate. Thin watery dull mouthfeel. Weak homebrewy caramel finish.

column1: Water Street Mayor McPriors Irish Stout
column5: Draft at the brewpub; Nose is strong raosty coffee, with light chocolate; Black with a big, glass-lacing tan head; flavor of coffee, chocolate, and light caramel; body kind of thin but has a good flavor.

column1: Water Street Mayor McPriors Irish Stout
column5: Dark black-brown with small head. Light, dry coffee roast in the nose and a strong coffee component in flavor. Black patent malts add a bitter-burnt finish.

column1: Water Street Mayor McPriors Irish Stout
column5: Body is black, nice light tan head. Aroma is coffee, with a nice roastiness to it. Taste is coffee, roasty, light hoppiness, a terrific full flavored dry stout.

column1: Water Street Mayor McPriors Irish Stout
column5: Pretty close to black. Lots of black notes - mainly dark chocolate with some coffee and wood. Hoppy and quite roasty as well. The body, though, is quite thin. The abundant bitterness is fun, but I’d like more sugar to round it into a beauty.
(Draught) Cloudy amber body with a dissipated white head. Nose of nail polish. The flavour is very sweet and enamel. This has nothing on Hop Rod Rye. Average.
Foggy amber with very little head on it. Aroma is slightly sweet, with rye, crystal malt. Taste is pretty sweet, rye, light carmel.
An unusual beer. Light fruity aroma, lemon, wheaty. Tastes kind of like a herbal wheat beer. Sweet, grassy.
@GCBF-on hand pump-pours with no head and cloudy gold color. Aroma is herbal. Taste is soapy, plastic, orange-citrus, herbal, some yeast. Interesting . Brewer said orange flavor is from spruce.
Cloudy light amber. Toasty, sweet, and lightly spicy character. Somewhat metallic finish. Decent brew with a lot of rye character.

Hazy golden. Big estery aroma with light florals, bready pale malt and firm alcohol all in a nice balance. Pretty enticing nose, all told. Flavour doesn’t really live up...it’s somewhat fuselly, getting into harsh gasoline country the warmer it gets. There’s still plenty of rich bready malt and peppery alcohol notes...this is what you get in the finish so that bit’s nice. But the middle is problematic.

Flat-looking hazy dull amber...certainly not an attractive beer. Big fennel/anise aroma. They used a bunch of different parts of the anise plant in this one. Flavourwise, it’s a whallop of anisey, fennelly notes. Light alcohol shows through a bit, as do some faint caramel malt notes. This aged bottle actually comes off a bit oxidized, and certainly unbalanced...I’m getting almost nothing but anise, not even hops.

(12oz bottle) Sampled at the Post-post-Great Canadian Beer Festival 2007 in Victoria on September 9th, 2007. Courtesy of Oakes. Thin yellow head with dissipating to the edges and deep mahogany body. Nose of raisins, puree apricots, marshmellow. Fruity and DAMN malty. Lasting tart finish and mellow warm malt. Very good.

Dark brown body. The head dies quickly - it’s a superheavyweight after all. Quite an interesting juxtaposition of light fruit esters (peach, apple) and dark malts (demerera, caramel). Oily, slight, and very sugary. Dark date and plum character towards the finish. Nice, sweet, interesting strong brew.

Maple syrup, marzipan and alcohol blend nicely in the nose. Clear brown body is topped by a shy, tan, fully diminishing head. Sherry, bubblegum, maple syrup, marzipan and bourbon flavours don’t marry all that well. Alcohol is strong in the aftertaste. Overly sweet and bourbon lingers. Medium body with fair to moderate carbonation. If the carbonation lasted longer it would likely taste and look better. Bottle sampled at Oakes’ Xmas tasting 2007.

(Bottle) Sampled at Oakes 2007 Christmas party. Deep ginger brown colour with dissipating white head. Great raisin and fig malt. Flavour of strong honey with undertones of alcoholic gueuze. Tangy finish.

Flat medium brown shade color, extremely fragrant with sweet smells permeating of bourbon and sugars. A bit dissapointing at first sip but rounds out nicely. Low suds which allows for the true flavor to be tasted.

Pours really cloudy, hazy, with smelly yeast and alcohol. Molasses, super sugary too like flan. Thin mouthfeel. Reminds me a lot of maple syrup turned into alcohol. Reminiscent of sweet alcohols like brandy or sherry. Not all that much carbonation.

Re-rate showed a beauty Buffalo Trace-ish nose. Flavour was more balanced...still very sweet but less maple and more vanilla and rich malt character. Slight score upgrade. Dull brown colour. Nice legs. Pear, brown sugar, nuts on the nose. Flavour takes a left turn and goes totally maple...just massively so. Chewy malts back this up. So much maple they could sell this at the souvenir shop at Pearson Int’l.
Hazy orange with a thin white head. Dull citrusy hop aroma. Light to medium bodied smooth a crisp ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Served in a standard pint glass, Carolina's Flagship IPA pours a medium amber with golden highlights. No head forms, but there is a spattering of white bubbles that occasionally coagulate and form a widely-spaced surface covering. Aromas of bright citrus and sweet, lightly roasted malts waft up from the brew with each sniff. The finish is full of malts and hops, and a nice bread-like character makes it quite fulfilling. This breadiness and hops makes up most of the aftertaste. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

An English style with a malty character. Pours a nice clear amber with a big head. The aroma and flavor are malty up front with a peppery hop finish. A bit thin but refreshing. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Fine ipa nothing too cray cray hoppy and fun new to the world love baby yes
Hazy golden colour. Aroma is of assloads of woody, grapefruity hops. Fresh woody flavour...a bit lemony and grapefruity as well. Dry finish is slightly tannic and husky.
Hazy brown colour. Sweet (corn oil) aroma and vague lactic taste. A little sweetness kicks back into the finish, but again it’s sort of corn oily.

rated high for a reason, AND, so everyone else knows, this was never bottled and was just a research brew as per a reply i got back from deschutes brewing. But, try any of there reserve series and you’ll fall in love. 20k imperial porter was a research brew for there XXI black butte porter. And for those of you who didn’t share....bastards!!!!

i was stunned when tasting the brew, its aroma was mild, with a taste that is intoxicating for a porter, the coffee bourbon raisins and chocolate provide an equilibrium of flavor. mad props.. by far best porter

Bottle. Pours black with a very small brown head. Dense aroma of chocolate, bourbon, coffee, raisins, and wood. Roasted malt, more coffee and chocolate in the taste. Nice blend with not-too-strong bourbon flavors, molasses, smoke, and tobacco. Some soy flavors, possibly from the hops. Simply a massive, delicious beer.
Bottle from Whole Foods. Pours dark black with tan head. Chocolate Coffe aroma, slight, slight bourbon. Taste is roast and chocolate with a hint of bourbon.

Growler from Brewpub: Dark black, nice tan head and great lacing. Nose of vegetal roast, light sweet molasses, some nuggat and cocoa. Light vanilla. The flavor is hot and steamy, nice bourbon and chocolate, some turpentine notes, very subtle though, almost soy saucish. Nice balance, many layers. Good.

Draft at brewpub: Dark brown pour with a modest tan head. Nose is sweet with bourbon, oak, and molasses. The taste is also sweet; bourbon, light on the roasted malt, molasses, and brown sugar. Bittersweet chocolate lingers in the tail. Overall quite enjoyable, just a bit sweeter than to be desired when compared to my ideal porter.

Growler from the brewpub. Big sweet chocolate and burbon aroma. Subdued roasted notes as well. Flavor was sweet but very robust. Soft roasted flavor and some coffee and milk chocolate. Lacking the sour ascidic character of most of the style. Soft carbonation and a fairly thin but very smooth palate. Thanks for bringing this one back, Jake.

Tap at Bend Brewing Co, Bend, 23/05/13. Clear golden with a thin off white head. Nose is malt, grain, light spice, touch of fruit. Taste comprises caramel, biscuit, bread, dark fruits, light spice. Medium bodied, fine carbonation. Drinkable but pretty average, lacks depth in the flavour that a decent heller bock should carry.

Sample at the brewpub. Dark orange pour with a medium creamy white head that diminishes steadily. Small patches of lacing on the glass. The aroma is malty with some pungent hops in the background. Medium body with flavors of earthy hops, sweet malt and fruit. The finish is sweet with a malty aftertaste. Decent overall.

On tap at Bailey’s Taproom in Portland, OR--Poured a deep amber body with a medium to small whitish head. Nose of sweet malt resembling some dark fruits balanced with a sharp hops presence. Pears, prunes, and raisins come to mind. I am not usually a big fan of this style of beer, but this one was quite enjoyable.

Draft at the Brewpub: Pours orange with a smaller white head and good lacing. Nose is sweet and fruity, citrus and malt. Taste is consistent with the aroma and adds a caramel and malty note. Very light bitters. One of the better maibocks sampled this season.

column1: Big Horn Snake Thumper Red Ale
column5: Draft: Pours a cloudy reddish orange with a moderate white head and good lacing. Nose is light of malt, citrus, and floral tones. The taste is malty sweetness up front, with citrus and floral hops in the tail. Nice, lingering hops bitters in the trailer. Not bad, but Jordan is right on by only having one pint.

column1: Big Horn Snake Thumper Red Ale
column5: Tap @ Meridian Location: Ruby mahogany hue with an average looking head and lacing. Served in a super thick frozen solid mug, like 1/2" thick, so it took about 30 minutes of watching PAC10 whatevers on the big screen while gripping the mug with an iron grip, to finally get it to warm up to temperature. It doesn’t help that they have 2 sizes available and both are larger than a pint. Digressing, fruity hop nose, light caramel malts and some roast, but very little. The flavor is balanced, a bit more toward an amber ale than a red, but i can’t fault them for that. It’s tasty and drinkable, but by because of an almost ethereal and intangible rule in the beer world for brewers in this category, it still comes across thin for the style. Finishes average. Howdy hum, howdy ho, another pint? Fuckin A no.
Not good either - disgusting. Had this as part of a flight at Monterey Coast Brewing in Salinas, CA.

"If not for the heavier body, I’d have thought they mixed up the pale and IPA. Not nearly as aromatic or as hoppy in flavor as the pale. Too much malty sweetness and really little hop presence. Not a bad beer, but a bad ipa."
Tap at the brewery. Gold pour. Pleasant aroma of pine and sweet malts. Taste is grassy with some sweet malt. Body is light.

Pours a deep golden color with a thin white head that dissipates quickly. Nose is faintly hoppy. Taste is a blast of hops; interestingly somewhat floral and with citrus notes. Nearly full-bodied, lively carbonation, semi-dry finish with a floral flourish. Nice! ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Draft @ the brewpub. Pours a pale amber color with a small white head. Has a fruity malty hoppy aroma with hints of citrus. Fruity malty hoppy flavor. Has a fruity malty hoppy citrus finish.

Clear golden orange pour with a white head. Nose is pretty unpleasant. Urine, berries, herbs, and grass with a sweet caramel and bread malt base. Blech. The flavor is not much better. Quite grassy with a strange herbal quality and lots of berries. Juniper notes, a little bit of pine bitterness, and lots of caramel sweetness.

Tap at the brewery earlier this month. Served in a pint glass full to the rim with absolutely no head. No bubbles. Aroma is barely there with some slight pine if anything. Taste, bland malt forward, simcoe hops in the front but nothing that stands out. The lack of carbonation is a big off putting element. Asked if there was a problem with the carbonation was told, "No, this is the way we intend it to be served." So if you like flat, malty, IPA, this is for you!

Tap. Pours clear buttery amber with a small white head and some lacing. Aroma is almost undetectable, with notes of pine and citrus. Flavor is lightly sweet, lightly bitter, with orange and pine notes. Light bodied. Must have been a bit old.
Tap at the brewpub. Pours amber. Earthy, citric aromas. Med body. Citric/earth flavor with caramel. Dry. Moderately bitter.
I had this on draft at Monterey Coast Brewing. I thought that this was a nicely balanced IPA: good bitterness, but not a palate mauler. Good background malts.
Rating from 2005. Nette Mischung aus fruchtiger Bananennote und leichter Röstmalzigkeit, die auch erstaunlich herb verläuft. Sehr süffig mit langem Nachgeschmack. --> 11
Geruch leicht bananig-fruchtig, röstig, Hefe und Kork. Startet erst fruchtig um dann malzfruchtig, säuerlich-weinartig zu werden. Ebenso mit trocken-hefigen Schüben ablaufend. Geht so.
bottle. Cloudy dark brown colour, large beige head. Flavours of caramel, banana and chocolate. A very nice beer indeed!
The bottle looks good, the beer in the glass also. Starts mild, almost washy. Turns then yeasty, modest fruity. The finish is boring and too dry. Nothing special!

Bottle, 5.3%. Roasted aroma, perhaps smoked, or perhaps it is the banana note mixed with the roastedness. Cloudy dark brown colour. Small creamy head. The flavour is roasted, slightly vinous. A little ripe banana in the finish.
50 cL bottle. Pours hazy brown with a slowly collapsing white head. Estery wheat aroma, light roasted malt. Medium dry mix of esters and light toasted malt. Light wheaty note too. Ends medium dry.

Bottle (purchased at the brasserie): Chestnut-amber coloured, visible carbonation, firm off-white lacy head, both dark-fruity and citrus-fruity nose with a tinge of dark (roasted) malt; medium bodied, soft MF; chocolatey traces in the fruity-malty, slightly sourish finish. Pleasant dark Weizen....

(bottle) Cloudy, dark brown colour with a huge and slowly lacing light-beige foamy head. Dusty, light-sweet and slightly toasted wheat-malty aroma with light fruity notes of citrus and plums. Light-sweet, slightly acidic flavour, light to medium bodied with a lively carbonation. Slightly toasty and light fruity taste with a moderate wheat-character and shy notes of caramel; sweet-bitter yeasty and subtle fruity finish with light notes of cloves.

Bottled at Zur Frosch, Hof, Bavaria. Cloudy nut brown, creamy head. Restrained toffee/banana aroma. Medium sweet with clean, spritzy mouthfeel. Some light phenols and chocolate. Not at all as refreshing as their pale version.
"Another textbook beer, that falls just short of standout. Nice dry, roasted barley aroma with hints of chocolate and coffee. Dry, smooth mouthfeel, and a flavor to match the aroma. Very pleasant."

Tap at the brewery. Mahogany colored pour. Strong aroma of roasted malts and coffee. Taste is coffee, roasted malts, and dark chocolate. Light to medium body for a dry stout. Texture is smooth and creamy.
Draft @ the brewpub. Pours a dark brown black color with a small tan head. Has a roasted malty caramel and chocolate aroma. Roasted malty chocolate flavor. Has a roasted malty chocolate finish.

Black pour with a dense tan head. Intense metallic aroma, lots of roasted malt, and some dark chocolate. A bit of earth, a decent amount of coffee, and a mild sweetness. Tastes like a mouthful of pennies. Intense metal, roast, and and coffee flavors. A bit of dark chocolate, earth, and a mild bitterness.

Tap. Pours opaque black with a small creamy brown head that leaves great lacing. Aroma is light coffee, chocolate, tobacco. Flavor is about the same, medium sweet with minimal bitterness. Light bodied but creamy.
Tap at the brewpub. Pours black with a beige head. Burnt malt aroma. Med minus body. Flavor is smooth burnt malt with hints of chocolate. Almost dry.
I had this on draft at Monterey Coast Brewing. It’s creamy up front with a dry roasty finish. decent

Draft at the brewpub. Decent stout but their porter was better. Nose of coffee and caramel. Black with a medium glass lacing tan head. Flavor was chocolate, body very thin. Did have a nice thick head.
This beer has an extremely creamy mouthfeel, and even better they did NOT use nitrogen to dispense. A nice naturally creamy texture. Smooth roasted aromas and flavors. Easy to drink. Nice.

column2: San Luis Obispo, California, United States
column5: Draft @ the brewery. Pours a brown color with a small off-white head. Has a fruity weak roasted malty aroma. Fruity roasted malty caramel flavor. Has a fruity roasted malty caramel finish.

column2: San Luis Obispo, California, United States
column5: Brown colored pour with a khaki head. Caramel, toffee, and toasted malt up front. Followed by grassy, a spoiled chocolate smell, and a mild tartness. Some coffee and dark fruits, too. There’s a much stronger coffee flavor than anticipated, but it’s very acidic and unpleasant. Some caramel and toffee sweetness, grassy hops, chocolate, and a bitter finish.

column2: San Luis Obispo, California, United States
column5: Draught at the brewery. Dark chocolate and clean lightly roasted grains. On the dry side and more drinkable than the 6% ABV would make you think. Mild hops and light in body. Another easy drinker in the topless lineup.

column2: San Luis Obispo, California, United States
column5: Malty beer with not a lot of hop aroma/flavor. Dry finish. Very one dimensional and frankly quite boring.

column2: San Luis Obispo, California, United States
column5: Mild notes of banana/clove, I was expecting more. Smooth body. Dry flavor. Another one dimensional beer.

column2: San Luis Obispo, California, United States
column5: Dark in color. Lots of roasted malt aromas/flavors. Lightly acidic. Smooth body. Nice.
Ruby black with nice lacing. Nutty and some vegemite. Not too sweet. Ver nice.
Mild dark ale that leaves a fizz in the palate. Not a great deal of aroma or taste but has a smooth texture.

Cap come off and it seemed it was half for me and half for my kitchen bench; it just couldn’t wait to get out the bottle. Settles to be more head than beer, but this is quickly diminishing. A lovely russet chestnut in colour and bright as bright with minimal carbonation. Aroma of roasted hazelnuts, cocoa, sultanas and sweet toffee. Malt driven, earthy and very nutty in the mouth, though thin for body and just a little too prickly in carbonation. Light roasted grain note in back, a little tannic and metallic in the finish. Short in length, minimal hops present, lacking in complexity, and just a little dull. Ok, credit where credit is due it goes down with ease!(50cL, BB 15/06/12, Cellarbrations Kinross)
(this is a Schwarzbier,not a porter)black body with a light brown head.aroma and flavor mixes up nuts,smoke,roasted malts,and charcoal.medium mouthfeel,fairly solid brew.
Pours dark with a thick head. Aroma is of roasted malt. Slightly acidic. Easy drinking. Body is a bit on the light side for this style.

Draught@Black Door, Helsinki. Dark murky brown/amber colour, small off-white head. Aroma is fruity and grassy hops. Flavour is enormously dry, and contains bitter fruits and some grass. Extreme hopbomb, yet extremely wellbalanced and pleasant to drink. Some citrusy notes starts showing when the beer get a bit warmer.

On the X-Tap at the brewpub: Pours a dark orange/copper color with a smaller white head. Nice lacing. Nose is mild of citrus hops and sweetness. Taste is rich with citrus hops, maltiness, a little hint of spice, and the orange peel. Orange is easily detectable, but not offensive. Nice bitters in the trailer. When compared to it’s sibling, it comes up just short.
Presented quite lively but not infected. Rather malty and sweet brown ale with some nutty bitterness to counterbalance. All taken into consideration, I like this beer

Bottle. Hazy dark amber with white head. Aroma is sweet and strong in a very bad way. Just a bit of malt, some fruits and a lot of something that should not be there. Taste is bitter and unbalanced. Very odd and artificial.
Bottle @ Home. Pours light golden with a white head. Aroma and flavor of malt, caramel, light fruity hops. Medium body, lively carbonation. 110110
160312: tasted after BB date. Very dry and slightly hoppy aroma, Works heavy and sweet, sharp and very bitter. when it is said, it’s still a fine IPA.
Hazy orange with an off-white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel and light hoppy - fruit. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and light bitter finish. 160508
Bottle, 50cl. Pours a hazy and light copper beer with an offwhite head. The aroma is sulfur, and the beer is undrinkable. This beer clearly has a serious infection.
Colour is amber with a small creamy top. Aroma is malt and sulfur. Flavour is bitter and sulfur. Clearly infected.
Pours amber with a small beige head. Aroma is malt, sulfur and foxurine. Flavour is bitter and sulfur. Clearly infected.
Bottle. Amber body and a medium off white head. Bit weak hoppy aroma wih some caramel. Flavour is grassy and flowery but lacks complexity. Medium bodied.
clear brown, small white head. aroma is faint flowery, slight caramel. flaovr is very bitterhoppy, caramel, nice balanced, ends flowery hoppy.

Bottle - Lightly hazy amber body, white head; A little strange but quite pleasant sour dough rye bread aroma; Strange quite full body lightly sweet and a UK like bitterness; Dry bitter finish that has a strange yeasty touch to it as well. Drinkable but a quite strangely composed beer
Clear redish coppery body, white head. Aroma is caramelly malty with some medicinal and fruity hops. Flavour is strong malt, alcohol, berries and some yeast when warms up. Much alcohol.
soy sauce, raisin, banana, alcohol, earthy, toast, bread, hay, amber, cloudy, frothy, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, heavily sour, medium body, sticky, average carbonation, bitter, long finish,

750 ml bottle. From France. Courtesy of Brandman. Clear reddish amber colour with tiny off-white head. Belgian style yeast, fruits, sugar and alcohol in aroma. Flavour is malt, sugary sweetness, mild yeast and mild hops. Sugary fruit juice sweetness. Boring.
14.05.2011. 0,5l Can. Golden yellowcolour with white head. Aroma is malty with nice smooth bitterness. Strong beer with lots of alcohol.

Bottle 0.75 L. Dark golden body, with a small, fizzy, white head, mostly diminishing with virtually no lacing; low density of medium-sized bubbles. Light malty and hoppy aroma with spicy notes related to alcohol; maybe some hints of honey. Sweet flavour with some bitter notes. Light-to-medium body with a watery texture; flat carbonation; evident alcoholic warming in the finish.
bottle. Slightly unclear golden colour, large white head. Fruity with hints of honey, shy hopy in the finish.
Trovata una sera in lattina in un supermercato, pensavo seriamente ad un disastro. Invece si lascia bere ed ha anche un suo carattere...Buon corpo e maltosa.

Birra dal colore ambra – oro con schiuma fine e di colore bianco. Aroma di malto miele,caramello e note floreali e speziate . Ne consegue un’ aroma dolce che termina con una sottile amarezza. Nel finale rimane abbastanza in risalto soprattutto la dolcezza del malto con sottili toni di erbe e luppolo.

Bottle 75cl at Galeries Gourmandes Strasbourg. A clear yellow beer with very nice head and good lacing, carbonation is high. Smell is very hopy even dry hoping. Aroma is quite sweet, very malty and quite bitter, nice hops bouquet there is definitely dry hoping on this beer. Very difficult to detect that it was done with a lower yeast, finish is a bit abrupt with a spicy hops bitterness. Good beer, good body, pleasant but high in alcohol.

Corked bottle from Auchan, Marne La Valle, France. Pours a decent cloudy cheddar orange with a head that settles into what appears to be mold spore colonies atop the brew. Aroma is honey and orange, with a touch of sweet bread and carrot soup. Flavor is a dull, buttery vegetable honey with a finish of light honey biscuit and over-ripened orange. Watery on the tongue. Not bad, but one is sufficient.
Cask (handpump) at The Duck & Drake, Leeds, October 2006. A fairly pale bitter. Plenty of citric hops with some subtle resinous notes on the palate. Refreshing and pretty tasty for a 3.8% bitter.

On tap at PRNH Meibockfestival ’12, as Lentebier 6.5%. Murky golden orange colour, thick off white head. Aroma of yeast, flowers, light spicy, citrus, a bit sweet. Flavour is sweet, fruity, spicy, yeast, citrus, light malty, nice yeasty light citrus bitter finish. Medium bodied. Tasty.
On tap at 10de Meibockfestival. Cloudy orange with a beautiful, lacing offwhite head. Sweet and quite fruity aroma. Flavours of oranges, coriander and a hint of bananas.

Cask, 1/2 pint, hand-pulled at Bon Accord, Glasgow on 17 Apr 2017, coffee, chocolate aroma, very dark brown near black with a subtle ruby tint and thin beige head, milky, coffee flavour with earthy notes, creamy, sweet.
Cask at Waterloo Arms with Ian on the November Southampton Pub Crawl. Standard Guinness clone. Fulsome and tasty. A good everyday stout - nothing fancy, and there doesn’t need to be.

On the SilkTork Southampton through the looking glass tour. Cask handpull at The Waterloo Southampton. Black beer lasting tan head. Chocolate aroma roasted malt. Quite a decent dry Irish stout. Quite a dry finish. Good condition. My kind of stout.
Cask conditioned at a Wetherspoons. Dark brown with tan head. This was a sweetish, fruity beer with a slightly smoked background, some dark roasted maltiness some coffee. It’s fine.
Cask @ Barum Top Inn, Halifax. Almost black with a frothy head. Light roasted aroma and crisp in the mouth, the dryness in in the roasted flavou which is not very stated. .
light toasted,malty aroma,black, off white foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, light body, oily feel, soft carbonation, light bitter roasted finish.
Dark brown and clear. Has an off-white head. Aroma of roasted bread, faint sour notes too. Flavor starts light sweet, creamy and a bit dry. Faint laqurice.

Bottle from Rhythm & Booze, Ripon. Very deep brown ale with decent cream head. Quite sharp at first before bitter coffee finish. Quite a thin mouthfeel for a stout. Not the greatest example of the style.
50cl bottle from Rhythm & Booze, Doncaster. Thick off white head. Clear black pour. A nice smooth stout

Bottle, from Rhythm & Booze, Barton. Jet black, creamy and lasting pale beige and gentle condition. Muted sweet liquorice, a touch of creamy coffee and some roast barley in the nose, initial roasted notes in the mouth with a little burnt toast and some pleasant bittersweet coffee ground, slightly sweet in the finish with some gentle coffee developing into a roasted bitterness lingering at the end
Brew pub sampler. Clear caramel color pour. Mild hop-pine aroma. Simmering head with good carbonation and lacing. Caramel hops with a slight hop bitterness.

Sampler @ brewpub. Completely lucid macro-pale color. Not pretty, ugh. Aroma is lightly floral and macro-corny. Taste is so damn ordinary and plain. Light German maliness, just as plain as plain can get and really going for the "I am German so I hate Bud but I will drink this b/c its got Bavaria in the name and tastes so much better" but its really almost as crappy.

Sampler @ brewpub and ATOMIC it is. Black and big tan head. I am not a coffee fan but this has all the aspects I like about coffee. Deep rich burnt roast smacks you in the nose. Its the smell of coffee brewing and nothing else. Taste starts of light (think dry stout) and finishes with a lllooooooonnnngggg, light, dry sweet part of the espresso flavor. Medium coffee bitterness throughout. The best beer I had on my visit here.

The aroma is alcohol, grass, and rice. The appearance is almost clear with a light yellow tint to it. The flavor is like the aroma and subtle. The palate is thin and lightly oily with an alcohol finish. Overall it’s nice and easy.
This is a very light flavorful sake. Just a nice thin palate with mild flavors of rice and alcohol flavor. a mild grassy taste. This is a keeper.

At a tasting, thanks, smallish creamy bubbly head, cloudy brown color, aroma of brown bread, stale grains and wood, bready malty flavor with a hint of smoke and chocolate, very sour and probably infected, Drinkable but no more.

Bottle sample at a tasting at troubles’s place. Thanks Ory. Dark brown. Sour aroma of roast, olives (infection), yeast. Sourish flavor, infected, with roast, olives, chocolate, coffee, some fruits. Medium-bodied.

Appearance: color dark seemed to coke. With medium head, beige, slightly dense and of low persistence. Aroma: sweet, slightly hoppyness, with touches of the toasted malts, candy, vanilla and nutmeg. For the style, low presence of coffee and chocolate in the aroma. Flavor: presence of the toasted malts, something of chocolate and coffee. Low hoppyness. Reminiscences of light liquor. Palate: medium body of oily texture. Medium carbonation. Poor beer for the style. (sorry for my english)
Burnt brown amber, lots of lacing, clear pour. Very light for a stout, light roast, mild, some hop bitterness.

Big tan head and thick lacing. Aroma is lactose, faint roast with west coast floral hops. A relatively light bodu dominated by a piney/leafy hop flavor. At first taste this could have easily passed for an IPA (if I was blind folded). As it warms some of the stout characteristics come out, mild roast. Mouthfeel is slightly silky, light-medium bitterness throughout.
Draft at Cannery Row Brewing Monterey. Nose of caramel. Clear dark brown with a medium beige head. Flavor is caramel licorice and dark fruit.

While this definitely wasn’t the worst beer on tap at the brewery, this wasn’t really anything to get excited over. An aroma with fruity esters, light spice and a slight funkiness that I assume was from bad tap lines. Appearance was a dark orangish/red, cloudy with absolutely no head at all. I even tried numberous times to stir one up, but no luck. Mouthfeel was watery. Flavor was light fruits, some bubblegum, boiled veggies, with that odd funkyness rearing it’s head again. I struggled to make it through a pint of this. Ugh.

Cask. Amber colour, small beige head. Aroma is fruity, nutty, caramelly and a bit biscuity notes as well. Flavour is fruity, caramelly, nutty, mildly fudgelike notes as well as some resin to it as well.
Cask in the Golden Cross, Bromsgrove. An amber beer with an off white head. Slight toffee taste with some green fruit. A bit of a bitter citrus finish.
On cask at sun inn, stafford. Pours amber with stiff head. Quite a sweet bitter but it's well balanced. Nice drop
Mid-amber colour without a huge aroma. Generally the malt wins out but there is a sharp bitterness in there too. A nice pint but not a particularly distinctive one.
Dark amber colour with light white head. Chestnut and caramel smell and taste with malt and delicious sweet aftertaste. Went down easy and fast.

Cask handpull at The County Hotel, JDW, Ashford. Mid brown colour, lasting beige head. Good condition. Traditional brown bitter, decent malts, some sweetness, bit of caramel. Some soft hop sting,, bit of earth on finish. Very drinkable best bitter.

Cask conditioned handpump Moon On The Square JDW Northampton. An amber coloured beer with a tightish whitish head and lacing. Strawberry sweetness throughout in an average pretty ordinary beer which gives the impression of being brewed with boring ingredients. Definitely not special.
JDW Rochester. Refreshingly drinkable - up front juicy sweetness with citric highlights from the hops quickly rubbed with hop bitterness. Some woodiness. Brown sugar.
Cask at the Hope Tap (JDW), Reading. A rather plain and ordinary bitter; gold in colour with a scummy looking cream head; malty aroma; stewed malt flavoura and a rough, slightly spicy, hop finish.

Cask @ GBBF 2009. Pours a dark amber color with a small off-white head. Has a fruity malty caramel aroma with hints of toffee. Sweetish malty caramel flavor. Has a sweetish malty caramel finish with some bitterness in the aftertaste.

Clear light golden, no head. Nose of an assortment of fresh chiles. The flavor is crisp and semi light with a blonde ale backbone, but then a spicy wave of fresh chiles kicks in, with a wonderful roasted undertone, and a bit of capcasin heat. A touch spicy and peppery flavored but actually kinda nice. Not over the top in any one direction and very flavorful.

Slight Spice In The Aroma, Pours A Pale Yellow With A Think And Dissipating Head. Flavor Profile Has A Malty Sweetness With A Muddled Pepper Spice. The Anaheim I More Dominant Than Any Actual Green Chile Flavor. A Promising Beer, But A Let Down Overall.
Had as accompaniment to the pizza. The strong chili taste makes me want more right after finishing. Love this beer. Might be too spicy for some palates.

Sort of a greenish tint to this light yellow beer (could be my imagination). Aroma is fresh chili heat, with less roasted notes than expected. Imposed over a sweetish, uncomplicated malt background. Flavor is sweet with some fresh pepper bite, but again, little detectable roastiness. Fairly spicy/hot, but not distractingly so. This comes across as some peppers thrown into a simple golden ale. Not bad to drink, but also not terribly interesting.

22oz bomber shared by Tim. Awesome and simple beer. Aroma is strong peppers in your nose, just the way I like it. The flavor was much more restrained, not hot in the throat like I would like. Very simple basic lager and the peppers really died down. But the nose is fantastic. I could sniff it for a long time. Thanks Tim.

22 oz bottle purchased at Dillon Ridge Liquor in Dillon, Colorado. Pour is a light haze golden, with a smallish white head. Aroma is bright fresh clean green pepper with a bit of spicy hot pepper. Really smells like Anaheim, fresh and clean. The nose is mostly the peppers, not a whole bunch else. Taste is the peppers on top of a very simple toasted malt base. The peppers give a nice bright heat, then fade smoothly. Nice integration of the heat and vegetable of the pepper. As it warms, get a bit of a buttery finish, though does not detract too much from the pepper. Palate is light to medium bodied, un filtered mouth feel. This beer was all about the peppers, and it did that well.

Bomber from brewpub. Pours hazy yellow with a swiftly disappearing head. Super carbonated. Nose is full of green chiles and grass. Taste is pretty one dimensional, with the chiles hitting the palate softly at first, then giving a bit of a sting on the way down. Very carbonated and light body. Not a bad beer for what it is and will go well with the stir fry that’s on the stove now.

Bomber pours hazy golden/orange with small white head. Aroma is predominately roasted green chilies with slight sweet wheat. Taste is smooth chile flavors with sweet citrus and some slight heat on the finish. Wasn’t sure what to expect from this one but was pleasantly surprised. Pretty singular but decent and drinkable.

I’ve had this one on draft on the pub but most recently from a bottle brought back from CO. either way, it’s a light straw color with an average-sized white head and fine carbonation. aroma is intense, vibrant green chile with a slight grassy note as well as a hint of wheat/graham, the taste tends to chile as a top note but there’s a solid malt backing underneath that. this is one of the best chile beers I’ve had, and pairs great (not surprisingly) with chili and cornbread.

Pours a clear light straw yellow. Aroma of roasted green chile’s . Flavor is green chile with a slight hint of wheat. Has a nice lingering burn in the back of the throat and mouth. At first I think this to be an odd combination, but find it to be fascinating and wonderful tasting. I love Hatch Green Chile’s from Santa Fe. This is a liquid version.
On tap at Brewpub Pours out a nice amber no head. A light hop. Some citrus hop on this one. Pretty light no bad.
Hazy light amber,small beige head.Light malt nose. Nice malt hop balance, brief hop finish. Somewhat gassy

Tap @ Brewpub: Copper, light head and nice lacing. Nose of fresh pine and citrus, grassy grapefruit and sweet sugar daddy caramel sweetness. A bit of sugar there. The flavor is nice and balanced, dry hops and caramel residuals balance together. Finishes clean and tasty. Good pale ale.
On tap at the BrewPub. Hazy light amner. Small off wiye head. Nice bright hoppy aroma. Balanced flavor withg plenty of crisp citrusy hops. Light and sharp. Very nice.

Draft at brewpub: Poured a light hazed golden orange with a medium sized white head and nice, thick lacing. Nose is citrus and piney, a little malty sweetness. Plenty of hops for the American Pale with citrus and pine notes. Sweet from malt and a little dryness in the finish.

This is a backlog rating from 2010 on the bus at RBSG to the MBGSF, from notes. When I had this beer it was average to below average for the style and not something I wanted to have again or I just didn't get back to my notes because of my technology at the time, work and/or family. Words to describe this beer are roasted malts, chocolate, slightly acidic coffee, thin.
Draft. Roasty coffee and lactic chocolate aroma. Black brown with a tan nitro head. Sweet lactic chocolate and light roasty flavor. Light body, moderate carbonation. Overall, relatively thin.

On tap at the brewpub. Pours a dark brown with a thin tan head. Creamy chocolate and roasted malt aromas. Roasted malt flavors dominate with coffee, chocolate, and burnt sugar notes. A bit thin on the palate, but overall a good beer.

Growler on the RBSG bus. Deep black pour.. The nose is quite sweet and milky. A little bit earthy and quite cocoaish. Lingering roast behind the milk chocolate. Soft, slightly fruity with a little kiss of tartness on the back. It’s a pretty decent simple stout.
Thin cola-like beer with lots of ice tea, caramel and some fruitiness. Meh.

Growler on RBSG bus - brown pour. arouma is milk chocolates,. Lightly roasted malts and coffee grinds. Light body with low carbonation. Nice creamy caramel and toffee candy. My kind of beer. thanks for sharing.

Growler on the bus to the Michigan Brewers Festival during RBSG. Pours a chocolate brown with a thin beige head. Chocolate and coffee, vanilla on the nose. Medium bodied, but thinner than I’d like. Tannic malt and chocolate sweetness on the finish.

On the bus at RBSG. Pours a deep brown (almost black) with an espresso swirl head. The aroma is awesome with plenty of toasty, chocolate, and coffee notes and a fair amount of sweetness. The flavor nails lactose sweetness and pairs it with a good roasty coffee and vanilla character. The beer is very straightforward but very good.
Growler on the RBSG bus. Chocolaty, sweet, but with a sour edge, very creamy and smooth. Decent sweet stout but a bit too thin and rather bland.

Thanks to someone on the RBSG bus! (Guyinchicago perhaps?) Really nice cream stout. Enough roastiness. Aroma has hints of sweaty ass crack though. A little watery, a little more carbonation could be nice, though it was from a growler so I can’t be to hard on it.

Lost Coast is good with fruit beers and this one is no exception. On draft, it came a nice light cloudy gold color with a light purple tinge with an off-white head. Looked much like a hefe in the glass. Moderate lacing in my pint glass. Nose of cherry. Mouthfeel was very smooth and refreshing. Flavor was of cherries also, with a little vanilla malt taste. Finish was very light. For a fruit beer this is very laid back, and remarkably refreshing for the type probably because unlike a lot of this style it is not too sweet. I took home a growler and will sample again tomorrow.
Fruity and juice aroma. Small head, clear rose gold. Taste was fruity sweet, with light bitterness at the beginning. Light body, a bit watery.
I had this at Global Brew. Pours amber with a off white head. Taste strawberry, sweet, light. I thought this was ok. I could drink this again. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Tap at California Brew fest. Pours light amber with a transient head. Strawberry aroma. Med body. Flavor is very berry over a little wheat in the finish.

Pint pour of lightly pinkish yellow with full finger white head. Nose is sweet and sugary. Some strawberry and other berry notes, but mostly sugar. Flavor is a little more on the strawberry side, but not great. Kinda grassy-ish... not memorable...

Draft… Mostly clear dirty-orange ale with a small, creamy, white head. Fantastic retention. Fruity, grainy aroma – lots of strawberry and pale malts. Medium-bodied and lightly creamy with zippy carbonation. The flavor is sweet with lots of strawberry, but seems a touch artificial. Finishes up much the same – sweet and fruity. Very little wheat character throughout. Still fairly enjoyable.
Nice strawberry wheat. Red pour with pink head. Not overbearing. If frankenberry were a beer this would be it. And frankenberry is good ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Brief rate from memory: on tap at Proof. Light berry aroma. Sugar cereal type sweet berry taste. Light and tasty enough. A whole pint of it was a bit much for my tastes though.

Pours a pink hued amber on tap with thin off white head and little to no lacing. Aroma of strawberries and slight hint of wheaty yeast. Taste is like strawberries and captain crunch. Good when you use loopy 3 olives and make it a bomb, otherwise its meh.

Tallahassee, Fl - Fermentation Lounge - on tap. Dark murky orange leading to ruby red, soft white head. Enticing strawberry shortcake aroma, hint of yeast. Flavor has that same strawberry shortcake essence to it with a hint of rhubarb sourness. Nice and sweet, but not to the point of cloying.Thick enough mouthfeel, not as girly tasting as I thought it would be - pleasantly surprised.
6/18/12. On tap. Hazy amberish pour with a nice khaki head. Mild strawberry aroma. Bigger sweet strawberry flavor with lingering wheat and citrus. Eh

column4: Privatbrauerei Scherdel Hof (Brau Holding Int. - Heineken)
column5: Bottle. Lightly sweet corn malt and grass hops aroma. Clear golden yellow color with moderate head. Sweet corny malt and moderately strong herbal bitterness. Strange - not a fan of the non-descript bitterness.

column4: Privatbrauerei Scherdel Hof (Brau Holding Int. - Heineken)
column5: Bottle 50cl. Clear medium yellow color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly diminishing, white head. Aroma is moderate malty, grain, cabbage water, vegetable. Flavor is light to moderate sweet, light light bitter and sour with a average duration. Body is light to medium, texture is watery, carbonation is soft. [20081129]

column4: Privatbrauerei Scherdel Hof (Brau Holding Int. - Heineken)
column5: Bottle 50 cl. A clear yellow beer with a small, white head. Light flower accents in the nose. Medium body, light malt accents and a very, very dry finish with some bitterness. 291108

column4: Privatbrauerei Scherdel Hof (Brau Holding Int. - Heineken)
column5: 50 cL bottle, courtesy of Papsoe/Ungstrup. Pours clear and golden yellow with a diminished white head. Mild malty and vague hoppy aroma. Mild citrusy hoppy flavoured with a mild/vague malt base. Light bitter finish.

column4: Privatbrauerei Scherdel Hof (Brau Holding Int. - Heineken)
column5: bottle. Clear pale yellow, large white head. Malty, hoppy with a nice touch of citrus fruit. Not as boring as many other Diätbiere.

column4: Privatbrauerei Scherdel Hof (Brau Holding Int. - Heineken)
column5: Bottle, 4.9%. Clean citric aroma. Clear shiny yellow colour. Very small white head. The flavour is OK malty to start with, has a good citrus note. Finishes quite dry, but still clean.

column4: Privatbrauerei Scherdel Hof (Brau Holding Int. - Heineken)
column5: Bottled. A light golden beer with beige head. The aroma is sweet with straw and a touch of citrus. The flavor is thin with notes of cardboard and light notes of malt and straw. The finish is dry and lightly.

column4: Privatbrauerei Scherdel Hof (Brau Holding Int. - Heineken)
column5: (bottle) Clear, pale golden colour with a short foamy white head. Light sweet malty nose with light hints of butter and shades of of herbal hops. Medium-bitter flavour, light bodied, moderate carbonation. Soft malty base with herbal notes; quite dry and a bit papery malty finish with a good dose of herbal hops, especially in the aftertaste. One of the better low carb beers.

column4: Privatbrauerei Scherdel Hof (Brau Holding Int. - Heineken)
column5: Bottle: Faint malty nose with a delicate but distinctive hoppy nose, straw golden coloured, quickly collapsing white head; quite dry bitter (fruity) flavour, light bodied to watery; short bitter-citrusy finish. A quite nice example of that odd style.......

column4: Privatbrauerei Scherdel Hof (Brau Holding Int. - Heineken)
column5: An average at best Landbier. Nice light color, Bread aroma, but an pretty industrial taste...

column4: Privatbrauerei Scherdel Hof (Brau Holding Int. - Heineken)
column5: Undated bottle. Clear orange with a large-bubbled white head. Paper starch aroma with sweaty / game-y notes, somewhat mildew-like. Medium-light body, worty raw caramel malt flavor profile, semi-sweet with low bitterness. Watery copper-flavored finish. Gross.

column4: Privatbrauerei Scherdel Hof (Brau Holding Int. - Heineken)
column5: 0,5 l bottle cereal, herbs, bread, dark golden - amber color, clear, frothy, white foam, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body, oily feel, slick feel, soft carbonation,

column4: Privatbrauerei Scherdel Hof (Brau Holding Int. - Heineken)
column5: Trübes bernsteinfarbenes Zwickel mit geringem Schaum. Geruch hopfig grasig, Geschmack angenehm herb, minimal säuerlich, süffig.

column4: Privatbrauerei Scherdel Hof (Brau Holding Int. - Heineken)
column5: Amber colour, white head. Aroma of pale malts, green apples. Flavour is light malty, light plastic, light bready, light grassy.

column4: Privatbrauerei Scherdel Hof (Brau Holding Int. - Heineken)
column5: Draught @ Scherdel Bajor Sörözõ és Kolbászda, Bp. Clear copper amber body with a medium sized off-white head and soft carbonation. Mild sweet malty aroma with caramel, toast and dough underpainted by hops, syrupy, slick mouthfeel. Medium dry, bittersweet finish with nuts and spices. Enjoyable.

column4: Privatbrauerei Scherdel Hof (Brau Holding Int. - Heineken)
column5: It’s dark-golden with a creamy, white head, and the aroma has notes of bread, malt, light flower and a hint of celluloses. The flavour has a light to moderate sweetness and notes of bread, malt, flower, caramel and a hint of butter. The finish is dry.

column4: Privatbrauerei Scherdel Hof (Brau Holding Int. - Heineken)
column5: The bottle looks simple, but good. The beer in the glass zippy, huge head. Starts mild, hoppy-grasy, more and more spicy. A bit moldy for a short moment, a bit sweet. Finish well balanced, spicy. Good landbier!

column4: Privatbrauerei Scherdel Hof (Brau Holding Int. - Heineken)
column5: Bottled. An amber beer with a white head. The aroma has notes of malt and bread. The flavor is sweet with notes of malt and bread, leading to a lightly bitter finish.

column4: Privatbrauerei Scherdel Hof (Brau Holding Int. - Heineken)
column5: Bottle. Sweet caramel malt and hay hops aroma. Clear amber color with moderate head. Sweet caramel malt and mildly bitter hay hops flavor. Medium body. Very nice beer.

On tap at the Eccentric Cafe. Aroma comes clean with a fresh malt biscuit and watered grain aroma, behind a bit of mineral salt, toast and ester notes. Pours in a pale amber gold, clothed in a soapy bath of off-white. Flavor comes in with nips of honeyed sweetness, rich wheat sugars, calming British yeast esters and a cue of full flavored hop balance. Nicely refreshing and dry, with an easy drinking finish. Smacks a touch in calm spice. Delicious all around and with a tooth of delectable alcohol.

12oz on tap at the Eccentric Cafe - Aroma is subtle toasted caramel malts followed by crisp citrus hops. Pours dark copper with a medium head and good lacing. Flavor is pine and grapefruit hops first followed by the caramel malt for a smooth finish. Palate is crisp and creamy. Pretty tasty stuff.

very well done...on tap at bells....reddish copper body with medium off-white head..aroma is of toasted malts, light caramel, and grassy hops..flavor is as expected, a largely earthy backbone that gives rise to the moderately bready qualities..finishes somewhat dry and a touch bitter...very grassy and piney, and very quaffable
Draughts at the Cafe. Pours copper with an off white head. Toasty aroma with caramel undertones. Medium body and bitterness. Not bad, but not at the top of American-brewed bitters.

On tap @ the brewpub: Pours a clear ruddy copper with an off white head. Aroma, earthy notes, caramel, and nutty. Flavor, nutty caramel malts up front, some brown sugar, with a roasty dry bitterness on the finish.

On tap. Pours a clear light copper color with a small off white head. Aroma is toasted malts, floral hops, and grain. Flavor is malt, pine, grapefruit, and grains. Palate is medium bodied, medium carbonation, finishes bitter. Decent stuff.

On tap at the Eccentric Cafe. Clear copper body, thin off-white head. Toasty aroma with potent herbal hops. Cerealy, biscuity body with Cheerios notes, pierced by sharp, herbal, piney hops. More assertive than most bitters, fresh-tasting with good complexity. Nice.

(100cl swing top bottle) Hazy, orange colour with a tiny frothy white layer. Yeasty, light-sweet, quite worty, greenish aroma with light notes of hops. Yeasty-bitter and sweet-worty flavour, light to medium bodied and a bit flat on carbon. Sweetish malty and yeasty-bitter finish with a shy hoppy touch from behind. Incomplete brew.

Bügelverschlußflasche 1000ml (purchased at the brewery): Hazy, quickly diminishing white head, golden coloured; tart yeasty, a bit estery nose with a touch of barnyard and "green" wort, oaky hops in the wings; light sweetish-bitter flavour, a bit sourish; tart, a bit metallic and bitter finish. No pleasure..........

Can, 50cL, 4.2%. Home. A clear golden yellow beer ; few bubbles ; big white head, medium retention. Light cereal, herbs, metallic. Light sweet and bitter. Light body, thin watery texture, flat, light light herbal finish. Overall, well the score says it all... Poor.
.5l can found in Sarajevo, 4.2% alcohol. Really not so bad, considering other lagers to be found in region. Light, sweet, grainy. Smooth, nothing horribly wrong here. a bit sweet-sour and cloying.
Golden beer with a thin head Light mildly hoppy nose. Thin watery texture and not very much beer flavor.
Can 50cl, name of the can is Kingsbrau. A clear yellow beer without any smell. What a poor beer, no aroma, no hops, watery, metallic, very boring, nothing to try again.
Can. golden colour with a white head. Aroma is fruit, malt, grain. flavour is fruit, malt, hay, hint of hop, grain. Thin beer.

Can, courtesy of MiP. A clear, pale golden beer topped by a small, off-white head. Grainy nose with some fruityness. Quite papery. Grainy, papery flavor with some fruits, quite low on bitterness, and not much of a finish. Thin to medium body, dry. I have a suspicion this is a discount beer... 091024

Can 500ml. Clear light yellow color with a small to average, frothy, fair lacing, fully diminishing, white head. Aroma is light moderate malty, grain, grain - raw fruit. Flavor is light moderate sweet and light bitter with a average duration. Body is light to medium, texture is watery, carbonation is soft, finish feel is light metalic. [20091024]

If there’s one thing as a beer connoisseur I enjoy, there’s nothing else in this world I find more appealing than a beer with "budget" in its name! So I buy this thing and chill it for a day, and it pours just okay - some head, some bubbling, okay yellowish colour. Smells vaguely like wet bread and carbonation, but honestly not a whole lot of aroma going on here. Same with the taste-it’s like carbonated water with a lemon twist. Okay breadiness. Very weak taste, but mayhaps that’s what you want, as at 4.2% alcohol it can work well as a "getting drunk" cheap lager. It won’t work as an enjoyable experience, however.
Can, 4.2%. Clear yellow colour. Distinct bitterness, quite clean. A bit of papery malt. Better than expected.
Clear golden with a tiny white head. Malty aroma with diacetyl and grainy notes. Flavour was grainy with diacetyl and butter. Finished sweet.
Heller Getreidestart, dazu würzge helle Malznoten, ohne die oft störende Süße. Das Bier bleibt auf diesem Level, zwar etwas monoton aber dennoch nett. Kurzer Abgang. 9/9/12/11/10/11
It’s golden with a huge, creamy head. The aroma has notes of malt, fruit and alcohol. The flavour is sweet with notes of malt, fruit and alcohol, especially in the finish. IMO it’s a bit monotonous.

Bottle. [Courtesy of Papsoe, another great tasting session] Average fizzy white head that mostly lasted. Good display of lacework. Clear flat looking body with a yellow color. Aroma of grain, fruit, citrus and bread and caramel. Medium bodied with an average carbonation and maybe hint of alcohol. Light sweet malty flavor. Bread like sweet finish. Quit nice. 27-07-07
Bottle. Clear golden coloured with a white head. Sweet aroma of malts, caramel and rye bread. Sweet flavour of malts, caramel, rye bread and hops. Hoppy finish.
Bottled. A golden beer with a disappearing white head. The aroma is sweet malty with notes of caramel and a touch of alcohol. The flavor is sweet malty with notes of caramel and bread.

(Bottle 33 cl) Courtesy of MoritzF. Pours a clear, deep golden with a dense, white head leaving laces. Sweetish, malty nose. Rather full body with lots of sweet malt. Some alcohol in the finish without being too hot. No real bitterness though. A nice one. 270707
Bottled. Deep golden coloured. Big malty and bready aroma. Sweetish malty flavour. Soft mouthfeel. Some hops and alcohol notes in the finish. Well balanced and pleasant.
Bottle, 7.5%. Slightly rough, peppery aroma. Clear dark golden colour. Big, semi-stable head. The flavour is peppery and fruity with some paper. Fat mouthfeel. OK standard Bock.

(33cl bottle) Clear, golden colour with a small, foamy, slightly yellow-coloured head. Moderately sweet, grainy nose with a subtle citousy hoppy blend. Light-sweet flavour, malt-accented, grainy taste with light notes of honey; medium bodied, smooth on carbon; sweet-bitter, malty finish with a fairly good hops presence. Decent one.

Bottle (33cl, purchased at the brewery’s own "bottle-shop") Deep golden coloured with a small, lacing head; sweetish, honeyish, but also "oaky" hoppy aromas detectable; solid sweet-bitter flavour, medium bodied; quite "full" sweet-bitter finish with some distinctive "oaky" hoppy notes. A well crafted, well balanced Bock.......
Poured from a bottle. Light clear golden color, medium short lived white head. Smells like crystal malts. Medium body with a musky flavor and a light finish. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

500ml bottle [as "Geburtstags-Bier">. Clear, yellow-ish golden colour with average, frothy, half-way lasting, minimally lacing, white head. Grainy, strawy aroma, floppy bitter hoppy overtones. Taste is monotonously bitter hoppy, strawy, very subtle grainy sweetness, minimally soapy. A turn-off.
Bottle Form beerhuntet111: Pale golden color, low white head. Malty and grassy aroma. Flavor is also malty/grainy, grassy hops.

Heller, hopfig herber Beginn mit erhöhter Karbonisierung, dumpf. Spritzig, süffig, dunkel würziger Hintergrund. Trocken herber, mild getreidiger Abgang. Nett, wenn auch schnell vergessen. 10/9/9/9/8/9

(bottle) clear deep golden colour with a frothy off-white head. aroma of straw and caramelized malts, with some notes of herbal hops, candle wax, green apple and some light cinnamon. flavour is mostly gently roasted malts and caramel, slightly starchy, with a light hint of pistachios, some hazelnut purée and a semi-dry ethanolic finish. medium-bodied with average carbonation.
Pours a golden color with a decent sized head. Taste is sweet malt, caramel and bread.

Flasche (50 cl), erstanden im Klosterladen des Karmelitenklosters St. Theodor in Bamberg. Alkoholgehalt (5,2 %) und Etikett (dunkelblau) entsprechen dem "Jubiläums-Festbier", nur daß hier über "Festbier" in feiner Schrift nicht mehr "Jubiläums", sondern "Keller" steht. Dürfte demnach kein neues Bier sein, sondern nur ein neuer Name für die alte Brühe. - Orangegelb, feinporiger weißer Schaum, klar (obwohl lt. Etikett "unfiltriert"). - Nase breit malzsüß mit Karamel, süßer Frucht, leicht fuseliger Note und Anflügen von minderwertigem Hopfen. - Im Antrunk sirupartige Süße und schwache pikante Säure. Bei Erwärmung kommen üble Aromen wie von zerkochtem Kohl und Erbrochenem dazu. Stark rezent, eher dünn im Mund. Wenig Körper. Schwach dumpf-bitterer Abgang; unangenehm säuerlich-herber Nachtrunk. Hopfenaromen fehlen völlig. - Dieses „Festbier“ ist leider ganz und gar nicht geeignet, ein Fest zu verschönern: das stümperhafte Aromengemisch ist hart an der Grenze zum Widerwärtigen. Dann lieber Mineralwasser ...

Bottled. An unclear orange beer with an orangey head. The aroma is sweet with notes of fruit and wheat. The flavor is sweet with a slight acicidy underneath, and notes of malt, straw, and wheat, leading to a dry finish.
The bottle looks a bit simple for a festbier, the beer in the glass is okay. Starts sourish and dry, the finish is weeker, almost washy. Should be spicier. Not so good!

Bottle. Light sour, light flowery, light sweat. Orange body, foamy-frothy white head, normal sized. Light acidic and light sour, short duration. Rather light body, light watery, soft carbonation. Nothing special.
Cloudy golden colour with a white head. Malty, grainy sweet and light fruity with notes of hay. Malty, light caramel and grainy sweet flavor

(Bottle 50 cl) Courtesy of MoritzF. Hazy golden with a tall, dense, white head. fresh and malty nose with a fruity touch. Medium body, fresh maltiness and some lightly tart vitamin C notes. The finish is dry. 191207
Bottle. A hazy golden beer with a big off-white head. The aroma is of yeast, spices and corn. the taste is sweet malty, straw, spices and citrus. Medium body with a dry finish.
Poured from a bottle. Clear golden color, small white head. Musky grain aroma. Light body with a sweet wheat flavor and a mild finish. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

500 ml bottle. Pours a veiled yellowish peach with a short lived white head. Aroma is peach, grass, faint pepper. Flavor is lots of peach, apricot, banana, clementine and pineapple. Finish is lemon, grass, peppermint. Lingering peach and pear. Light to medium body, velvety mouthfeel and average carbonation.

3.1lt mini-keg from ALDI into Weizen glass. Aroma of cream, bananas and spice. Hazy amber beer with large white head. Medium body, easy drinking. Finish is like the nose, only less so. Standard Hefe, refreshing and delicious without being exceptional.

Sweetish-fresh, sourish hints. Yeasty body without too much banana or clove. Hints of sourness that makes it easy to dring, but I miss a nice yeasty smoothness. The aftertaste is medium, fresh-yeasty, hints of unripe pears, very interesting. Not bad and thirst-quenching.
Bottle: Aroma of wheat, light sourly, yeasty, citrus, spices, hints of banana. Yellow color, creamy white head. Flavor is fresh, yeasty, fruity, sourly, banana, citrus. Light bitter end. Quite good.
Cloudy golden with a good head. Spicy banana aroma. Noticeable clove flavours with refreshing fruit. Refreshing and well- made.

500ml bottle. Hazy golden colour with average, frothy, half-way lasting, white head. Wheaty and yeasty aroma, hints of lemon. Taste is wheaty, minimally yeasty spicy, hints of lemon; way overcarbonated.
500ml Flasche. Ins Glas ergießt sich ein trübes goldgelbes Bier mit schöner Schaumkrone. Geruch hefig, fruchtig, Citrus. Geschmack hefig fruchtig, bananig, leicht säuerlich fruchtig, erfrischend.

Bottle. Light golden, hazy, small to average and fully diminishing head. Light to moderate, malty – lightly wheaty and lightly sweetish aroma, faint fruitiness and light banana, light notes of metal. Body is light to medium, malty – lightly wheaty and lightly sweetish flavor, faint fruitiness and light banana. Finish is short to average, malty – lightly wheaty and dryish - lightly sweetish, faint banana and fruitiness, faint metal. Light-bodied hefeweizen with notes of metal in the finish - not too sweet though.
bottle from Bierzwerg. Cloudy pale yellow, creamy white head. Wheaty and yeasty with a fruity bouquet (citrus, tropical fruit, banana).
bottle bb3/19 thanks Roman chiara dorata leggera velatura buona schiuma buona persistenza delicata amaro medio piuttosto morbida un po cereale
Mild herber Beginn mit metallischem Einschlag. Geringe Würzigkeit, süffig, langweilig. Spritzig, zunehmende Intensität, mittellanger Abgang. Noch okay. 8/8/7/8/9/7
Bottle, thanks Axel! Nose is sweet grains, citrus, bread. Palate is thin grainy citrus, orange. Bitter finish. Very standard helles.
Poured from a bottle. Clear light yellow color, medium white head that is short lived. Humid basement aroma. Light body with a flavorless metallic finish. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

(bottle) slightly opalescent golden colour with a frothy white head. aroma of tobacco and floral hops, slightly perfumed, with a hint of gently buttered malts and some dust. flavour is mostly straw and herbal hops, quite metallic, with some notes of starchy malts and a light-bitter finish. medium-bodied with average carbonation.

As Karmeliter Hell. Minikeg from Aldi. Pale gold. white head. Crackery aroma with herbal and some lemony notes. Grainy, slightly biscuity and not all that sweet with herbs and a decent bitter kick. Slightly metallic. Not bad.

zapach s³odowy, lekko chlebowy i herbatnikowy, trochê kwiatów, zio³a i lekkie roœliny. kolor s³omkowy, piana bia³a, drobna œrednio obfita i œrednio trwa³a, ³adnie koronkuje. w smaku doœæ pe³ne, choæ przy tym lekkie, s³odowe, lekka kukurydza i chleb, wyraŸnie zio³owe, czyste. goryczka wyraŸna, zio³owa, czysta, klasyczna. nasycenie wysokie

500ml bottle. Barely clear, yellow-ish, pale golden colour with small to average, frothy, half-way lasting, minimally lacing, white head. Cautiously grainy, strawy aroma with a spicy touch of hay, a fresh grassy hop note a well. Taste is pale malty, fresh, bitter hoppy overtones, minimally tangy. OK for the style.
50 cl bottle @ Timo A. Pours clear golden color with a small head. Faint hay and grain on the nose, some pale malts also. Grainy, grassy and slightly malty flavor. Bitter palate. Simple. 2313
500 ml bottle. Thanks Timo A. Pours a golden colour with a small head. Aroma of herbs, grains and some citrus. Flavour of citrus, high grassy bitterness, grains and bread. Light bodied. Refreshing.
