Bottled. A light yellow beer with a thin white head. The aroma has notes of lemon. The flavor is artificially sweet and dominated by lemon.
Bottled at PBF. Very pale yellow, miniscule head. Buttery Sprite with caramel behind. Very sweet with sugar and ink. The finish has burning saccharine.
Bottled. Pale yellow colour, small white head. Aroma is lemon and mild malty notes along with carsboard. Flavour is lemon and a lot of saccharineish sweetness.

Bottle from the Doemens stash. Deep copper with a nice lasting head. Nice clean, rich malty aroma with light caramel. Clean caramel flavors with a nice toasty malt flavor and light hops. Medium body. Solid malty märzen.

(bottle, with thanks to Stefan!) Hazy, orange colour with a dense and minimal off-white foamy head. Sweet and slightly yeasty malt aroma with honey, herbal hops and a rural touch of barnyard. Sweet and slightly bitter flavour, well rounded malty and bready taste with subtle fruity notes; soft, almost creamy mouthfeel; medium-dry, sweet malty with a light but nevertheless aromatic, balancing herbal hoppy bitterness. A goodie.

Bottle (thanks to Quack-Duck !): Slightly hazy, deep golden coloured, rather big and firm rocky head; sweet-grainy and aromatic hoppy nose with an oregano-like touch; moderate bitter-sweet flavour, creamy MF, medium bodied; stronger - slightly alcoholic - malty-bitter finish with a touch of almonds. A well made, well rounded brew....

bottle, bought at the brewery. The brewery was founded in 1386, the beer’s name is Burggeist (ghost of the castle), as the biggest castle ruin in the Bavarian forest is in Runding. The beer has a beautiful amber colour and a large fluffy head. Nose: malty, notes of caramel and fruit. Fruity and malty flavour, only slightly hoppy. Hints of caramel and roasted malt. Soft water, very nice palate. I really liked this one.
50cl bottle from the brewery. A clear golden beer with a white head. Aroma of mild spicy and floral hops, pale malt, herbs. Taste of moderate spicy hops, pale malt, herbs, floral hops, flowers. Good!

"Schloßbrauerei Runding Spezial", Flasche von Edeka, Chamerau. - Helles Goldbraun, klar. - In der Nase kräftiges brotiges Malz, Karamel, Waldhonig, dezente kräuterige Herbe und zart faulige Noten wie von überreifem Obst. - Antrunk breit brotig malzig mit flau karamelliger Süße aber ohne die nötige Herbe. Anklänge an grüne Äpfel; zarte faulig-ranzige Noten. Durchschnittlich rezent, vollmundig, leicht mineralisch. Im Abgang viel zu knappe Herbe. Schwach dumpf-ranziger Nachgeschmack. - Malzbreites aber sehr schwach gehopftes Export mit leichten Fehlaromen. Gefällt mir nicht so recht.

Bottle circulated on the buss on the German beer tour 2014. Fine, lasting off white head. Clear solid yellow color. Small aroma but clean. Malty and well fermented. Small biterness nd nice drinkabillity.
Pours clear and golden yellow with a small white head. Aroma is cornish and slight grassy. Sweet malty, light mouldy and cornish.
Schaum fällt schnell zusammen. Malziger Geruch mit grünen Äpfeln. Ganz ganz leicht Gemüse. Bisschen karamellig. Kaum bitter.

It’s golden with a creamy, white head. The aroma has notes of butterscotch, malt, bread and flower. The moderately sweet flavor has pretty much the same notes as the aroma, and the finish is slightly dry.

Bottle 500ml. @ home on the terrace. Clear medium golden orange yellow colour with a large, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white to white head. Aroma is moderate to light heavy malty, straw, toasted, sweet malt, light caramel. Flavour is moderate to heavy sweet and light bitter with a average to long duration, straw, sweet malt, toffee notes. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20110929]

(bottle, provided by Quack-Duck) Hazy, golden colour with a beautiful and persistent foamy white head. The aroma has got a lot of rural character: slightly sweet barnyardy and buttery malty nose with a touch of honey and aromatic herbal hops. Balanced malty and herbal hoppy taste, slightly bready with notes of honey; almost medium bodied; malty, slightly bitter and herbal hoppy finish. Quaffable Export/Spezial with rural Landbier character (30.06.07).

Bottle (diky pìkne, Quack-Dacku!): Golden slightly hazy, firm, rocky whitehead; deep malty and distinctive oaky (Tettnang) hoppy nose; robust sweet-bitter flavour, medium-bodied, smooth MF; a bit vinous and fruity, but mainly bitter-sweet finish. A gorgeous Helles........

bottle, bought at thze brewery. Golden yellow colour, nearly amber. Medium-sized head. Very fruity and malty nose, full of character. Fruity and malty taste with hints of roasted malt and hops. Hoppy finish and malty/fruity aftertaste.

50cl bottle from the brewery. A clear golden beer with a small white head. Aroma of moderate sweet grainy malt and straw. Taste of straw, moderate sweet grainy malt, buttery notes, soft metallic hops.
Bottle from Beerhunter111, thanks! Blonde. Bready, buttery aroma and flavor. Floral. Diacetyl. Orange. Medium bodied. Sweetish.
It’s golden with a creamy head. The aroma has notes of malt, bread, straw and the slightly sweet flavor has the same notes with addition of a little fruit. The finish is dry.

(bottle, courtesy of Quack-Duck) Almost clear, greenish golden colour with a foamy white medium-sized head. Slightly sweet grainy malt aroma, honey-fruity with light notes of herbal hops. Light-bitter flavour, light bodied with a soft carbonation. Light grainy, slightly chalcky taste with light to moderate herbal notes; dry and slightly bitter finish with a light hoppy touch. Okay.

Bottle (thanks to the Lake of Constance): Golden coloured, quite firm mid-sized head with a little lace; moderate sweetish-grainy and a bit grassy hoppy nose; moderate sweet-bitter flavour, light to medium bodied; soft, short bitter-sweet finish. O.K. Bier..........
bottle, bought at the brewery. Intensive hoppy nose. Well-balanced beer, hoppy and malty. Rather hoppy, but not bitter at all. Medium malty, not sweet; rather dry finish.
50cl bottle. A clear golden beer with a white head. Aroma of spicy hops and malt, straw. Taste of strong grainy and spicy malt, moderate bitter hops, nothing special.
Bottle from Beerhunter111, thanks! Pale golden color. Floral, bready aroma and flavor. Hint of orange. Full bodied. Pleasant and fairly powerful helles.

Aroma of grain, malts and corn. Pours crystal clear, pale golden color with a big white head that fades instantly. The taste is starting off quite sweet, but it fades into ... less sweet. Nothing more really. A touch of pale malt. It’s simple. Watery texture, smooth mouthfeel, soft carbonation.

Very clear straw color with a small spritzy head. Aroma clean and almost nondescript, with barely noticeable grainy notes. Taste clean and grainy, very very light, and quite refreshing. I can imagine drinking this by the liter on a hot summer’s day.
Bottle at home. Pours yellow color, white head. Aroma and taste are malty and sweet, bit fruity, average beer, but easy drinkable.

Cellar clean-up. Bottle BB 2012. Clear yellow colored, small white head. Somewhat hoppy nose, grassy, cardboard. Watery somewhat hoppy flavor with cardboard. Unimpressive, although the sample was quite old.

On 50 cl bottle from Kiosk in Frankfurt. Clear golden color, good foam. Some aromas of fruitiness,some malt & boiled vegetables, light hops in the finish. Ligh body & complexity. Good bitterness and balance. pretty ok
Bottle @ Home. Pours light golden with a white head. Aroma of malt, grain, little sourish, hay. Flavor is malt, light sweet, grainy, light hay. Medium body, lively carbonation. 131113

It’s warm golden with a white head. The aroma has notes of malt, light celluloses and straw. The flavor has a light sweetness and a slightly dry bitterness with the same notes as the aroma. Not a typical helles.
Thinn white lace. Light yellow color. Malty aroma with typical german hop aroma and litle DMS. Nice malty taste and big drinkabillity.
Draft sample. The beer is a clear gold with a white head of foam. Dough and caramel with some spice. Sweet and doughy taste. Medium body and medium carbonation. Overall decent.

On tap at Handlebar. Pours a clear gold with a medium sized white head. Clean wheat and a bit of musk and yeast on the nose. Medium bodied, soft wheat and a bit of musk. Soft grain into the finish. A touch of wheat, light yeast. Clean.

From tap at BeerTemple, Amsterdam. Aroma is wheaty, bready, spicy and herbal notes with some bretty funk. Flavour is moderate to medium sweet and slightly bitter. Medium bodied. Okay beer, bit sweetish for my taste.

Tap @ Beer Temple. Hazy orange color. White head. Aroma’s: maggi, herbal, light brett. Retronasal it’s light sweet, light sour, maggi spices, light brett notes. Flavor is moedrate sweet with some bitterness. Light bodied. Interesting, a bit weird, but not bad.

Draft at Beer Temple. Hazy dark golden with a thick white head. Aroma of yeast, light bretty notes, citrus, elderflower and some weird herbal notes. Flavour is light sweet and light to moderate bitter with a juicy acidic twang. Above light bodied with soft carbonation.

Can pours a very cloudy golden with a one finger white head and good lacing. Unpleasant aroma of heavy aspirin yeast, dish soap, and some mostly orange citrus. Tastes much better than it smells though with some real complex flavors hitting all over. Rather sweet and light but with a sharp twang. Minimal bitterness. Lightly carbonated. Good sweet citrus fruity aftertaste that turns into a dominant floral aftertaste.

12 oz can. Canned on 8/27/15. (Beermongers) Portland, OR. Cloudy golden color with a small white head. Spices, malt, wheat and yeast in the aroma. The flavor is really much spices and yeast... dry malt and wheat there too. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Can. Colour...hazy golden straw with a thin white head. Nose...faint hints of butyl esters and sweet spices. Palate...frothy and fairly zesty, with notes of coriander and sweet spice, muddled with some citrus. The finish is short and somewhat spicy.
Draft pour pint at Frankies pizza. Pours a light golden color with a fizzy head. A lot of refreshing lemon flavor with a light floral finish. Mild orange spice. Very nice wit.
Lemongrass notes with faint hints of coriander. The nose is slightly floral and the elderberry comes through on the finish. Refreshing on a hot summer day
Getrunken vor Ort. Bier ist so in der Mitte aber in der Richtung hoch. Schön bitter und süffig. Keller auch nicht schlecht.

50cl swing top bottle. A almost clear golden beer with a small off-white head. Aroma of mild grainy and caramelish malt, straw. Taste of caramelish moderate sweet malt, straw, grains, moderate bitterness.

Clear golden. Aroma is spelt, noble hops, grass, lots of grains, some basement, hints of tomato, yeast cake. Taste is balanced bittersweet malt with some minerally dusty finish. Full bodied, but the dusty herbal character is a bit too much. Still pretty tasty.
Bottle. Cloudy golden, low offwhite head. Spicy heather and hay nose, medium light body, grainy, hay start, mineral, rural, cake finish.

Bottle, many thanks MoritzF! Unclear golden color with white head. Aroma is grainy, earthy, a bit hay. Taste is grainy, light lemony, grassy, hay, cake dough. Mineralic dry mouthfeel with medium carbonation and quite a bitter finish. Ok, a bit too cakey.

On tap @ So Good (Rome). Pours golden with a medium white head. Aroma of malt, honey, bread crust, yeasts, grass, light off-flavour (shrimps). Flavour is medium sweet with a light bitterness, watery. Light body, medium carbonation. So so...

Bottle (50 cl swing-top) from KeWe Getränkemarkt, Bamberg, Germany. Hazy golden, medium white head. Bready, earthy malt aroma, slightly unclean, herbal hops. Medium bodied, medium to high carbonation. Dry with medium bitterness.

From a flip-top bottle, pours a hazy golden color with a cream colored lid. The smell is bread, toasted malt, nuts, grass. The taste is as it smells with a bit of citrus and a somewhat dry and herbal ending. The beer has a light+ body with nice fine carbonation. Nice Kellerbier.
Pours a pale, golden color with a small head. Quite clean hoppy and refreshing.

(bottle) murky golden colour with a frothy off-white head and lots of tiny floaties. aroma of cardboard and peaches, slightly alcoholic, with a hint of vanilla and cashew nuts. flavour is mostly starchy pale malts with more alcohol, dried apricots, some cherries, nettles and yeast in the dry finish. full-bodied with soft carbonation.
old backlog rating. RBESG08, blind tasting at Modrý Abbé, #5: Low aroma, a bit napkin. Pale golden, light haze, creamy head, big bubbles. Fizzy. Boring.
Golden color with small white head. Aroma of malt. Taste sweet malt, grass, very little bitterness.
Tap @ Prague beer museum. Pours golden with a white head. Aroma of malt, corn, hay, grass, light dusty. Flavor of sweet malt, grass, hay, light fruity hops. Medium body, soft carbonation. 060812
Unfilterad at the soldiare Svejk. thick and lassting white head. Clowdy golden color. Smallmalty aroma. With some corn. Sweetmalty taste with mediumbody and small bitterness for a tjeck lager.

Draft at Modrý Abbé. A hazy golden beer with a white head. The aroma is sweet with notes of straw, citrus, and hops as well as a light note of sulphur. The flavor is sweet and very malty combined with light notes of eggs, leading to a dry straw finish.

Draught at a blind tasting at Modrý Abbé in Klatovy -08. Clear golden colour. Milky aroma, leaning towards sour. Stale. Pretty empty beer flavourwise with low maltiness, and that goes for the bitterness as well.

On tap. Clear golden with a dense and creamy white head leaving some laces. Sweetish malt in the nose, some flowery accents and perhaps a hint of metal. Medium body with sweet clean malts and a very subdued bitterness in the finish. 280608

[tap at blind tasting at Modrý Abbé in Klatovy] Almost very fresh noble hops aroma that is a touch sour. Slightly hazy straw with a thick and clingly head. Quite bitter on the tongue with a fresh hops flavour but not enough malt flavour and sweetness to balance. Light to medium body with medium carbonation and a little residual bitterness.
Clear golden with large white head. Sweet malty aroma with fresh wort notes. Sweet flavor with fruity and mild caramel notes.
Cloudy yellow with a firm and lasting white head. Pilsner malt aroma, some vegetable sulphur and a touch of grassy hops. Dryish clean flavour with hops and a decent bitter finish.

column1: Chelsea New York Rye Pale Ale
column5: growler-pours a light tan head and hazy amber color. Aroma is resin/pine hops, medium malt/rye, fruit. Taste is husky, rye/sweet medium malt-caramel, roasty, nutty, resin/pine/earthy hops backbone. OK carbonation. Thanks to jwc215 for sharing.

column1: Chelsea New York Rye Pale Ale
column5: Draft at the Blind Tiger. Amber / ruby pour with some off-white head. Aroma is biscuity malt (rye?), citrus hops, and some earthy / floral hops. Flavor is the same, with the citrus and earthy malt and hops dominating. There is a little nice resin, but overall the mouthfeel is not so good. Medium bitterness.

column1: Chelsea New York Rye Pale Ale
column5: Tap @ Cole’s. Gold, light tan head. Nose is rye spiciness, lightly sour, some paint, hay. Flavor is watery rye, cereals, some watery orange, tea. Fizzy tea finish.

column1: Chelsea New York Rye Pale Ale
column5: On-tap at Cole’s, this is an APA. Neutral smell, lighter mouthfeel with whitish head on light yellow body almost clear. Low on hops, and even rye taste is moderate. Drinkable like a lager. Above average carbonation.

column1: Chelsea New York Rye Pale Ale
column5: Tap at Hop Devil. I didn’t write down very much. Rye, hops in the aroma. Fresh with clean yeast. Chewy. Very drinkable. Rye was there but not very strong.

column1: Chelsea New York Rye Pale Ale
column5: Tap at Barcade: Labeled as an IPA. Pours a deep orange topped by a thin off white sheet for head. Somewhat aromatic. Just straight forward American hops, a hint of pine. The body is a bit too carbonated IMO. There’s a very subtle caramel note in the malt upfront followed by a very piny and dry hop bite in the finish. Has less body than I expected, considering this is made with rye malt. Simple, but still somewhat enjoyable.

column1: Chelsea New York Rye Pale Ale
column5: (Tap) Pours a orangy color with a nice white head. This was listed as the ’Chelsea Rye IPA’ at the bar. I would agree that this beer is more of an IPA than an APA. Dusty, hoppy aroma. Taste is rather hoppy, yet very dry and crisp. You can tell there is some rye in this beer, but it really doesn’t jump out like you would expect. Nice bitter finish, with some citrus and pine.

column1: Chelsea New York Rye Pale Ale
column5: Tap at The Brazen Head. Deep golden amber beer with a thin white head. Also listed as "IPA" and it probably is more IPA than APA. The aroma is lightly spicy with a light rye spiciness behind the otherwise normal pale ale malt. Not much in the way of crystal malts or other sweeter components. Hops are a bit of a hybrid with a light spiciness but also a fair amount of orange fruitiness. The fruity flavour increases as the beer warms a bit. There is also a light pine/resiny bitterness that I quite enjoy. Soft spiciness on the back and a moderately hoppy finish. Decent brew.

column1: Chelsea New York Rye Pale Ale
column5: Draught at Pete’s (Waterfront) Ale House and also Brazen Head. However, listed as Chelsea NY Rye "IPA," as opposed to "Pale Ale" which makes sense since the hops are at the forefront here. Poured a lightly hazy orange with a citrusy/grapefruit hop aroma. Grain to caramel malts with a solid grapefruit hop presence and underlying sour/spicy rye flavors. Dry hoppy, almost tannic, bitterness on the finish. Medium bodied with moderate carbonation. Local freshness apparent. Great recipe and fine execution again from Chelsea.

column1: Chelsea New York Rye Pale Ale
column5: On tap at Waterfront in NYC. Deep orangey red in color with a nice off white head. Sweet and grainy aroma. Sweet and hoppy flavor. Caramel notes. Dry tasting. Finish is hoppy. Smooth. Decent. Enjoyable.

0.5 l bottle from the brewery, best before July 2017. Clear, golden yellow with a medium large, foamy, very dense, stable, white head. Grassy-spicy, slightly floral-fruity aroma of fresh grass and some citrus. Slightly bitter, just a little sweetish, moderately grassy-spicy, slightly floral and a bit fruity taste of fresh grass, some citrus and hints of crackers, followed by a short, moderately bitter, grassy-spicy, relatively dry and a little metallic finish. Thin to medium body, slightly effervescent mouthfeel, lively carbonation. Nice!

Bottle. Thanks to Erzengel. Pale golden body with small white head. Aroma is grain, bread and some hints of malts. Taste is grains with some sweetness and a very thin mouthfeel. Aftertaste is slightly bitter with some sweetness.
Für ein Pisner ungewöhnlich mild, beinahe süß. Stellenweise getreidig und leicht vanillin, dabei jedoch laff und ohne wirklichen Charakter. Eigentlich nur trinkbar, mehr nicht.

Bottle bought at the Hofverkauf of the brewery. The beer pours out in a clear golden colour with airy, low head and medium to crisp body. Aroma of hops and grass. Taste of medium bitter hops, light barley, light malt, grass and citrus fruits. Medium-bitter and crisp finish. Refreshing and easy drinkable.
Ins Glas ergießt sich ein klares goldenes Bier mit schöner Schaumkrone. Geruch hopfig, getreidig, grasig. Geschmack hopfig, grasig, lang anhaltende Bitterkeit.

Der Geruch ist hopfig-frisch, riecht schon ziemlich herb. Der Antrunk ist wässrig-süßlich. Zum Hauptteil hin entwickelt sich eine leicht muffig-herbe Note, die Wässrigkeit im Hintergrund bleibt. Der Nachgeschmack ist herb-süßlich, mittellang anhaltend und auch so muffig-komisch. Insgesamt nicht schlecht, aber mein Geschmack ist es nicht - da zieh’ ich lieber die dunkle Variante vor! Test vom 11.4.2008, Gebinde: Glasflasche Noten: 12,9,12,8,12,9 - 9,75

Bottle from trade with Erzengel and ThirstyBird, many thanks. Pours pale golden color, white foamy head. Aroma is malty, grassy, grain. Taste is light sweet, low bitterness, malty, corny. Average pilsener.

(bottle) pours a clear golden colour with a frothy white head. aroma of barnyard, pale malts, cardboard, herbal hops and some light straw. flavour is mostly the same, yeast, grainy pale malts, light grass and straw. medium-bodied with average carbonation.

Pours a brilliant clear yellow color with a white cap. Smell is sweet light malt sweetness, grass. Taste is the sweet light malt mixed with some nice hop crispness ending dry. Light in body with nice finely constructed carbonation. Overall a very nice pils.
Color unclear yellow with medium head. Aroma hop, fruit, grass. Taste hop, fruit, bitter.

Sehr schön süßlicher Geruch. Röstmalzanklänge, Karamell. Der Antrunk ist vollmundig-süffig, leicht süßliche Karamelltöne zum Hauptteil hin, mit schön ausgewogener herb-malzige Note. Insgesamt aber etwas flach bleibend. Erst im Nachgeschmack wird es körperreicher, auf der Zunge bleibt eine sehr schöne Karamellmalz-süßlich-angenehm herbe Note zurück. --> Anfang flach, Mittelteil besser, Nachgeschmack toll. Ein Bier mit Steigerung. Dabei schöne grasige Hopfenfrische. 11/11/13/11
Ins Glas ergießt sich ein leicht trübes goldgelbes Bier mit ordentlicher Schaumkrone. Geruch malzig, getreidig, leicht würzig. Geschmack malzig würzig, getreidig, leichte Bitterkeit.
Etwas schwach auf der Brust mit getreidigen Ansätze und etwas Apfel im Aroma. Simpel, einfach zu trinken - Durchschnitt.

Pours out of the bottle in a cloudy ligth golden colour with steady low head and medium body. Aroma of straw and nuts. Taste of mild hops, straw, dust, nuts, caramel, basement and apples. Easy to drink, refreshing, but just not that special at all.
Bottled. A dark golden beer with a yellowish head. The aroma has notes of straw and malt. The flavor is sweet with notes of straw and malt, leading to a dry finish. Thanks yespr for sharing.
Bottle, 33 cl, courtesy of Yespr. Clear golden with a small, quickly diminishing head. Malty, unspecific nose. Toasted malty taste, some bittering hops. Unspetacular.

Bottle 33 cl. Courtesy of yespr. Pours a clear golden with an almost absent white head. Slightly skewed and unclean malt aroma. Medium body, lightly caramellish sweet malt with a subdued bitterness. 040213
33 cL bottle. Pours clear and golden orange with a small white head. Aroma is toasted malty and grassy. Grassy and light cornish. Bitter and light metallic finish.
Trocken herber Antrunk, getreidig. Das Bier wird fast staubig trocken, leichte, etwas wässrige Bitterkeit. Zum Ende ausgewogener, leider kaum hopfig, zu trocken. 9/7/5/7/9/6

Bottle 330ml. w. swing top. [ Trade by Koelschtrinker ]. Clear medium orange yellow colour with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, white head. Aroma is light to moderate malty, grain, hay, dusty, paper note, mint - bubble gum notes. Flavour is moderate sweet with a average duration, mint, malty, clark. Body is light to medium, texture is watery to oily, carbonation is soft. [20121019]

Clear golden color with white head. Aroma is clean, slightly malty, slightly hoppy, quite generic. Taste follows, really balanced, generic, hoppy on the finish with light bitterness. Medium to light body with medium bitterness. Pretty generic and slightly bitter on the finish.
50cl bottle. Pours clear pale golden colour with a huge most good lasting white head. Aroma of mild grassy hops and pale malt. Taste of mild grassy hops, hay, pale malt, very easy Pilsener.
Pours a goldencolor with a small lacy white head. Almost nothing on the nose or taste. Thin body.

Bottled 500ml. -from www.beershop.hr Yellow/golden coloured, small white head, mild grassy nose. Weak malty, slight hoppy and watery with grassy notes in the dry finish. Let’s say (below) average beer.
Clear yellow color, minimal white head. Corny nose. Aroma is corn and malt. Medium sweet. Thin body, lively carbonation. Bad, even for Pilsener standards. (Pivkan 0,5l bottle)

Ogivlado’s, thanks! Very, veeeery pale golden-yellow body. Big, lasting white head though. Remarkably nice, initially hoppy, lemony aroma, slightly fruity, some nice grainy maltiness. The taste is a letdown after that, mild, watery, slightly grainy, and that’s all.

Bottle, danke David. Amber, big bubbles, low offwhite head. Grass and hay aroma. Medium to light, quite chewy body, honeyish bread base with plentyfull leafy hop notes on top. Quick finish, fine aromatic retronasal.

Malzig-hopfiger Antrunk, ausgewogen, wenig außergewöhnlich. Der Hopfen ist im Mittelteil auf ein bescheidenes Ausmaß zusammengeschrumpft, gleichauf aber leicht verwässert ist eine würzige hellmalzige Note, die etwas verschwimmt und bald sehr unscheinbar wird. Zum Ende mild hopfenherb, hintergründig bitter. Trinkbares Pils. Danke an kappldav123 für das Bier. 7/7/7/6/8/7

50 cL bottle. Clear and golden yellow with a small, creamy and white head. Mild grassy and slight spiced hoppy aroma. Bitter and light malty flavoured. Vague cornish and slight malty note. Bitter and malty finish.
Bottle. Metallic barley malt aroma. Pale yellow with large head. Stale barley malt and tin flavor. Not one I’ll look for again.
Bottle looks very simple. Beer in the glass zippy, small head. Starts mild, malty, dry. Metallical notes. A bit soapy. Finish more balanced. Okay.
bottle. Greenish yellow, tall white head. Malty start, grassy hopy tune in at once, also a dusty touch.
Fläschchen: Pale golden, small foamy layer, bitter mineralic-metallic nose; moderate dry bitter flavour, light bodied and tart; dry and lingering metallic-bitter finish. Great Ersatz-Warsteiner...
Bottle from Hol Ab, Südstadt, Hannover. Clear golden with a white head. Aroma is sweet, amlty and moderate hoppy - straw. Flavor is medium and moderate bitter. Dry and moderate bitter finish. 110417
50cl bottle. Pours clear pale golden colour with a huge most good lasting white head. Aroma of metallic hops, spicy hops, some grains. Taste of grainy and spicy malt, some metallic hops, boring!

0,5 l bottle. Clear golden with a mighty but fast fading head in the glass. Low grainy and grassy on the nose. Tast starts a little bit malty and grassy, metallic elements. Low hop bitterness. Boring easy to drink Pilsener but also nothing really wrong with it.

Schaumkrone massig, aber grobkörnig, Haltbarkeit gering. Farblich helleres Goldgelb. Riecht etwas würzig, durchschnittlich frisch. Schmeckt metallisch, leicht würzig, stumpfes Malz, geringe Herbe. Recht rezent im Antrunk, lasches Mundgefühl, recht hartes Wasser.
0,33 l Flasche. Hellgelbes Bier, weißer Schaum. Riecht nach Maische und leicht nach Hopfen, fast wie ein alkoholfreies Bier. Geschmacklich dann recht süß und leicht bitter.

Pours out of the bottle in a clear golden colour with steady low head and crisp body. Aroma of grass and hops.Taste of fresh hops, grass, citrus, spruce, light malt and dust. Thin-crisp finish. Average beer but quite refreshing anyway.
Leicht metallisch mit starken Neigungen in Richtung Getreide und Unaromahopfen, dazu eine leicht derbe Bitterkeit. Ganz ok. Durchschnittspils durch und durch.
bottle from pivnizub! Golden yellow, mid-sized white head. Grainy malty flavours, shy grassy-herbal hops.
Bottle looks very simple. Beer in the glass zippy, small head. Starts mild, malty, metallical. Boring malty finish. Nothing special.

NRW-Flasche:Clear, Pale greenish-golden, medium-sized and slowly collapsing white head; mild sweetish-grainy nose with an eben milder dry Grass background; mild dryish bitter-sweet flavour, light bodied, but astonishingly soft; slightly lingering bitter-malty finish. Nothing wrong with it, just a simple thirst-quencher...
Pours a clear golden color with a white head. Aroma of malt, grain, hay. Flavor is light sweet, malt, grain.

Bottle from Hol Ab, Südstadt, Hannover. Clear yellow with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty and moderate hoppy - straw. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and moderate bitter finish. Metallic. 110417

50cl bottle. Pours clear pale golden colour with a mid-sized most good lasting white head. Aroma of mild grainy malt, very low bitterness. Taste of grainy malt, mild bitterness, some spicy hops, boring!

Cheap 0,5 l bottle. Clear golden in the galss, very small fast fading white head. Mid malty with grain on the nose. Smooth taste, malty, grain, grassy, some citrus in the background. Heyyy, to be honest not really bad for the 45 ct I´d pay at a local bottle shop.

Schaumkrone durchschnittlich, grobkörnig, kurze Haltbarkeit. Geruch feinwürzig, metallisch, durchschnittlich frisch. Geschmack würzig, leicht metallisch, mild. Brauwasser akzeptabel. Unterer Durchschnitt.
Mehr als simpel und dumpf ist es nicht, Getreidig mit etwas Heu und Malz. Derb, trinkbar, nicht gerade inspirierend.

Pours out of the bottle in a light golden colour with low airy head and thin body. Aroma of hops and mild fruits. Taste of mild hops, grains, balrey, wheat, bread and citrus. Thin and unaromatic finish. Average and boring.

0,5 l bottle from a random Hol´Ab! market. Unclear darkest brown to black in the glass with a nearly two finger beige foamy head. Smells malty with choco and dark fruity background. Taste is malty, little bit roasted, choco, sweet dark fruity. But not very complex or intensive. Okay.
Shared bottle at home. Pours clear dark brown with light beige head. Aroma of dark bread, coffee, chocolate, dark fruits. Tastes slightly sweet with balancing bitterness. Medium bodied.

(Flasche) Es hat eine dunkelbraune Farbe, ist klar filtriert mit einer weißen gräulichen Schaumkrone. Das Aroma ist brotig, leicht röstig, Isopropanol mit dunklen Beeren. Im Geschmack ist trocken, mit Noten von Sirup und Brombeere. Im Hintergrund befindet sich eine minimale Röstnote.

(bottle) clear deep ruby colour with a frothy light-beige head. aroma of black bread crusts and earth, with a light hint of yeast, raspberries and some liquorice. flavour is mostly the same, heavy roasted malts and yeast, with a light herbal hoppiness, some vanilla and a semi-dry finish. medium-bodied with average carbonation.

Bottle from Hol Ab, Südstadt, Hannover. Clear dark brown with a lasting off-white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel and moderate hoppy - straw. Flavor is medium sweet and light bitter. Light dry and light bitter finish. 110417

50cl bottle. Pours clear dark reddish brown colour with a huge most good lasting beige head. Aroma of spicy hops, some dark and sweet malt. Taste of dark malt, sweet malt, bitter medium metallic hops, nothing special.

Pours virtually black from the bottle and leaves a porous white crown that soon collapses. Aroma is malt and something vaguely sour. Taste is cardboard, stale cracker, burnt malt. I am struggling to find something positive here. It is light bodied and watery, which dilutes the unpleasantries rather than magnifying them. Finish is bland and lightly bitter. The latest in a series of disappointing German black beer experiences. Avoid.
Relativ langweilig mit einigen Röstaromen und etwas Kaffee im Hintergrund. Auch ein klein wenig Schokolade könnte man vermuten, diese wird aber von der Perlung übertüncht. Mittlerer Durchschnitt.
Pours out of the bottle in a deep black colour with low head and medium body. Aroma of malt and spices. Taste of malt, roast, woods, earth, caramel and spices. Spicy finish. Nice one.
Bottle. Pours black rubish color. Aroma of malts and caramel. Flavour of malts and caramel .

column2: Neuhaus an der Pegnitz, Bavaria, Germany
column5: Pours a hazy golden color. Banana, grain, bread aroma. Taste is medium sweet, with a bready and doughy aftertaste.

column2: Neuhaus an der Pegnitz, Bavaria, Germany
column5: Pours amber and hazy from the bottle. A thick, foamy crown lingers. Aroma is banana, and fresh dough. Taste is moderately sweet with hints of bubble gum and banana. Dry throughout. Body is to the lighter side of medium, carbonation is soft. Nothing special but still a quite drinkable Weizen.

column2: Neuhaus an der Pegnitz, Bavaria, Germany
column5: (bottle) murky golden colour with a frothy off-white head. aroma of candle wax and wheat, heavily phenolic, with lots of buttermilk and oatmeal. flavour is mostly ashy wheat and vanilla, with a light touch of tobacco and heavy clove in the semi-dry finish. medium-bodied with lively carbonation.

column2: Neuhaus an der Pegnitz, Bavaria, Germany
column5: (Flasche) Es hat eine helle orangene Farbe, ist hefetrüb mit einer weißen Schaumkrone. Das Aroma ist hefig, Weizen, grüner Apfel und einer leichten Süße. Der Geschmack ist samtig, getreidig, mit Hefe und leichten Bananennoten.

column2: Neuhaus an der Pegnitz, Bavaria, Germany
column5: 50cl bottle. Pours hazy dark golden colour with a mid-sized good lasting off-white head. Aroma of banana, yeast and bread. Taste of phenolic yeast and sweet banana, nothing special.

column2: Neuhaus an der Pegnitz, Bavaria, Germany
column5: Thanks to WillemsUrenkel for that one! Bottle looks simple but good. Beer in the glass very zippy, huge head. Starts mild, malty, more and more yeasty, modest dry. Light fruity notes of banana. Finish still mild, a bit boring malty-yeasty. Average hefeweizen.

column2: Neuhaus an der Pegnitz, Bavaria, Germany
column5: 0,5 l Flasche. Orange trübes Bier, solider Schaum. Geruch Bananig, hefig. Geschmack auch fruchtig, leicht säuerlich, frisch. Gut trinkbar.

column2: Neuhaus an der Pegnitz, Bavaria, Germany
column5: Pours out of the bottle in a cloudy light amber colour with steady big head and smooth to thin body. Aroma of yeast and grass. Taste of ripe yeast, wheat, berad and bananas. Sour-thin-watery finish.

column2: Neuhaus an der Pegnitz, Bavaria, Germany
column5: Die Nase sagt leider Banane, danach wird es etwas saurer, mild-fruchtiger und dank der brutalen Kohlensäure beinahe scharf. Etwas sehr unausgewogen, aber zumindest erfrischend. Ganz ok.

column2: Neuhaus an der Pegnitz, Bavaria, Germany
column5: Aroma: yeasty, sour. Appearance: hazy gold, big white head. Taste: light sweetness. Palate: fruity and long. Overall: very drinkable Hefeweizen. Bottle at the Octoberfest Pub, London.
Keg at the brewpub. Hazy yellow, large fizzy offwhite head, good retention. Aroma of spice, coriander, wheat, clove, mild citrus finish. Taste is citrus, wheat, spice. Thin. Drinkable. Solid.
Draft - Banana, coriander and light citrus. Cloudy yellow with a nice white head. Banana, coriander, light lemon and a nice bite. Pretty decent and refreshing.

On tap at the brewery. Pale, yellow-orange appearance with a sticky white head. Aroma of coriander, orange peel, wheat, herbs and lemon grass. Similar flavor, adding citrus fruit, sweet bready malts, light zesty bitterness and light spice. Light to medium body, crisp feel with average carbonation and a refreshing finish. Tasty.

Tap @ Court Avenue. Pours a hazy light yellow appearance with a nice white head. Spicy, lemon citrusy, a bit bready aroma. Coriander, lemon zesty, orange peel, moderately spicy yeasty flavor that is pretty refreshing.
On tap at the brewpub. Comes a cloudy pale gold with a small white head. Aroma of fruit, spice, and grain. Taste is orange, corriander, wheat, and yeast. Pretty good.
Poured from bottle at americano. Golden orange with no head. Orange and bland taste. Boring wheat beer
On Tap at brewpub.. cloudy orange pour no head..very fruity aroma.and wheaty fruity taste

Cloudy yellow pour with a thick white head. Faint aroma, mostly of cloves with hints of banana and some spices. The flavor is very unusual though. Very faint with only the slightest hint of any of the spices that are in the aroma. The flavor disappears quickly. Very strange
on tap-pours hazy straw with a white head. Aroma is coriander, wheat. Taste is raw wheat, orange, coriander.

Pours a hazy yellow color with a small head. The aroma is orange with some general fruity notes and some mineral stuff. The flavor is nicely bitter with a somewhat soapy character, very fruity, with a wonderful expression of the coriander.

column2: Höchstadt an der Aisch, Bavaria, Germany
column5: Dank spontaner freundlicher Einladung der Kellergemeinschaft Blauer Löwe konnte ich auf dem Bierkeller Blauer Löwe in Höchstadt ein Bier trinken, das am ehesten als Ungespundetes zu bezeichnen wäre, tatsächlich aber ein im eigenen Bierkeller gereiftes Hausbrauerbier ist (d.h. Jungbier wird zum Vorzugspreis von der Brauerei bezogen und zur Nachgärung im eigenen Keller eingelagert). - Das Ergebnis war weich malzsüß, leicht karamellig, etwas hefig und frisch zitrusfruchtig gehopft - ein klassisches, gut gehopftes Kellerbier. Sehr empfehlenswert - und auch die ausgedehnten historischen Kelleranlagen sind eine Besichtigung wert. Einfach freitags mal vorbeischauen!

column2: Höchstadt an der Aisch, Bavaria, Germany
column5: On draught at the brewpub: Hazy, deep golden coloured, lively carbonation, mid-sized creamy-lacing head; sweet-malt, bitter-hops and a touch of barnyard in the aroma; robust sweet-bitter flavour, medium-bodied; lingering bitter-sweet-malty finish. Not too aromatic, but a very soloid franconian Kellerbier...

column1: Rock Bottom Des Moines Stand Up Pale Ale
column2: West Des Moines, Iowa, United States
column5: Pours a hazy almost orange color with a good head and nice lacing. The aroma is floral and citrusy with some biscuit maltiness in there as well. The flavor follows suit but adds plenty of pineapple to the mix. The beer is nicely bitter and dry with a mild roasty bitterness.

column1: Rock Bottom Des Moines Stand Up Pale Ale
column2: West Des Moines, Iowa, United States
column5: On tap a few weeks back. It was labelled as a California Style Pale Ale. Color was dark orange. Aroma of citrus and caramel; somewhat earthy. Flavor was much of the same; simple and good.

column1: Rock Bottom Des Moines Stand Up Pale Ale
column2: West Des Moines, Iowa, United States
column5: Tried again at the brewpub and I liked it a little more. Still, pretty mild. From a growler, thanks a lot General_Gao. The body was dark gold with a generous fluffy head. The aroma had some light grapefruit. There was also some roasted peanuts and bread crust. The taste was surprisingly sweet. I mostly tasted pancakes with some light hints of orange flavored candy in the background. There was also a note of caramel. Where are the hops? The body is softly carbonated and helps to make this seem like a session brew, but the abv is a little high for that.

column1: Rock Bottom Des Moines Stand Up Pale Ale
column2: West Des Moines, Iowa, United States
column5: Draft at the brewpub. Poured a clear orange color. Head was off white with good retention and lacing. Nice malty caramel aroma with a hint of citrusy hops. Slightly sweet on the tongue with malty cereal grain citrusy hops, and honey. There was also a touch of graham cracker. Finishes with a hint of caramel and delicate hop bitterness. Pretty good APA.

Date: 06/24/2007 Mode: Bottle Source: Tasting, RBSG 2007 clear pale ale, wispy white head, light sweet malt aroma with a hint of corn and floral hops, creamy corn flavor, light bitterness, Aroma: 3/10; Appearance: 6/10; Flavor: 3/10; Palate: 5/10; Overall: 6/20 Rating: 1.8/5.0 Drinkability: 5/10 Score: */4
RBSG 2007 Grand Tasting. Light straw with a fluffy white head. Light honey and grain nose. More grain and honey in the flavor, a bit of bread. OK.
Sampled at the RBSG 07 Grand Tasting. Almost no color in the beer. Just the faintest yellow that might have been the alcohol blurring my vision ;). Faint lager-honey aroma with faint grainy body.
Clear very pale yellow body with a small white head. Very light honey aroma. Light honey and grain flavor, somewhat bready with a bit of a metallic hint in the end.

Had this at St. Louis Microfest at the Trailhead tent. A very nice hoppy aroma. Poured an amber with a very nice, creamy head. Aroma was mostly citrus with a little Summit vidalia onion. Taste followed suit, but a little more intense onion bitterness. Very good, different pale ale.
Poured from draft at old maine in Ames. Milky. And little sour? Sweet. Just weird also
An average milk stout with a chocolate and coffee taste. Finishes with a touch of sweetness. The label is what really makes it worth buying.
On tap @ Olde Main. Black appearance with dark brown appearance. Milky, roasty dark malty nose. Milky, lactic, dark malty, light chocolate flavor.

Tap at the brewpub. Deep near black body with garnet at the edges. A light khaki head on top. Strongly roasted coffee nose with green beans. There is also some milk chocolate. The taste is like sweet grapes and green apple. There is also a strong sweet coffee finish. This would be good except for the green apple as CanIHave4Beers said about it last year.

Pours a deep black with a good head and some lace. The aroma is some burnt sugar and caramel with some roastiness and some odd kind of green apple infection. The flavor is more odd green apple with some toastiness and a nice sweetness. There are some coffee tones in there as well. This is basically perfectly balanced and would be exemplary for the style if it weren’t for the odd green apple flavor that really gets in the way of all the nice things going on here.

Had this one on draught at the brewpub in Ames, Iowa. Clear, dark reddish brown pour with a thick, foamy tan head, soy sauce and chocolate malts in the nose, bitter chocolate throughout, especially in the finish, with some cherry and sweet coffee, a milky, smooth finish. Excellent.

Draft at El Bait Shop in Des Moines, IA. Poured a clear dark brown color. Head was thick and light tan with good retention and lacing. Distinct milk chocolate aroma with a similar flavor. Sweet on the tongue with a smooth mouth feel.
Bottle [from trade with bierkoning] @ home. Clear yellow golden color, average sized white head. Smell and taste malts, sweetish, only slightly a bitter hint in the finish. Low body and carbonation.
*Old rating, best before 13.07.12. Nettes, süffig-maltiges Bier. Nicht zu tief, leichte Getreidetöne, nett.
Geel bier met schuim. Smaak is matig, licht bitter en gemiddelde nasmaak. Standaard bier.
Ins Glas ergießt sich ein goldgelbes Bier mit durchschnittlicher Schaumkrone. Geruch malzig, getreidig, leicht herb. Geschmack malzig würzig, getreidig, minimale Bitterkeit.
Bottle. A small head. Some hops with a medium body. Aroma is light to the nose. Taste is slight carbonated up front.

The glass pours a pale yellow beer with little foam. It smells hoppy, bitter, subtly metallic. Starts hoppy-bitter, slightly grainy and malty sweet. The middle part is well balanced, with proper malt body and pleasant hop flavor. The finish is hoppy, floral, subtle grassy, also aromas of hay, grain and sweet malts.

Bottle 33cl from Quack-Duck thanks. A clear yellow beer with good head. Nose is slightly vegetable like, aroma is on peppery hops, sweet at the beginning with a very dry finish with grassy, peppery and bitter hops. Medium malty with a light apple note and honey. Long bitter aftertaste, very carbonated, ok !

0.33 l bottle, thanks Timo A! Pale golden. Very honeyish aroma with hint of grass and alcohol. Honeyish malty and somewhat citrusy flavor with low herbal hoppiness and low bitterness. Light bodied. Easy, a bit watery.
330ml bottle. Clear golden colour with small unstable white head. Grainy aroma with some hay. Flubby, slightly sweet malt taste, fresher finish, minimal dry hop note.
Bottle. Pale blonde. Grassy bready aroma and flavor. medium bodied. Malty sweetish. Soft apple notes. pleasant beer.

Color naranja, muy turbia, casi opaca. Espuma blanca, medianamente cremosa, de más de dos dedos de espesor y excelente retención. Aroma de intensidad media, tropical y cítrico, no muy definido, hierba y resina, más notable al atemperar, ligeras notas a polvo. Sabor resinoso y herbal con notas cítricas, final de amargor resinoso y ligeramente astringente, alcohol bien integrado. Textura sedosa y muy oleosa. Carbonatación media baja.

On Tap at the Everett Craft Beer fest Light amber with a small light tan head. Decent light toasted malt aroma, rather bland soft woody flavors. Nothing special, I like the "second runnings" idea as a traditional way to get two beers from one mash. But this doesnt quite fly.... or float, I should say.

Draft at the front st. Pours a crustal clear pale gold with a loose white head. Stale cardboard and butter nose. Slick medium body with soft carb. Cardboard and butter and toast on the mid palate. Longish nutty finish.
Dull, lifeless looking banana blond. Easy willamette aroma and similar flavor. Light viscous, smooth graininess.

Pours medium amber with a small white head. Tastes like unfermented wort, sweet and watery. Not much to it, thin and not much fermented so it tastes flat and watery. Not my thing really, but always fun to try a revived style.

Cask gravity at the Pig's ear beer festival 05/12/2017. A clear amber orange coloured pour with no head. Aroma is sweet, boozey brown sugars, ginger, chewits. Flavour is composed of medium sweet, chewy brown sugars, strawberry. Some hot alcohols. Palate is thick and chewy, super sweet.

4th August 2018 Wax top bottle. Hand writing on the back says this bourbon barrel aged. UK Chinook, Admiral and First Gold hops. Hazy amber beer, decent cream colour head. Palate is smooth and semi dry and with reasonable fine carbonation. Slighty thin malts, mildly sweet. A touch of bitterish wet wood. Tangy bourbon. Some ripe orange and marmalade. Quite a dry finish. Interesting. Not the best barrel aged IPA I've had but it's interesting and drinkable.
Tap @ Hotel Mooshof Bodenmais. Blonde. Grass and hay in the aroma. Grassy soft hopbitter flavor. Hay, butter and malt in the aftertaste. Questionable.
It’s golden with a white head, and the aroma has notes of malt, bread and light straw. The flavor has a light sweetness and notes of malt, bread, straw, flower and the finish is dry.

bottle, bought at the brewery. Clear pale yellow, consistent medium-sized head. Dry and hoppy Pils, slightly malty in the background. Rather spicy with flavours reminiscent of herbs. Nice hoppy finish and aftertaste.
On tap at a restaurant in Spandau. Golden yellow with fluffy white head. Nice spicy noble aroma. Very smooth and creamy. Plenty of biscuit and a crisp finish to the falvor. Nice.
bottle, bought at the brewery. Clear pale yellow, medium-sized head. Malty Pils, only slightly hoppy. Very full flavour, slight flavours reminiscent of grain.
On tap at the brewpub.The pour was a straw yellow with a soapy head.The nose was fruity sweet with some hoppiness. Flavor was fruity, sweet, and hoppy.Finished off semi sweet and hoppy.

Served a golden/amber with mild carbonation and a head that is but a film. Aroma of German nobles over light malts. Low diacetyl in flavor over honey & herbs. Light bitterness to finish. Mid-bodied, but it leaves an unwanted coating over the mouth. It’s O.K... but you can pass. On draught at Columbus Brewing Company, Columbus, Ohio 43215

Pint at the brewpub poured bright amber with a very short offwhite head. Aromas of caramel, and biscuit mostly. Flavor is very much the same. Slight caramel, a touch of toffee, and lots of biscuit. Slight hops on the finish but not much. Seemed quite overcarbonated to me as well. Fizzy mouthfeel. Not one of CBC’s best
6/9/07: Sample at Columbus Ale Fest ’07. Golden yellow body. Light malt nose. Small wheat flavor with a slightly sour finish.

[2925-20100625] Sample. Heavy evergreen spruce hops aroma has thick citrus pulp rind notes. Murky, amber orange body with a quick foamy white head. Light bitter evergreen bark flavour with hints of liquid grainy malt bread. Thick medium body. Seems boozier and heavier than the name implies, but still it is aptly named. (@ NAOBF 2010, Portland, OR)

2010-06-25. Hazy dark orange body with a modest beige head that fades. 3+ Very green hop aroma, notes of fresh cut grass, and pine needles. 7+ Flavour is fairly hoppy, green vegetation, pine needles, leafy touches. Pleasant bitterness throughout, green hops linger in the finish. Average palate is smooth, lightly carbonated. Nice. On tap at NAOBFestival, Portland

2007 - North American Organic Brewers Festival – Portland, Oregon Light reddish color with a tint of amber. This was a great Rye ale. Loved the flavors and the deep malts and light hops used. Some light fruit notes with a tad bitter to the finish. Little less hops in the finish would make this a perfect brew. But in all fairness this was a fun and great beer.
bottle from Waitrose Sidmouth (08/2010). Mild, sweetish and very fruity. Quite nice.

Bottle, 500ml. A hazy light pink colour. A slightly floral aroma. Taste is fresh pear with perhaps a hint of rose petals, somewhat sweet but not overly so. Very lightly carbonated. Could do with some tartness to liven things up a little. This bottle was from the first batch of Perry West Lake have ever produced and was described by the brewer as an experiment. I think it’s safe to say that it was successful, and I’ll surely be buying more of this pretty soon. I could drink this all day long, although it is somewhat expensive.

Bottle, 500ml. A deep, hazy golden colour. A light, somewhat sweet apple aroma. Taste is much the same. A slight amount of acidity/tartness. Perhaps a little too much sweetness for my liking, as the apple flavour is somewhat obscured by it. (cane sugar is added). Light to moderate carbonation. This is both artificially carbonated and pasteurised, which probably doesn’t help the flavour much. For a premium cider, this is pretty good - it’s actually more like a cross between a premium cider and a more traditional cider.

column2: Kill Devil Hills, North Carolina, United States
column5: I think this is their best brew except for the lemon grass wheat. The cinnamon and nutmeg spice flavors seem to stand up with some slight acidity along with a fruity flavor and a decent alcoholic kick. The aroma and body could be a bit more pronounced but its a nice diversion from the other offerings, except say the big wine list at OBX.

column2: Kill Devil Hills, North Carolina, United States
column5: My 500th rating, and I wish it were a little better, honestly. Oh well, no worries. Deep amber pour with a surprisingly decent head retention for ABV. The nose is of Belgian yeast and aerated sugars. Unfortunately, the flavors contradict themselves, simultaneously pale (via Crystal) and sugar-syrupy (via Candi Sugar). The mouthfeel waxes and wanes, tugging between the opposing flavors. This palate war leaves a finish that is hollow and almost astringent. As it warms, subtle bitters enter the end of the pull. The body is light for such a heavy offering. It honestly makes me wonder exactly what the brewer was aiming for. I’m not exactly sure I understand the brew. Not a typical BSA, that’s for sure. Interesting for the rate, though.

column2: Kill Devil Hills, North Carolina, United States
column5: A good try at the style. Very sweet fruity taste. The beer is very dark with a small head. The alcohol is evident from the first sip though unlike others of the style. Don’t have too many of these especially in the hot summer.

column2: Kill Devil Hills, North Carolina, United States
column5: snifter at brewpub, Ok aroma, sweet. Malty, caramel, sugary, lite fruitiness. Got a yeasty egginess, some berry/dried fruit, plum & raisin. Dark cloudy orangy brown color. Minor head & lace. Sweet flavor Like aroma, but Has some spice I didn’t notice in aroma, clove, big dose of the candi sugar, little caramel, really notice the 10.2% now. Medium body, smooth creamy mouthfeel, sweet biting finish. ABV again is noticable. I had a tough time finishing this one. I didn’t think the flavors came together well. To me it was like they never blended together and you got bit & pieces of them as you sipped. Oh well.

column2: Kill Devil Hills, North Carolina, United States
column5: On draft at the brewery in Kill Devil Hills NC. Pours a clear dark cola brown with a tan head. Malty nose. Flavors of chocolate and toasted nuts. Velvety mouthfeel. Crisp, dry finish.

column2: Kill Devil Hills, North Carolina, United States
column5: Dark brown colo, thick creamy head & thick lacing. Flavor is quite roasty with stong notes of chocolate. Slightly bitter and dry finish. Body is very silky and smooth.

column2: Kill Devil Hills, North Carolina, United States
column5: Growler, from brewpub. Nice aroma. Little fruity, grapefruit, little bready. Some chocolate about it. When cold the fruitiness seemed stronger that faded. Clean dark orangy brown color, Good head and lacing. Bitter sweet flavor. Fruitiness still shows up, has a bitter chocolate streak. Medium body, smoooth lite creamy mouthfeel, bitter dryish finish. I like it really like the aroma when cold, lost it as warmed. Classic to style though the Centennial gives it a little extra punch. Nice session brew.

Cask-conditioned at the Farmers Boy, St Albans, 8/6/07. Straw coloured with a moderate white head. Aroma was of resinous and herby hops. Very dry in the mouth with a slightly oily feel and long, hoppy finish. Very distinctive.
Cask-conditioned at the Lower Red Lion, St Albans 8/6/07. Straw coloured with a slight white head. Aroma of citrus and grassy hops. Flavour was dry and hoppy with a long bitter finish. Pleasant.

Cask conditioned - handpump - Wig & Pen, Northampton. A golden coloured beer with an off white head. The aroma has light citrus hoppy notes. Lemons specifically noted. More hoppiness in the taste which is clean and delicate. An easy drinking sessionable beer.

Cask The 3 Judges. Golden amber colour wit h slight foamy head givng a nice even lacing. Aroma of slight overripe bananas, floural chraacter and apricots and peaches ending on a dry fnish. Taste- Similar to aroma. Very tasty lasting peaches and cream flavour. Yummy smooyj and sessionable
3 Judges. Colour fest, wheres the colour? Aroma is super fruity hoppy citrus goodness. Taste is a similar beast more body than expected from a 3.7% ale. The best beer of the nite forsure.
On tap at Brasserie Beck, DC. Pale straw body with massive head. Nose is malty, grainy, and eggy. Taste is also malty, grassy with hop notes throughout. Okay.
Tap at BB. Great belgian pale ale that has a good amount of mothfeel with a hop finih on the palate.
On draught at Brasserie Beck. Pours a golden straw color. Subtle hop aroma. Slight white head. Very light body. Slightly crisp hop bitterness. Mellow pale malt flavor. Ok summer beer.

For fear of rattling the can one too many times, can breweries please stop abusing the name "pilsner"? Anyway, this beer pours a pale straw colour, which is topped off with a white fluffy head. Very little aroma, disclaimer though, I have a bit of a stuff nose - some bread, a little hay. Taste wise, mostly grainy sweetness with a dry crisp finish. Not awful, but not a pilsner either.

Served on draft at Beer Run in Charlottesville, VA. Pours a barely hazy straw color with a large frothy white head. Fair head retention and lacing. Aroma of grainy malts, saltines, faint toastiness and butter. The taste is grassy hops, grain, and an herbal note. Oddly, reminds me of Mexican food. Thin bodied.

tap at brasserie beck. liked this quite a bit, actually. not sure what’s up with the low marks. crisp. fresh cut grass. creamy. complex. tasty. sessionable. had to go back for a second glass. solid pilsner.
Sweet hop malt aroma. Clear yellow colour with poor head and lacing. Bitter hop malt flavour. Fizzy palate.
19 May 2006 - Light fruit spicy malt hop aroma. Clear yellow, reasonable head and lacing. light sweet spicy, but slight stale hop flavour. Thin and hoppy finish. This reminds me of Stella.

Uh oh, another dumping scam it seems. No other raters apart from Aussies. Is this another case of Caporal punishment being inflicted upon us downundas? So Mr Brewer, what do we have here? Its none other than the hand thrower or Antwerper in the lingo of the land that is Belgian at the sides with great beers. This is not one of them but neither is it a shocker. I have used the term Euro pils many many times here and I believe this is one of them. There is the usual floral nose and metallic taste in a typically light golden body. It is inoffensive enough that it wouldn’t make you huyghe if you had a bit too much of it. The sort of beer you can give to your mate when he lends a hand.

One of the hazards of beer hunting in Sydney is that anything unfamiliar on the store shelves as often as not turns out to be brewed by Huyghe. The Belgian brewer is as prolific as Ryan Adams, and just as hit and miss. They seem to brew several pale lagers/pilseners with an abv of around 5%, which makes me wonder if this isn’t just Rubbel Sexy Lager without the tits. Regardless, I thought this was better than most of their stuff and quite a fair lager, despite the adjuncts. The aroma was sweet, and rich with corn. There’s some peachy fruitiness but it’s battling rainwater and stale malts. Minimal bitterness. As the aroma implied, it’s sweet and fruity. Quite full-bodied for a lager. Apricots and sweetcorn. More flavoursome than most of the lagers on local shelves. Quenching. Bit metallic but better than expected. (330ml bottle from Randwick Village Cellars. BB Sept 2008)

2007 - North American Organic Brewers Festival – Portland, Oregon Golden in color with a light head this had a light aroma. A great session beer with a good balance between hops and malts. A slight citrus notes. A good lawnmower beer.

column1: The Cambridge House Honey Blonde Ale
column5: Nothing too special, but this isn’t my favorite style. Well balanced, just enough malt and hop to make it pleasant but not distinguished. Some light honey flavors that blend well, nothing too sweet or heavy. Very much enjoyable and forgettable.

column1: The Cambridge House Honey Blonde Ale
column5: Draught @ Cambridge House: This one pours a hazy orangish-golden color. There was only a small white head that didn’t linger. It left some lacing. The aroma is definitely on the mild side. There some sweet notes, most likely from the honey as well as some grassiness. The taste is quite smooth. There was some sweetness from the honey, as well as some dryness in the finish. A really nice session beer.

Tap @ Powerhouse brewpub. Clear amber pour with a minimal white head leaving moderate lace. Smoky, alcohol nose leads into an immediate smoky start which quickly mellows into a pleasant malty body. The medium weight, lightly carbonated body has pepper, toast and faint cherry flavors. I had this rauchbier fresh at The Powerhouse when it was first released in summer ’10 and liked it then despite the marked smoke dominance. It has mellowed beautifully into a coherent, tasty lager. One of the best lagers I’ve ever had and the best rauchbier to date.

Luminous amber with a slight head. Light bacon nose and just a well-rounded smokiness to the aroma. Nicely smoked body with a middle range maltiness and touches of bacon. Warming quality. Well done and quite enjoyable.
It’s not often that you can find an easy drinking Rauchbier. Great smoke character and firm malt backbone. Not a quaffer, but definitely a sipper. Smoke is evident but not overdone/overpowering.

Sampled this one on draught at the brewpub in Puyallup, WA. Pours to a bright, deep amber color, with a soapy, white head that fades, and a moderate carbonation. The nose on this beer is fantastic, with big, pungent, salty, sooty, smoky aromas. The palate is firm, with good, clean, toasty and nutty malt flavors, paired with a really delicious smoky/bacon flavor from the rauch malt. This beer finishes with more really great nutty, smoky, and salty flavor, and then ends with a dry, smoky flavor that lingers. Outstanding, very authentic, domestic example of rauch bier, that pulls no punches. You really get a lot of smoked malt aromas and flavors and this one, so this beer is not for the timid. For those of us who love the style, this beer does not dissapoint.

On tap at the brewery. Appears to be based off a standard Marzen. Aroma is highly smoke forward with just a light touch of sweet malt. Smoke is a bit overpowering, carrying a lot of bacon, maybe even saltiness, and obscuring any hop character. Beer is a clear light copper with a low white head. Flavor is less somkey than the aroma, with an even blend of smoke and roast malt. Flavor is lightly bitter with marginal sweetness. Texture is medium bodied with medium carb feel and a very light finish. Overall an interesting beer, but the smokiness in the nose is just too high. The flavor could use some hoppiness to add balance as well. Worth trying, but you probably won’t have more than one unless it’s paired with just the right dish.

column4: Prince Edward Island Brewing Company (The Gahan House)
column5: Great looking beer with huge head and clear brown body. Aroma is soft hops of no further uniqueness. Hoppy flavour of little complexity but has a bitter lingering finish. Not my favourite kind of ipa.

column4: Prince Edward Island Brewing Company (The Gahan House)
column5: Where and how: big trip East Coast 2017 – on tap at brewpub Aroma muted nose, especially for such style. Straight, simple hop set up , noted with citrus. Bland. Appearance : Top: medium sized top, defined rings, average retention. Base: light amber, almost clear Palate : medium plus bodied, average carbonation. Long finish. Taste: More hop presence in flavor than in aroma zesty, citrusy with sweeter backing. Straight simple rendering.

column4: Prince Edward Island Brewing Company (The Gahan House)
column5: While vacationing on PEI and eating at the Row House Lobster Company in Charlottetown, I had this beer on tap. It poured clear copper with a fluffy off-white head and some lacing. Aroma: brown sugar, sweetened dried citrus, some pine. Flavor: caramel, blood orange, pine resins. Mouthfeel: medium-bodied. I prefer a more bitter IPA, although this is tasty enough if you like malt-forward IPAs.

column4: Prince Edward Island Brewing Company (The Gahan House)
column5: On tap. Pours a clear deep amber with a medium, frothy, long lasting, off-white head that leaves plenty of lace. Sweet aroma of caramel malt, tropical fruit, citrus, floral and pine. Sweet flavour of biscuit malt, caramel, lemon rind and pine resin with a crisp, dry, bitter grass finish. Medium body with a slick, oily texture and average carbonation. Not bad.

column4: Prince Edward Island Brewing Company (The Gahan House)
column5: On tap at the Malpeque Oyster Barn. Pours a clear orange gold with a white head that dissipates to the edges. Aroma has bread and earthy citrus with a bit of grass backing. Flavor has more of a bitter citrus note with a slight earthiness and a grain backbone.

column4: Prince Edward Island Brewing Company (The Gahan House)
column5: On tap at the Gahan House, Halifax NS. A rich golden amber colour with a loose cream head; spicy hop taste with a trace of cinnamon; nicely balanced with a toffee finish.

column4: Prince Edward Island Brewing Company (The Gahan House)
column5: Draft at the brewery. Hazy red body, small white head. He aroma has some fruits, the taste is spicy as well. Quite interesting, very balanced.

column4: Prince Edward Island Brewing Company (The Gahan House)
column5: I love this beer. It really won me over with its taste. Keep up the great work Gahan breweries.

column4: Prince Edward Island Brewing Company (The Gahan House)
column5: 500 ml bottle via family, served quite cool in a tulip glass. App.: Clear deep amber with a full off-white head. Aroma: Herbal, woodsy, a touch minty, eucalyptus, a bit of bread crust as malt support, clean yeast. Palate: Medium to medium+ body with moderate to moderate+ carbonation. Flav.: Quite herbal with the same eucalyptus/minty note, bread crust, a little earthy, dry British maltiness, almost a honey-like note; dry with moderate+ bitterness and a bread crust and herbal/eucalyptus/minty finish. A little different, not too bad.

Tap. Lightly malty aroma. Hardly anything else though. Pours almost a maroon colour, thin white head, next to no lacing. Not much plum flavor. Reminds me of the wee heavy just for the sheer malty flavor of the first sip. After that not much sticks out. Some floral notes, a little fruitiness but nothing very distinctive.

(Draught) Lasting creamy white head with a mildly carbonated amber body. Nose of Mild malt and a light bready iodine flavour. Finish with a milky carbonate palate. Average but an interesting twist to fruit beers.

At Bushwakkers. Taster. Clear golden color with big foamy head. Smells of grassy fields, light spruce and candy apple. Taste is hay grass, apple and some caramel. Low carbonation. Smooth, not too bitter. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Dark yellow, half inch head. Lots of carbonation bubbles. Nose is Lemon, hops, grass and barley. Taste is grassy with a nice bit of bitterness. Lemon and malt in the aftertaste. Slight lingering bitter finish. Too much carbonation and too much grassy/earthyness to it.

Bottled sample via paco. Pale amber in colour with moderate carbonation. Aromas of both earthy and slightly floral hops, light malt, and a hint of toffee. Fairly light bodied, with the earthy hops dominating the palate. There’s also a slightly lemony element too. Not a whole lot of malt flavor. Firm bitterness, and a bit too much carbonation. Not exactly a traditional bitter, but still one you could drink a fair bit of and enjoy.
(Draught) Thin, creamy white head with an amber body. Nose is nicely balanced of malt and bitter hops. Smooth, tasty palate of maltiness. Great lasting bitter hop finish. One of Bushwakker’s finest.
Pours chestnut with a two finger tan head. Aroma is dried fruit and roast. Taste is raisin and light caramel, moving to roast and light nuttiness. Finish is toasty.

6 oz. short pour at the source. Little warm for a scotch ale, but I considered it my dessert. Pours a muddled red/brown with a thin beige ring. Light smoky/peat aroma with a buttery maple sweetness. Smokiness almost goes away in the flavor and it’s not as sweet as some in the style. More light maple. Thinner in body than I would have expected. Still quite nice.

On draught at the brewery, pours murky brown red, small head. Nose has fairly well integrated smoke notes, some sweet fruit, dried apricot, and light maple spice. However on the palate the smoke is very overly heavy and dominates in an unpleasant way, leading to notes of permanent marker and paint. The finish is sticky campfire, sweet bready maple. Not good.
On draft at brewery, ah this one was fantastic the smoked malt added a perfect touch that was just another complete level of flavor

Dark Brown pour with amber edges, little to no head. Aroma is very sweet, maple syrup, some booze. Mouthfeel is a bit slippery, syrupy. Flavor is dominated by maple syrup sweetness and a touch of vanilla bean. Full flavored, but lacking the peatiness that I love in this style of ale. Meh, relatively one dimensional but pleasant

On tap at the brewpub. Murky brown with no head. I didn’t much care for this. Like a Scotch brewed for the masses. Mild caramel and really light peat, a whiff of smoke. Mild and uninteresting. Whatever.

Draught, sample @ brewpub. Believe this might have been past its prime or just off...Deep dark amber. Aroma of bubblegum borders on putrid. It’s all wrong. The pieces are all there: caramel, vanilla bean, and toffee, but they never come together and it’s thin and unsatisfying. Can sense the potential.

Pours a brown color with ruby highlights and a ring of white lace. Strong aroma of toffee and earthy malt. Very good flavor of burnt caramel and earthy malt. The body is light and liquorous while the carbonation is moderate. This scotch ale is not very complex but highly enjoyable.

Draft at the brewpub - Poured a cloudy brown/amber in color with a light tan head that held up for a while. Aroma is strong of caramel and brown sugar with a hint of smokiness. Flavor is quite sweet, but not overpowering. Hint of smoke in the background. Alcohol is well hidden. I really liked this beer...

(Draft @ brewpub) More nice liquid malt candy from Portsmouth...Served in a tulip. Dark reddish amber body with less than a finger of biege head (as an aside I think Portsmouth falls prone to serving their beers too cold hence the presentation is not what it could be and also some time needs to elapse before one can smell/taste). Aroma is sweet dark fruity toffee and caramel. Mouthfeel is full, smooth and a little sticky. Not really an exceptional palate but something about it still quite inviting. Light, weepy rings of lacing. Flavor is sweet caramel, toffee and hints of dark fruit. Just as I was about to give up on it as actually being a Scotch ale a subtle peat smokiness emerges as it warms. Nicely warming beer but ABV well-hidden otherwise. This is not quite up to the level of their barleywines, Imp stout or mead but still quite a nice sipper. Kind of subtle. Perhaps not a classic Scotch ale but I enjoyed it as a beer.

Draught pint at the brewpub, mid-May 2007. Opaque apricot with no head....earthy-piney aroma with plenty of caramel as it warms up, faint English-y hop notes, light dry yeast....light refreshing, citric-hop dominated, moderately sweet at the front but it dries out and dulls a bit too much at the finish....it’s quite drinkable but pretty darn ordinary overall.

Cask conditioned at the North Riding Hotel, Scarborough. ABV was 4.2%. Golden colour, creamy head, nice lacing. Fruity aroma, pineapple, a hint of sulphur. The flavour is reasonably hoppy but not very complex, still okay.

Cask conditioned at the North Riding Hotel, Scarborough. The ABV was 3.8%. Copper coloured beer, creamy light tan head. Malty aroma, notes of toffee. Malty flavour, smooth mouthfeel, some caramel, dry hops in the finish. Okay. I suppose the name of the beer suggests that this is a mild, but to me it’s a typical Northern English malty bitter.
Torquay ’Spoons. Thin and murky gold pint. Lace but no flavour. Distant currants. Very poor, almost water.
cask ... golden ... light hop ... slight medicinal ... very hoppy ... bit of that gold hop that im not fond of. anyone know hwat hops this uses. to help identify what one i dont like :-)
JDW, Rochester Dry and rusty with a hop pellet bitterness. Drinkable, but a little serious and dull.
A Mes rate: Cask at Baker Street ’Spoons. Standard bitter type looks. Malty herbacious nose. More malt in the flavour with some tea and a slight bitterness. Acrid finish. Poor beer.
Golden colour with a fair amount of white head that stays. Hop aroma, with a juicey fruit flavour well balanced with hop bitterness. A slightly spicey aftertaste. Very drinkable.
Cask conditioned at The Buck Inn, Whitby. ABV was 4.1%. Golden colour, creamy head. Fruity aroma. Extremely smooth flavour, low bitterness.

column2: New Brunswick, New Jersey, United States
column5: On tap. Pours black with off white head. Aroma is of dark fruit and toasted malt. Body is medium and crisp. Taste is of coffee, toasted malt, herbal hops and some fruit. Long almost dry finish. Good brew.

column2: New Brunswick, New Jersey, United States
column5: I had it on tap in a sampler glass. It pours dark brown with a tan head. The aroma is coffee, chocolate, and vanilla. The taste is the same. There was a nice, roasted bitterness. The sweetness was nice and subtle. This was really good.

column2: New Brunswick, New Jersey, United States
column5: Aroma: earthy, malty. Mold. App; dark black, very little head. Taste, mineral, coffee, Feel, low carbonation, light feel. A Nice dark sipping beer.

column2: New Brunswick, New Jersey, United States
column5: On tap at the Harvest Moon Brew Pub in New Brunswick. Poured a dark brown color with a small sized off white head. Roasty, chocolate, lighter vanilla, and lighter coffee.

column2: New Brunswick, New Jersey, United States
column5: Served on draft at the brewpub. Pours a clear dark brown color with a large creamy brown head. Poor head retention. Aroma of roasted malts, chocolate, sweet coffee notes. The taste is roasted malts, nutty notes and herbal hops. Medium bodied.

column2: New Brunswick, New Jersey, United States
column5: On tap at Harvest Moon. Pours a deep dark brown with a thin white head. Sweet roast, almost the faintest hint of bacon and smoke on the nose. Sweet caramel and roast. Cocoa and roast, light plum and prune. Sweet and malty, plum. Cocoa on the finish.

column2: New Brunswick, New Jersey, United States
column5: Tap @ the brewpub. Just listed as a Schwarzbier without the Joe. The beer was clear and a very deep brown with a tan head. Mild coffee notes to the aroma with semi-sweet roasted malt. Coffee flavor. Light to medium bodied. Semi-sweet finish.

column2: New Brunswick, New Jersey, United States
column5: on tap-pours a light tan head and black color. Aroma is mild dark malt, dark fruit. Taste is dark malt-chocolate, smoky, over roasted-charcoal, woody, faint raspberry. Very stout like. OK carbonation.
Tap at SOPP 2011, Helsinki. Vintage 2011. Originally rated 30072011. Colour is reddish brown with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Fruits, alcohol, sweetness and malts.

Draught at SOPP 2011, Helsinki, Finland. 10.7%. 2005 vintage. Hazy dark reddish brown colour with tiny light tan head. Strong malt, some berries, dark fruits, strong alcohol and port wine in quite vinous aroma. Berries, sweet fruity hops, dark fruits and Play-Doh in complex vinous flavour. Thick and rich and still quite drinkable.

Tap @ SOPP Helsinki. Pours murky deep mahogany amber with minimal tanned head. Excellent fullbodied aroma of sweet malts, caramel, raisins, fidges, dried fruits. Flavor is acidy sweet, much as great as the aroma. Finishes longlived sweet fruity and hoppy. One of the best barley wines I’ve had.

Draught @SOPP 2011. Vintage 2005. Poured murky brown with no head. Huge sweet fruity, raisin aroma. Flavor is ultra sweet, raisins and malt, leading to a long warming sweet finish with some alcohol. Way too sweet for me to be really enjoyable.

2005 vintage Draught @ SOPP 2011. Pours reddish orange with a minimal sticky head. Aroma has notes of malts, raisin, alcohol and slightly fruits. Strong malty and sweet taste with notes of raisin and fruits. Long lasting, warming finish. Full bodied, no carbonation. Perhaps aged a bit too long, slightly unbalanced.

(2005 vintage, Draught at Vihreä Haltiatar, Jyväskylä, on 2009-04-03) Amber and clear. Small white head. Sweetness, raisin, malts and hint of berries in aroma. Full bodied and bit dry palte with little carbonation and warmth from alcohol. Malts, sweetness, light bitterness, raisin, bit of fruitiness, light sourness and some berries in taste. Malty aftertastes. Despite the sourness this beer has aged well.
Draught at OpusK December 2007 Colour:hazy, dark orange red Flavor:very malty, fruits, alcohol tastes through Good bye old good Friend!

Draught at Vihreä Haltiatar, Jyväskylä (under name Standin Barley Wine 2005). Slightly hazy mahagony color. Vinous, yeasty, bready and berryish aroma. Sweetish, yeasty, bready and very vinous flavor with roasty notes, berries, caramel, toffee and port wine. Repulsive yeasty note bothers me.

Dark brown colored, little yellow head. Rich raisinny BW-aroma with sweetness dominating, alcohol comes up nicely. Lemon, toffee and chocolate also here. Near full bodied. Flavor has also alcohol even better hided than in aroma, sweetness and raisins dominating, some port-vinous tones also come up. Hints of cardboard here, still not as much as in 2001-version. Excellent brew.

Draught (Gallows Bird, Espoo, Kekri 2007) Flat, opaque ruddy brown. Wonderful sweet portwine raisin aroma. Amazing tangy sour alcoholic malty taste, sticky and punchy. Full of medium-roasted malts, full of tangy hops, and full of dark fruits - plum, cherry, raisins, and more raisins. Heavenly and tempting - just say yes! The finish is warming and hugely fruity. Earlier Rating: 6/17/2007 Total Score: 4.4 Draught (Black Door, Helsinki) Dark reddy brown, thin off-white head. Port-wine and chocolate on the nose. Ginger and coffee details in the taste sit above a sticky sweet full-bodied malty body. Very complex and very well balanced. Finish has everything - ginger, burnt caramel. Astoundingly delicious beer, hyvä StaPa!

PET láhev 1500 ml. Aroma je velmi výraznì zázvorové. Pìna je do hnìda, jemná, støednì vysoká a nedržící. Barva samotného piva je mìdìná a kalná. Chu má výrazný nádech zázvoru, finiš je støednì hoøký a držící. V ústech pivo pùsobí plnì, má støední øíz a je dobøe pitelné. Jedná se o zajímavé pivo dobøe korespondující se svým názvem.
Bottle from brewery. Slightly hazy amber colour. Aroma of strong ginger, less caramel, cinnamon, grassy hops. Taste is medium bitter, light sweet. Finish gingery bitter.
strong ginger nice aroma, red, brown, hazy, frothy, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body, soft carbonation, creamy, slick feel, long finish,
150 cl PET bottle purchased at the brew pub On May 21, 2009 Cloudy brown color, small tan head. Spicy, ginger, nettle, herbal scent. Ginger, cinnamon, herbal taste. Moussy mouthfeel, low bitterness.

1.5l bottle from the brewery, drunk on the bus back to plzen. really fresh and authentic ginger root aroma, not over-sweet, still has some hop bitterness, mellow texture. i was a bit scared of this beer but it turned out to be a winner

on tap at the brewery. Zazvorove pivo means beer with ginger. Semi-dark colour, spicy nose. Spicy taste indeed, malty and very gingery, quite fiery. Hops is there too. Not sweet, well balanced beer, which is quite interesting because of the exotic ginger flavours.

On tap Judge Baldwins in Colorado Springs. Clear light yellow. effervescent bubbles that fade rapidly. Leans sweet. Corny. No bitterness. Hint of dish towel yeasty aroma. Very watery. Low to no flavor. 2.1-2.2.
On tap at Judge Baldwins in CO Springs, CO. Watery yellow beer wiht no head or carbonation. Slightly sweet body with a grainy taste.

Bottle. Black colour with a tan head. Aroma is soya sauce, licorice, coffee, whiskey. Flavour is soya sauce, licorice, coffee, alcohol, chocoalte. Full body. A litte bit oxidation but still a very nice beer.
Bottle at Craig’s Brewdog vintage tasting. Pours black, rich, chocolate, whisky, dry, sweet.
Almost black of color with a small brown head.. An aroma of whisky, prunes, chocolate and weak liqurice. A flavor of liqurce, prunes, weak soy sauce and bitterness from the malt.

Bottle @ fonefan tasting courtesy of Enjoyit. Black with a small beige head. Aroma is sweet, roasted malt, oxidized, chocolate and whisky. Flavor is quite sweet and rather bitter. Sweet and rather bitter finish. 050714

Bottle, Batch #002,8%. Almost blackwith no head. Aroma is roasted malts, chocolate, vinous, little whisky and soy. Flavour is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, vinous, soy, little oxydized, little sticky, little whisky, medium sweet and a little bitter.

Imperial Stout which has been matured in specially selected Scottish Grain whisky casks resulting in a complex vanilla overload and a unique whisky and beer fusion. Das Bier im Glas ist tiefschwarz, der Geruch ist typisch für ein Imperial Stout – schön röstmalzig-schokoladig mit leichter alkoholischer Note. Von Whisky keine Spur. Schon der erste schluck ist umwerfend aromenreich und komplex, wie ein guter Whisky – Vanille, Holz und dazu die schokoladige Kaffee-Note vom Imperial Stout.
