0,5 l bottle BB 21. Feb 15 caramel, cereal, citrus, herbs, golden, clear, frothy + creamy white foam head, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body, oily feel, slick feel, average carbonation,

Mit McTapps geteilt und mal wieder liegen wir bei Dortmunder weit auseinander. Schön süffig ist es, dazu buttrige Konsistent und ein Hauch von Vanille in der MItte. Sehr trinkbar, mild, ausgewogen. Helle Biere können so einfach und gut sein.,

Bottle from Dilo in Bochum. Pours out in a clear golden colour with low ehad and medium body. Aroma of mild hops and straw. Taste of mild hops, grains, straw, light malt, bread and wheat. Grainy-bready finish. Drinkable, yet nothing special.
# 392; 8/2016. Tmavý ležák s nižší plností. Nevýrazný, sladový, mírnì karamelový, dosti sladký.

Dunkler, kaum süßer Malzantrunk mit passendem herben Beiton. Mild würzig, süffig, die Malzigkeit nimmt ab, es bleibt eine dunkle Getreidigkeit. Steigend herb, schnell abflachender Nachgeschmack. 9/10/9/8/8/9

Bottle - clear, very dark brown color, thick head that disappears completely. Aromas of toffee, dark malts chocolate. Body is watery, carbonation is near to nonexistent. Finish is very mild. A bit boring.

Bottled, from Biershp Bayern. Clear mahogany colour, mid sized head. Light toasty nose. Sweet with medium body and well rounded mouthfeel. Toast and caramel, silky but sweet and very mild. Almost no bitterness.

Brown color beer with a beige big and frothy lasting head. Aroma is strong caramel with notes of roasted malt, bread and wet wood. Flavor is very sweet with light bitterness notes. Thick and sticky body with a low carbonation. Long sweet end.

500 ml bottle. Pours a dark brown colour with a small head. Aroma of toasted malts, nuttiness and toffee. Flavour of rich toasted malts, bread, mild sweetness and interesting sesame seed notes. Medium bodied. Good drinkability. Nice work.

Bottled (from bierzwerg.de). Deep ambery brown colour with a mediumsied off-white head. Aroma is sweet malts, mild caramel, toffee and some slight grassy/floral notes. Flavour is very similar in a nice balance. A bit towards the sweeter side, but still not overly sweet.

0,5 l bottle BB 04. Aug. 14. Red-Brown color, clear and with a frosty tan foam head. bread, cereal, herbs, light sweetness, medium bitterness, lightly sour, medium body, oily feel, slick feel, soft carbonation,
Rötlichbraunes Bier mit schöner Schaumkrone. Geruch leicht röstmalzig, Karamell. Geschmack röstmalzig süß, leicht schokoladig. Süffiges dunkles Bier.

Bottle looks simple but good. Beer in the glass dark brown, nice head. Starts mild-malty, modest roasty, not too dry. Hints of liquorice and chocolate. Soft-malty finish, not too intense. Really nice!
50cl bottle. A clear golden beer with a small white head. Aroma of moderate sweet grainy malt and straw. Taste of straw, grainy malt, dry grains, mild spicy bitterness.

“Münster Hell“, Flasche direkt vom Brauer in Chammünster, im Anblick des (unbedingt sehenswerten) Ur-Münsters verkostet. - In der Nase milder aber für ein Helles außerordentlich aromatischer Hopfen. - Geschmack kernig hellmalzig mit charakteristischer Gerstennote, fast etwas erdig oder wurzelig. Milde aber sehr aromatische Hopfung mit Kräutern, Eukalyptus und einer Spur Zitronenschale. Äußerst dezente Malzsüße, auch ohne die übliche pappige Weißbrotigkeit. Mild rezent, leicht trocken. Langer kräuteriger Nachtrunk. - Außerordentliches Helles, mit mehr Charakter als so manches Supermarkt-Pilsner.
Bottle @ Hopfen & Malz, Berlin. Pours cloudy Pale yellow with a white head. Grain, Almond and heavy diacetyl. Quite buttery. Paperbag in the back. BB 01/17
Aroma is dry, little woody, Appearance is golden with 3-fingerfoam, taste light bitter, mediumbody, some ribes coming up,
Pours gold with a creamy white head. Bready aroma. Flavor is sweet and bready with only a hint of nobility.

It’s golden with a creamy, white head. The aroma has notes of bread, malt, newly harvested grain and flower. The moderately sweet flavor has notes just like the aroma, only more intensive. The finish is sweetish and slightly dry - pleasant!

(bottle) Slightly hazy, golden coloured hue with yeast-floaties and a medium-sized foamy white head. Slightly dusty, moderately sweet grainy malt aroma with notes of hay, honey and a touch of barnyard, accompanied by shy herbal hops. Light-bitter flavour, light to medium bodied; medium carbonation. Grainy malty taste, slightly chalky mouthfeel; dry, slightly bitter and a bit citrousy hoppy finish. Unspectacular brew, but also well-balanced and pretty likeable (11.07.07).

Bottle (courtesy of Quack-Duck): Golden, a bit unclear, bigger fluffy white head; spicy citrousy-hoppy and solid grainy nose; light to medium bodied, delicate sweet-bitter flavour, soft MF; citrousy-grainy finish with a light bitterness. Good and unspectacular.........

bottle, bought at the brewery. This brewery was founded in 1377. Golden yelow, large and creamy head. Malty nose. Malty flavour, spicy and hoppy in the finish. There is a flavour that reminds me of young, not yet readily fermented wine available in the wine growing regions of Southern Germany in autumn. The carbonation also reminds me of that, very fine and tiny bubbles, which makes the palate rather attractive.
50cl bottle. A clear pale golden beer with a white head. aroma of mid sweet grainy malt, hay and mild spicy hops. taste of straw, grains, pale malt, hay, mild spicy hoppy finish.
0,5 l bottle BB 23.12.14 pale, clear, minimal head, white foam, bread, hay, cereal, citrus, herbs, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body, oily feel, slick feel, average carbonation,

50 cl bottle @ Timo A. BBE 23.09.2014. Pours clear pale golden color with a small head. Grassy, slightly fruity and pale malty. Fruity flavor, some pale malty notes, hay and some herbal notes. Slick palate, short dry finish. 3214

500 ml bottle. Thanks Timo A. Pours a yellow colour with a small head. Aroma of grains, some citrus and grass. Flavour of grassy bitterness, some grains, mild citrusy notes, herbs and bread. Light bodied and a herbal, bitter, finish. Refreshing and nice. BBE is tomorrow, but this is in mint condition.
It’s golden with a creamy, white head. The aroma has lovely notes of malt, straw, flower, and the same notes are found in the slightly sweet and pleasant flavor. The finish is dry.

(bottle, from Quack-Duck) Light-hazy, greenish golden colour with a medium-sized foamy white head. Sweet, grainy and cereal-like aroma with a present herbal hoppy blend. Moderately sweet flavour, medium to light bodied, crispy mf. Strawy, grainy taste with a touch of honey and light herbal notes; moderately dry, malty and slightly bitter finish.

bottle, bought at the brewery. Clear golden yellow, large and very persistent head. Malty aroma. Malty beginning and middle, followed by an increasingly hoppy finish and aftertaste. Bitter-sweet character. Ver full-bodied. Hints of mediterranean herbs in the finish and aftertaste.

Bottle (donated by Quack-Duck !): Greenish-golden, quite persistent and lacing white head; solid sweet-grainy nose, not without the addition of spicy hops; robust sweet-bitter flavour, medium-bodied; solid sweet hoppy-grainy finish. Superb, very well crafted Märzen..........

Bottle 500ml. @ home. [ As Falterbräu Drachselsried Arber Weisse ]. Murky to hazy matt medium yellow orange colour with a average to large, frothy - creamy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, wheat, moderate yeasty, fruity yeast, weizen yeast, banana, clove. Flavor is moderate sweet and light bitter with a average to long duration, weizen yeast, banana, clove, fruity yeast, sweet yeast. Body is medium, texture is watery - creamy, carbonation is soft. [20190211] 6-3-6-3-13
50cl bottle from a Edeka in Drachselsried. A hazy orange golden beer with a white head. Aroma of clove and wheat malt. Taste of clove, spices, some phenols, wheat. Good!
Tap @ Hotel Mooshof Bodenmais. Golden color. Cloudy. Tangerine and soft herbal notes in the aroma. Banana, tangerine and soft yeasty notes in the flavor. Quite drinkable in the blistering heat.
0.5 l bottle at Timo A’s. Hazy yellow brown color. Aromas of clove and pepper. Dry grainy and spicy taste with clove, pepper, lemon. Nice refreshing citrusy weizen.

It’s unclear golden with a huge, creamy, white head. The aroma has notes of yeast, banana and wheat, and so does the sweet flavor. It’s harmonic, but not overly powerful. The finish is slightly dry. Quite nice.

(bottle, with thanks to Quack-Duck) Hazy, light-orange colour with a rocky foamy white head. Yeasty, sweetish wheat-malty nose with citrus and banana and fortunately restrained clovy, spicy notes. Slightly sweet, slightly acidic flavour, light bodied with a silky mouthfeel. Wheaty, slightly grainy taste, citrus-fruity with faint notes of banana; moderately sweet and slightly sour finish. Refreshing Hefeweizen, otherwise pretty unspectacular.

bottle, bought at the brewery. Pale yelow colour, slightly cloudy. Large head. Very lively and visible carbonation. Aroma of citurs fruits. Fruity flavour with hints of lemon and banana, yeasty, malty, slightly hoppy, especially in the finish.

Bottle at Granite City. It pours hay golden with a thick white head. The aroma is bread, straw, very grassy, leaves, light honey, hay and floral notes. The taste is crisp, dry, pretty bitter actually, clean, metallic twang, freshly cut grass, hint of soapy citrus and peppery spice with a firm and dry finish. Medium body and moderate, foamy carbonation. Tastes fresh and bright. Way more bitter than expected. Decent stuff actually.
0,5l Bottle from St Margaret's Hopes shop. Nimbuszkulcsízü basztard lágerfajzat.

Bottle. Pale Orangey Gold in colour. Fruity; citrus - orange, grapefruit. Hoppy; grassy hops. Malty; caramel, toffee, wheat malts. Nice fruit/hop/malt balance. Sweet fruity malty throughout. Very drinkable. (2010-04)
500ml bottle at home, from Aldi, Ayr Road, Prestwick (festival beer)(bb 31 Dec 2016), floral, fruity, grain aroma, straw with a thin white head, grapefruit, grain, sweet malty, quite gassy.
smells like grass with maybe a hint of lemon, Pale gold with white frothy head, rather better than i was hoping a nice lemony flavour that sweet and cloying in a good way, nice mouthfeel too.
Bottle at home. Pours golden, nose is grassy, floral, taste is light citrus.

Crystal clear golden colour with a lasting fine fluffy head; good lacings. On the nose subtle aromas of wheat, floral citrus notes and hints of barnyard arise. On the palate the beer offer at first a light lively texture which fades quickly into a palate coating velvetness. Flavours of floral citrus hops are subtley lingerin gon the palate. Medium bodied with a short-medium well balanced finish. Good session beer!
500 ml bottle, sainsburys. Not as nice as I remember it from the last time I drank this, though still a fine beer. Slightly over bitter this time making it a little less refreshing.
Aroma: butter and floral notes Flavor: floral bitterness and a aftertaste of butter. Color: amber with a white head.
Bottle from Voldby. Light hazy golden with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty and light hoppy - grass. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and moderate bitter finish. 170514
Draught@Readin BF. Light, soft and slightly leafy character. Some soft juicy pear acidity comes through in the finish. Quite drinkable, but not the best perry i have had.

Bag in a box at Reading BF 07. Gold/silver colour with no head. Slight haze. Fairly juicy, peary, fleshy for a dry perry. Got that vinegar aroma. Very drinkable though. I like it. Good dryness but lacks tannin and firmness.
Cask@Readin BF. Grainy malt notes are the first thing i pick up in the flavour. Slightly sour character. Um, i didn’t get much hops in this, quite grainy/malty i thought.
Cask gravity at Reading BF 07. Haze amber with thin beige head. Farty aroma, but so much better in mouth. Bit of citrus, syrupy citrus, quite dry, almost cidery.

Many thanks to Erzengel for sharing! A clear ruby brown beer with a mid-sized most good lasting beige head. Aroma of mild sweet red malt, dark malt, raisins. Taste of red malt, red fruits, raisins, caramel, medium bitterness.

500ml bottle from Wrekin Whiskies, Shrewsbury. Pours a deep chestnut amber, off-white head. Good caramel nose, nice soft nutty caramel character to taste with additional burnt brown sugar. Smooth, balanced, delicious Scottish Ale.

Many thanks to minutemat for this bottle. Malty caramel beginning. Fresh and mild, moderate bitter. Slightly caramelly sweetish, round and smooth, moderate bitter. Nice mild malty darker aftertaste. Nice dry caramelly finish.
0,5l bottle from St Margaret's Hopes shop. Scotch or Scottish bitter. Definitely.

Bottle. Atlas’s take on a Scottish 80/- Ale - Ruby in colour. Malty; sweet roasty malts, caramel, toffee, chocolate. Fruity; citrus, berries. Hoppy; floral and grassy hops. Sweet roast malty throughout. Dry malty finish. Very drinkable. (2010-03)

Bottle from local store in Glencoe 160611. Clear dark copper with a lacing beige head. Aroma of bitter ale with liquorice. Nice palate with typical british ale/ bitter feeling. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle At home clear reddish brown flavour is malt some fruit light toffee dry bitter finish fairly ordinary bitter
Bottle from Voldby. Clear brown with a beige head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel and dark fruit. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate bitter. Sweet and light bitter finish. 060415
Aroma is a bit fruity and malty. Flavour has some light toastiness to it. A fairly dry and bitter finish. Nice balance but not especially memorable.

DAA; Pours moderate, copper with a lasting, lacing, tan head. Aroma is roasted malt, caramel, sweet berries, nuts, spice and light grass. Taste is medium sweet and bitter, light spicy, somewhat lasting. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

Draft at brewpub. Poured hazy brown color with an average frothy white head that was mostly lasting with fair lacing. Moderate toasted malty and citrus aroma. Light to medium body with a sticky texture. Medium balanced flavor with a medium sweet finish of moderate duration.

On tap at the Courthouse Pub in downtown Manitowoc, WI. Pours a cloudy dark amber brown brew with a thick off white head that slowly dissolves to a fine film and good lacing. Aroma of light wheat malt, light molasses with citrus, and just a touch of yeast. Taste is lightly carbonated, medium bodied with a smooth sweet finish. Aftertaste is crisp, clean and sweet/dry; fairly short, but very refreshing.

sampled at Food and Froth. Nice beer, I understand it’s a pickup from a beer recipe from the 60s. We’re going to have to head to Manitowoc to sample some more. Nice and balanced between a malty Lager and something lighter.

Bronze color with a modest off-white head. Malty/grainy aromas perhaps what one would expect from a brew of the 60’s. Corn and pale malt flavors with a light hops presence. Enough malt to keep you interested, but light enough to make you want more.

This is a terrific surprise to see another beer brand of the past has been revived. White Cap beer was last brewed by the Two Rivers Beverage company in Two Rivers, Wisconsin, in 1966. After 40 years later of hibernation, it has returned to Manitowoc. Pours a pale golden yellow brew with a thin white head that dissolves to a fine lacing. Aroma of multi-grain malt with corn, and a slight fruity scent. Taste is light bodied, llightly carbonated, clean and easy drinking. Finish has a little grassy hop bite and very refreshing. A terrific 1960’s light popular style beer. According to the brewmaster, the Liebech family has shared the actual White Cap beer 1950-1960s recipe with the brewery and is continuing to produce this beer of the past.
3.6% amber colour with a good head, sort of a weaker creamy version of Strongarm but not as good.

Draught (keg) at Hogan’s, Darlington. Amber colour, creamy nitro-head. Not much going on here in terms of aroma and flavour. Very low bitterness. Slightly dusty aftertaste. Easy drinking. Must be somewhat better cask conditioned?

column1: Milton Dr Oh (Alright Then Just One More PInt
column5: Cask handpump at Cambridge BF 2007. Golden, slightly yeasty and oily on top but this goes quickly. Flowery and hoppy scent. Bitter and quite a dry finish. Quite a bit of sugar and some acid. Not much in the mouth.

column1: Milton Dr Oh (Alright Then Just One More PInt
column5: Cask conditioned - handpump - Criterion Leicester. A pale beer with a whitish head. It’s quite cloudy and the slightly acidic aroma suggest it’s past its best. The taste has hops and lemony notes, but again there’s some spoiling acidity.

column1: Milton Dr Oh (Alright Then Just One More PInt
column5: Cask gravity at Pembury Tavern. Brewed specially for the Cambridge BF 07 according to the manager. Gold colour with slight haze, thin off white head. Very tangerine/orange citrus. Not a huge fan, but you can see where it’s going.

One of those ’didactic’ ales for hopheads featuring one single hop variety each time (Mikkeller, Alvinne and others have done the same thing before or after this American-style English brewery). Pretty orange blond beer with loose, off-white head and soft pale maltiness, but of course it’s the hops that stars, spicy, citrussy and herbal, ensuring a long, very agreeable finish. Great brew - and obviously a stimulus to try and find all versions.

I have to say this is probably the best beer I have had. I tried it several times at the Oxford, Kentish Town, as well as at a private party. It has an aroma that hits you long before the glass reaches your lips. The main characteristic I can give it is grapefruit, although I have had other beers with presumably this hop which were too much like grapefruit juice, not what I want in a beer! Couldnt get enough of this and downed many pints!

Cask (gravity dispense), St Albans Beer Festival, September 2007. Supposed to be the One Hop beer for May/June 2007 but here it is in September, and Grand Union hasn’t published the running order since August so I don’t really know what is going on with the One Hop series. Anyway, this is a mid gold beer with a loose white head. Lashings of leafy, spicy Simcoe on the nose. Lots of grapefruit and resinous notes in the flavour, although perhaps marginally more laid back than the aroma, with just a hint of biscuity malt. The mouthfeel is crisp, sharp and refreshing. Showcases the Simcoe hop brilliantly in a UK context. Not sure why they repeated this one but I’m sure glad they did.

Cask. At The Wenlock Arms, London. Oh, my - after a week and a half of pretty much nothing but bitters and ESBs, this was quite a welcome change; Golden Ale? Not by half - try IPA, mate! Poured clear gold with an average creamy/frothy lasting white head. What an aroma - lush, acidic, full-on Simcoe resin/lemon funky bitter hoppiness, just enough mild grainy malt to remind you there’s more than hops to it. Taste - well, the malt was more pronounced, definitely fresh cereal grain, strong hops but more evenly balanced than in the aroma. The body seemed light but had that wonderful cask chewiness to it, solidly astringent and high in alpha acidity, with a very long, tenacious hoppy finish and aftertaste - simply terrific, IMHO.
(cask - Coastguard, St. Margarets Bay) pale gold with dense white head, some lace. Citrus hops aroma. Great Simcoe hops flavor. An awesome cask ale.

Gravity, Merton Beer Festival. Bright gold, lots of dense white foam. A stunning clean and bright hop expression; piney, catty, grapefruit hop goodness, reaching out of the glass to slap your face and assert respect. Catty carries over to the flavor, adding cinnamon and mineral. Mouth filling, nose tingling--a really serious hop punch-up at 4.5%! Just enough light toast to counterpoint the hop expression. I suppose it’s odd that the most genius expression of all-American Simcoes I’ve had is an English beer, but maybe not. At any rate, this is it. I’m pining for more...
Cask at Merton. In excellent nick, congrats to Fin. A stunning single hop beer. Perfect for a day outside listening to bands, eatting dodgy burgers. The flavours just went on and on.

Cask at Merton Summer Beer Festival 06-07-07. What a stunner. For me when I had a sneaky taste of this well before we opened this beer and the Bowman Quiver were always likely to be fighting it out to be my favourite, but what a contrast. In the Red corner was the Grand Union Simcoe a beer that was looking for the big knockout it was an out and out impact beer that was exciting, vibrant and a big hitter. In the blue corner was the Bowman Quiver equally exciting but more prepared to go the distance and seeking to come out on top on points, on this occasion the Grand Union Simcoe come out on top but for all it’s attributes it was taken quite a long way by the Quiver. This beer poured golden with a superb clarity, the hoppy nose hit you straight away stunning aroma of grapefruit. The taste just zapped you wow what a zapper the citrus just smacked home, and it didn’t stop there that grapefruit and bitterness just kept on lingering, christ you get your moneys worth with this little beauty you can still taste it for ages afterwards. It reminded me of the old ’You’ve been tangoed advert’, with this beer you really had been Simcoed, it seemed like someone had came up with a half of hollowed out grapefruit and then proceed to rub it all over one’s face and stuff it in the mouth before legging it. I warned people to be wary of what they drank after this as you really needed something that would counteract that bitterness afterwards, when I initially tried this on Thursday I had a couple of more standard gentler bitters after which were totally ruined by this as the bitterness from the Simcoe was still evident in everything I drank, you needed a porter or the Smokestack Lightning after I felt. A truly great bitter, it’s just a shame that it will only be around for this month. This was [b] joint Beer of the Festival along with Bridge of Allan Red Mist [/b]

Cask conditioned at Merton Beer Festival ’07. Amber with white head. For me, the beer of this Festival, beautiful hop aroma, I think the first time I have given a 10 for aroma. I wrote hops **** at the time and why change it, I like what this brewery does in presenting the different ingredients like this. Lemony, grapefruit, dusty and magnificent.

A Mes rate: Cask at the Wenlock. Cracker. Obviously it is all about the hops. Frankly I like the sharpness of the Simcoe. So crisp it almost stings. Lovely dust old character to it. Obviously all the citrus fruits you can think of are there in abundance. Loads of character and gloriously drinkable.
Cask Handpump from the Outside Bar at the Black Horse, Darwen 26/05/2007 Some fruit aroma. Amber mid brown and fruity with a crisp and slightly bitter malt finish.
Cask handpull at Wenlock Arms. Deep russet with lasting deep beige head. Great condition. Some toffeeish malt. Crispish finish. Nice mild. Good choc/toffee. Nice hop finish.

A Mes rate: Cask at the Wenlock. Nice golden brown colour with a slim white head. Grassy American hop nose with a very slight farty note. Flavour is all about the hops too. Grassy and aromatic, almost resinous, piney and woody with more American bitterness in the finish. Good stuff.

Cask handpull at Wenlock Arms. Copper, thin white head. Lovely US hop aroma. Little bit of haze, maybe getting towards end of barrel. Earthy grapefruit. Malts are a bit thin, bit unbalanced. Still, not bad.

Bottle 500ml. w. swing top @ home. [ As Lindner-Bräu Kaitersberg Dunkel ]. Unclear - hazy medium amber colour with a large to huge, frothy, good lacing, mostly to fully lasting, off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, caramel, sweet malt, grain, hay, straw, light bread. Flavor is moderate sweet with a average to long duration, sweet malt, caramel, fruity malt, bread, citric - soured milk. Body is medium, texture is watery, carbonation is soft. [20190210] 5-3-5-3-9
Swing top bottle, thanks to Beerhunter111! Deep dark brown color. Roasty aroma.Malty bready flavor, sweet with chocolate and caramel. Good dunkel, this one. Roast in the finish.

50cl swing top bottle from the brewery. A clear orange brown beer with a off-white head. Aroma of dark caramelish malt, nuts and some spices. Taste of moderate sweet dark caramelish malt, nuts, mild bu, good!
Butelka 0,5l. Bardzo przyjemny aromat s³odowy, karmel, toffi, delikatny chmiel. W smaku toffi, mocniej zaznaczona chmielowa zio³owoœæ. Dobre.
Frisch vom Hahn im Braugasthof getrunken. Tiefes Dunkelbraun mit weißer Schaumkrone. Recht kräftig, im Nachtrunk leichte Röstaromen.

Sampled at the brewpub. Small light brown head. Clear dark amber color. Light roasted malt aroma with a small fruity aroma. Small caramell and light roasted malt taste without giving any residual sweetness, just an enjoyable dunkel. Low-medium bitterness and a dry finish.
Deep brown, almost black colour, large beige head, very creamy. Aroma of dark malts and chocolate.

0,5 l swing top bottle caramel, bread, cereal, roasty, coffee, spruce, citrus, herbs, earthy, brown, clear, frothy, tan foam, light sweetness, medium bitterness, medium body, oily feel, soft carbonation, long finish,

It’s dark brown with a hgue, creamy and lasting head. The aroma has notes of malt, caramel, light dark syrup and a touch of nuts. The flavor is sweet with notes of roasted malt, caramel, light nuts and the finish is slightly roasted bitter. Not very complex, but nice enough.

(swing top bottle) Hazy, dark brown colour with a small tanned foamy head. Light-sweet, nutty and slightly toasted malty nose with notes of caramel, chocolate and a pleasant hoppy blend. Moderately bitter flavour, medium to light bodied with a well-carbonated mouthfeel. Toast-malty taste with a touch of roasted barley and caramel, plus minimal fruity accents, staying in the background; dry-ish, nutty and toasty-bitter finish with a shy hoppy touch. Quaffable Dunkel (25.06.07).

Als “Helles“ vom Faß beim Lindner-Bräu, Kötzting. - Tiefes Goldgelb, klar. - In der Nase blasse Zitrusfrucht. - Im Antrunk schlanke zitrusfruchtige Herbe (Orangenschale) über sauberem hellen Malz mit sparsamer Restsüße und gut abgestimmter zart säuerlicher Note. Schlank, milder rezent; leichte mineralische Härte, die das Bier erst richtig süffig macht. Im Abgang sehr dezente hopfenwürzige Herbe, aber das leicht trockene Finish macht Lust auf mehr. - Sauberes, gut abgelagertes Helles mit dezenter Malzigkeit, etwas zu knapp gehopft. - Hätte mir gern eine Flasche mitgenommen, aber im Brauereiverkauf gab's “nur Koschtn“.

Shining deep gold with sticky-lace foam. Big nose of fresh honey-malt, grain sack, pancakes. Sweet taste, light bitterness, light tangy acidic touch and drying out in finish so you want another gulp to sort out what just happened there, and before you know it a quarter-liter of the stuff is gone. Surprisingly complex but it demands no contemplation or deep thoughts, leaves it up to you.
Frisch vom Hahn im Braugasthof getrunken. Lief dort unter "Helles". Recht würzig und abgerundet.
Sampled at the brewpub as their Helles. Small off white head. Clear yellow color. Firm malty aroma from fresh pilsner malt. Clean and malty taste with small but noticeable hop taste and bitterness.
This one has 2 entries. Bottle @ Hopfen & Malz, Berlin. Green apples, straw and paperbag. Bready malts. Medium bodied.
50cl swing top bottle. Pours clear golden colour with a small good lasting white head. Aroma of pale malt, straw, mild hops. Taste of grainy malt, sweet, straw, mild hops.
Clear pale yellow colour. Small white head. Sweet grainy aroma. Grainy grassy hopppy flavour, bit sweet.
0,5 l bottle BB 08/13 golden, hazy, frothy, tan foam, bread, cereal, herbs, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body, oily feel, slick feel, average carbonation,

It’s warm golden with a creamy, white head. The aroma has notes of bread, newly harvested grain, fruit and malt. The flavor is moderately sweet with notes of flower, fruit, newly harvested grain, malt and a touch of flower and dry straw in the finish. Lovely indeed!

Bottle looks very simple but good. Beer in the glass zippy, small head. Starts fine spicy, modest malty, then more and more soapy-moldy. Finish unbalanced, less spicy. Starts good, but finish too moldy.
Frisch vom Hahn in der Braugaststätte getrunken. Helles Gold mit feinem Schaum. Fein trocken, mit milden Hopfennoten.
Brewery tap. Blonde. Soft grassy notes in the aroma. Thinnish ith some malty notes and a noticeable grassy hopbitterness. Decent.

0.5 l bottle, thanks Timo A! Hazy golden color. Sweet fruity, herbal and honeyish aroma. Sweet, herbal, honeyish and bitter flavor with earthy-herbal hops and some graininess. Medium body, soft carbonation. OK fairly fruity and artisanal kellerpils.

It’s hazy, dark golden with a white head and the aroma has notes of flowerm lat and clower. The flavor has a light sweetness and notes of flower, malt, is fairly dry, just like the finish. well balanced and nice.

Bottle 500ml. w. swing top. Clear medium orange yellow colour with a large, frothy, good lacing, fully lasting, off-white to white head. Aroma is moderate malty, grain, hay, toasted, fruity, light to moderate hoppy, flowers - grass. Flavour is moderate to light heavy sweet and light to moderate bitter with a average to long duration, flowery malt - hops, sweet malt. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20111115]

(swing top bottle) Slightly hazy, pale golden colour with a big and slowly lacing foamy white head. Mildly sweet pale malty and slightly grainy aroma with a distinctively citrus-fruity and flowery hoppy touch. Moderately bitter flavour, light to medium bodied with a crisp carbonation. Dry pale malt-character with citric and slightly herbal accents; dry and moderately bitter hoppy finish with notes of citrus. Pleasant and well-rounded Pilsener. 13.X.10

Bügelverschlußflasche: Pale golden to golden, unclear, mid-sized white lacy foam, that slowly collapses; distinctive herbal and lemony hops in the nose with a good dash of pale malt in the background; moderate dry bitter-sweet flavour, light bodied; slightly lingering pale-malty and aromatic hoppy finish. Great Pils.....

bottle, bought at the brewery. Slightly hazy, large head. Flowery and hoppy nose. Hoppy and slightly bitter taste, hop flavours reminiscent of lemon, flowers and grass. Malty in the background, quite full-bodies. Very pleasant.

Draught. Pours clear pale orange with an average, frothy, white head, somewhat lasting with good lacing. Aroma is heavy malt (caramel, husky grain), heavy hops (perfume, citrus, pine), and heavy yeast (sweat, must). Light bodied, oily texture, average carbonation, and a bitter finish. Long duration, light sweetness, moderate acidity and bitterness. Dirty and sweaty socks steeped in this beer a while.
On draft at Manhattan Beach. Very bitter. floppy and thin. Citrisy, grassy, one dimensional IPA. Tasted strong alcohol content. White head.

This is a pretty good IPA, tasty and well-rounded. It seems a little on the softer, less hoppily pungent side for a West Coast IPA. It is amber with a thin, somewhat off-white head. This slowly shrinks to leave a ring and wispy top plus some pretty nice even rings of lace. The aroma is malty and fruity, a bit juicy, with hints of pine, lemon, grapes and honey. The taste is similar, malty body and fruity sweetness with som wine and grain plus a hint of cracker. It has light, just dominant pine-citrus hop character and bitterness that lightly takes over the finish. Its’s smooth, tasty, has balanced, fairly full flavour and a good character breadth.
Draft at the brewpub. Probably my favorite of the trip. Decent hop aromas off this amber colored beer. Citrus nose gave way to more floral and grassy flavors. Nicely hopped. Very Decent.

Tap @ brewpub: Clear gold with a nice off-white head & sticky lacing. Sweet perfumy hop aroma, but the question I have to ask myself and the brewer at Manhattan Beach is: Is this a pale ale? Because it sure seems like it. The hop presence is mild and kind of papery. More like a Sierra Nevada Pale Ale. The body is full and like a good pale ale, it has a fairly bitter aftertaste. they need to double the hops in this to make it a real standout IPA.
Draught at the pub 03/2008. Floral hops lacing whitish head copper hued golden. Nice sweet full hops bitter finish. Light bodied. Nice IPA.

Sample at the brewpub. Clear yellow-orange color with a medium thin and foamy off-white head with fair retention. Top ring of lace on the glass. Aroma of citrus and pine, plus a touch of malt. Medium-bodied and moderately hoppy with flavors of hops, malt and spices. Oak undertones as well. The finish is hoppy and leaves a bitter aftertaste. Above average overall.

On tap at brewery, 01/07/08. Clear gold with nice head retention (as most of their beers seem to have here). No aroma. Flavor starts with piny hops, segues into a little sweet malt and finishes a little spicy (black pepper). Lingering bitter aftertaste. Okay.

Filtered gold, lingering small head and mild hop aroma. Strong, flavorful hops. A tad oily and lingering, but tasty. Not bitter as in the grapefruit rind, but it finishes with a mixed sweet and chalky bitter hop flavor.

Tap @ Brewpub: Clear bronze, no head light lacing. Nose of sweet and super woody hops, light caramel and plenty of malt. The flavor is puckering, hoppy and nearly cloying, enough flavor and aroma hops but not enough bittering for this level of attenuation.

Draught. Pours black with a small, creamy, light brown head, somewhat lasting with good lacing. Aroma is heavy malt (chocolate, coffee, nutty), light hops (dry grass), average yeast (leather) with notes of tar and dates. Full bodied, slick texture, average carbonation, and a metallic finish. Average duration, light sweetness, acidity, and bitterness.

Tap at MBBC. Pours a very dark brown almost black with a thin white head. Aroma of malt coffee and some chocolate. Flavor of roasted malt milk chocolate and some coffee in the finish. Nice beer but nothing really special at the same time.

Draft at the brewpub. No head on this black pour. Almost no aromas at all. Flavor was decent with some roasted malts up front, and burnt malts on the finish. Touches of Chocolate.... very small touches. Just OK
Tap @ brewpub: Dark brown, no head. It has a thin feel with a roasted nut, charcoal, and earthy aroma. Flavors of charcoal with a slight chocolate flavor. Ok.

Sample at the brewpub. Pours dark brown with a medium thin and creamy beige head that has good retention. Sheet of lacing on the glass. Rich chocolatey aroma with touches of sweet malt and coffee. Medium, smooth body with milk chocolate dominating the flavor, and malt and roasted coffee following behind. The finish is creamy and sweet, with a touch of coffee in the aftertaste. Decent overall, although with a little more balance I would have enjoyed it a lot more.

On tap at brewery, 01/07/08. Hazy brown. After sitting for a few minutes, the strange soda style head is gone. Light aroma of chocolate. Hard to say it any other way, but it has a mild proper porter flavor. Oddly, I didn’t taste any chocolate. Bitterness appears late in flavor. A bit boring.
On tap at brewpub. Big head, black. Nice for a porter in it’s rich body. Minimum chocolate malt flavor, but good.
Tap @ Brewpub: Dark black, nice tan head and lacing. Nose of light roast and sweetness. The flavor is sweet and a thick mouthfeel. Nice pleasant flavor. Finishes dry, not very chocolatey.
Aroma was sweet, of chocolate malts, maybe some coffee too. Appearance was a dark brown, and flavor was bitter sweet. Wasn’t too bad at all.
weak nose. Hints of malasses on the palate with weak hints of chocolate malt. A bit more sour than sweet.
Tap at MBBC. Pours a clear copper color with an off white head. Aroma is of malt bread hops. Taste is malty caramel with some hop bitterness in the finish. Nice ESB.
Draft at the brewery. Not much aromas off this copper colored beer. Smallish head. Very smooth mouth feel. Flavor was malty with just a touch of bitter on the finish. Another average beer.
Tap @ brewpub: Clear amber color with a nice off-white head. Aromas of butter with a tin flavor with a little cola and nuts added in. It had a smooth full body and is a good all around ESB.
Draught at the pub 03/2008. Light amber thin off white lacing head. Floral dry malty flavor quaffable a little bland, lacking any punch. Some lingering bitterness medium body. Aroma subdued barley.
Light copper color, lingering small head. Spice, hop and malt aroma. Rich flavors of malts and hops. Long, bitter spiced hop finish.
Tap @ Brewpub: Bronze/copper, nice head and lacing. Nose of light sweet hops, average malt. The flavor is similar, decent body, nothing stands out though. Hmmm, ok.
Bottle from Beerhunter111, thanks! Golden blonde. Soft floral notes in the aroma. Malty bready floral flavor. Full bodied, especially for a pils. Typical rural Bavarian pilsener.
50cl bottle from the brewery. A clear golden beer with a white head. Aroma of spicy and metallic bitter hops. Taste of spicy and metallic hops, straw, long bitter finish.
It’s golden with a lasting, white head. The aroma has notes of hay, malt and flower. The flavor has a light sweetness and notes of flower, hay, grass and malt, and the finish is dryish.

(bottle) Clear, golden colour with a mid-sized frothy white head, quickly diminishing. Discreet aroma: moderately sweet and grainy nose with a touch of citrus. Slightly sweet flavour, light to medium bodied with medium to light-crispy carbonation. Soft malty base with herbal hops with notes of citrus and a light grainy touch; almost dry, bitter-sweet malty and slightly hoppy finish. Just a decent Pilsener from the south-east of Germany.

Bottle (thanx to Quack-Duck): Golden coloured, small, quickly collapsing white head;, sweet-malty nose with shy citrousy hops and a faint touch of cardboard; moderate sweet-bitter flavour, light bodied; shy bitterness in the finish. Drinkable, but no glorious "Helles"..............
bottle, bought at the brewery. Pale yellow, decent head. Quite malty with flavours of flowery and grassy hops, which ist very pleasant. Hoppy but not bitter, dry finish.
Bottle. Pale yellow color. Aroma of pure honey. Taste is sweet floral honey. Sweet.

Very light golden color. Sweet aroma of tropical fruits and honey, with a whiff of alcohol. Very sweet flavor front to back, with earthy papaya, floral honey and a hint of mint. Nice flavors here, but again very sweet.

This had a very unique texture and taste on the palate. A lot of residual sugar and fruitiness, a bit of eucalyptus, and a slightly menthol character, but not heavy at all on the palate. I am not sure I could drink a lot of this but I loved trying it.
Bottle sample at the Great Alaska Barleywine Festival 2016. Clear reddish amber color. Aroma of soft dusty overripe berries. Taste is dry berries. Very nice.
Bottle at GABBF. Pours clear ruby and still. Aroma is tart berries and sweet honey. Flavor is sweet honey, raspberries, vanilla and a sweet finish. Full body and still.

Bottle. Poured reddish amber color with an average off-white head that diminished slowly with very good legs. Moderate to heavy tart raspberry and floral honey aroma. Medium to abundant body with a sticky texture and good sticky legs. Medium to heavy tart berry sweet flavor and finish of long smooth duration. Interesting solid mead.

Bottle shared by tmoney99. Labeled 12%. Great aroma of raspberry jam, some mild creme, and a touch of honey. Hint of chocolate. Hazy red, slight brownish color. Not really any head. Medium to bigger body. Mild slick. Not too syrupy though. Mild dry in the finish. Moderate to bigger sweet taste, though not cloying. Mild tannic dry bitterness. Mild, pleasant warmth. No burn. Just a touch of natural raspberry tartness. Very tasty melomel. 4-5 oz was the perfect quantity, a nice post-lunch treat.
Nice red pour. I love the sweet raspberry jam flavors up front and its perfectly balanced with just a hint of tartness...almost a granny smith apple flavor. Really a tasty mead.

Sampled several times at the ’11 GABBF. Still with a reddish hue. Nice raspberry jelly aroma. Sweet honey, natural raspberry and sour cherry fruit flavors. There is some cinnimon candy heat. Very nice drink.

The raspberries are very well highlighted in this one. A little bit on the tart side, as I was expecting something a little sweeter. and this is quite spicy, and sour. Still very well done and clean, but I honestly think this could stand to have a bigger honey background, and back off on the fruit a bit. I cannot say for sure, I am just one person talking, and I do not have a lot of experience with melomels.

If you favor fruit forward melomels, this one’s for you. Liquid raspberries in a glass with a touch of honey stirred in. These raspberries come from the fertile slopes of the Talkeetna Mountain Range, in the shadow of Denali. This mead is fun just to look at! Brilliantly clear, radiant, light violet color. Highly reflective meniscus, two ring variance. Heavy, organized legs quick to fall straight down the glass. The full-bodied, smooth, and viscous mouth-feel confirms what the legs are telling you. Spicy, peppery, raspberry aroma with minty, eucalyptus undertones that when combined seems a bit medicinal. Not much honey apparent on the nose. A tangy, acidic, and tart raspberry flavor hits the center of the tongue and hangs there forever. Honey makes a guest appearance after the raspberry diminishes. This mead has a clean, bright, fresh raspberry fruit flavor, but backing off on the fruit would allow the honey to come forward and add more balance. This is a sweet mead but not cloyingly so. Do not mistake this for a dessert only mead. It can hold its own. The fruit flavor dominates and although the fruit flavor is excellent, it leaves the mead somewhat one-dimensional, wonderful, but not particularly complex. Nothing wrong with that.
from backlog...on tap-offwhite-gold. A-grain. T-grain/bready lt malt, some earthy hops.

Location: Draft at Egan & Sons as Quigley Seasonal Ale - IPA, 9/24/14 Aroma: The nose is light, with some pale malts, earthy hops, and a little citrus Appearance: It has an orange colored pour with a thick and frothy head that leaves a coating lace Flavor: The taste is clean and light too. Somewhat hoppy, lightly sweet, bitter finish Palate: Smooth and very creamy mouthfeel, with a soft carbonation, and a long, dry finish Overall Impression: Good, solid beer. The pour is the standout, and the creamy feel makes it rather enjoyable. The rest of the components are solid, but nothing spectacular.

on tap at the pub. lightly cloudy brownish rusty golden color, short light tan head. aroma is pretty straightforward, moderate hops like a little pine cone and grapefruit. flavor is pretty much the same, with a bit os lightly sweet earthy malt for balance. nothing inspirational, but a decent session beer.

Draught (Busch Gardens, Tampa): Pours medium golden with a 1.5 inch white head that lasts 5 minutes. Aroma of a good skunky pils, with malt and saaz hops overpowering. Flavor is bitter and sweet/skunky and a little gummy. Medium body with above average carbonation. Finish is toasty malt, and bitter.
Too light and a little watery, I guess the sunky aroma turned my off, I ’m not much of a pilsner fan anyway
Okay.. very thin appearance, with a slightly skunky aroma.. Flavor: almost none. Palate: comparable to water. Uh...yea.. But its Bohemian!!!! woo-hoo!!

Sampled at GABF 2007. Clear fluorescent yellow with a synthetic head. Slightly grainy aroma. Water bomb thinness. Perhaps a breif dunking of a teabag full of hops into each bottle, but other than that, I’m not sure how this differs from their other gazillion barrel madness.
Draught into Tarpon Spoon footed pilsner on holiday. Not bad for A-B. Notes of citrus in aroma with a clean crisp flavour.

I feel bad rating this beer because i had it on a crisp winter’s night and not a hot summer afternoon, so it really felt out of season as i consumed it. Pours a very pale color with medium head. Aroma is pleasant and mildly floral. Could have wished for a more prominent flavor and aroma but the palate is smooth. Drink this when its 80 degrees plus outside to appreciate it fully. Also disappointed to realize that its produced by AB and not locally brewed (for me at least) in Tarpon Springs, Florida.

On tap in the Hospitality Room at the A-B Brewery, Jacksonville Florida. Clear golden yellow beer with a medium white head that fades after a short while. Light floral hop aroma. Flavor is lightly sweet pale malts, with a good hop flavor, then a clean finish. Fair amount of carbonation. Not spectacular or memorable, but certainly drinkable and decent.

Draft... Clear yellow lager with a mid-sized, frothy, white head that’s... zap!... gone in a flash. Sweet, grainy nose and flavor. Lightly hopped to cut into the sweetness and provide a tiny hop zing. Medium-bodied with lively carbonation. Short, crisp, refreshing finish. Went well with raw oysters and dolphin fish.

On tap at Don’s in Metairie, LA. Served in a frozen mug. This beer was very refreshing, but just not much flavor. A good summer beer. It really tasted like much of the mass produced beer in the U.S. but worth a try.

On tap at Hurricanes in Orlando. Served in a frozen mug, so much of aroma was non existent. Nice golden color nonetheless. Nice roasted malt taste with a good balance of hops. Not bad, even after finding out it was an AB product.

Dark brown with a reddish tinge. Thin creamy mocha coloured head on pouring but disappears almost instantly. Mild roast and chocolate on the nose; milky chocolate perhaps. Not bad. Smooth palate, chocolate and dry roast early, but flavours do fall away somewhat. Looks like a stout at first glance but doesn’t really have the stuffing.

column1: San Diego Mission Trails Pale Ale
column5: On tap at Brewery. Clear golden with a fizzy white head. Faint malty aroma. Crisp slightly citrus taste.

column1: San Diego Mission Trails Pale Ale
column5: On tap @ SDBC - Pours a clear amber color with a small off white head. Light lacing. Has a nice hop flavor and aroma. Light to medium body. Would make a decnt session beer.

column1: San Diego Mission Trails Pale Ale
column5: Aroma is mild citrus and perfumey hops. Poured red/gold with a nice small head. Flavor is mild crisp citrus hops with not alot of malt. Was very carbonated and had a strange after taste that I couldnt put my finger one.

column1: San Diego Mission Trails Pale Ale
column5: Draft at the brewery. Very nice hop smells included grapefruit and other citrus notes. Taste starts smooth with a crisp ending. Very good

column1: San Diego Mission Trails Pale Ale
column5: Bronze copper color with decent head. Aromas like a nicely hopped red. Citrus hops in the flavor as well. Pretty good.

16/VIII/09 - 75cl bottle, shared with my parents and parents-in-law-to-be, during our engagement dinner party @ De Heeren Van Liedekercke, as a gift for our engagement by the owners. Clear amber coloured beer, no head (from picture). Not a lot of details about the aroma or smell, but it was definitely very refreshing, drunk as aperitif in the hot summer sun. Very nice beer.

Bottle @ De Heeren. Pours clear golden with a white head. Aromas of citrus, apples, mouldy dust, apricots, leather, heavy funky cheese. Taste has lots of tart fruity notes. Unripe plums, red apples, gooseberries, cheese, light mouldy dusty cellar, sweet oak. Very different gueuze compared to the older Lindemans I've tried - and very good for its age!
Bottle thanks to Doug. Pours out golden straw color. Nose is funky sour horse blanket barnyard notes and lemon citrus. Tatse is more of the nice dusty barnyard funk bugs and lemon zest.

Bottle @ dhvl. Pours clear golden/Cooper with a white head. Aroma of vinous grapes, dust, cheese, slight Apples, wet hay, slight note of Glue. Taste is sour, light sweet, stonefruits, vinegar, some wierd cheesy - hay alike notes, along with a barnyard thing which was a bit odd. Good condition and good beer.

Bottle @ De Heeren van Liedekercke. Vintage 2000. Clear amber with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, barnyard and lemon. Flavor is medium sweet and rather acidic. Dry and rather acidic finish. 190317

75cl bottle to cap the DHVL visit. 2010 vintage. Not the easiest of beers as body is oily and flat and flavours are complex and musty. It pours a clean rich golden color with no head. Aroma is musty and sweet with some oxidation, notes of basement, mold, complex. Taste is semi-sweet with notes of red berries and mostly strawberry jam. There’s also the same basement and mold funky notes as per the nose. Some caramel sweetness and leather notes, too. Overall, very interesting to try, but I would prefer the regular Gueuze to this Loerik version

Bottle, massive, massive, massive, massive, etc....thanks to Brian for tracking this down and trading for it and then offering to bring it. Wow, talk about beers you never thought you’d have a prayer to try! Shared on 10/8/16. Wonderful condition, actually showing a moderate amount of carbonation at this point, the yeast/bacteria having perked up, as it goes. Deep, copper-bronze-golden hue as is characteristic of Cuvee Rene. White head showing light retention. Good clarity. Brings me right back to the hayday of Cuvee Rene. It’s still a good gueuze, but recent vintages are nothing like the best late 90’s and early 00’s I’ve had. This one recalls the glorious horseblanket, light cheese, big brett fruitiness and light apple, strawberry, pear qualities. Throw in some moderate lactic character, no alcohol or flaw and you’ve got yourself a beer in wonderful shape and probably easily drinkable for many years to come. Soft, tightly carbonated texture with malt and wheat providing additional softness and light honey. The brett fruitiness outdoes the lactic sourness and there is a plethora of light band aid, horseblanket, dried hay and other various barnyard qualities. Cellar mustiness quite reserved and as it warms and breathes, the big fruitiness continues to emerge. To me this seems like just another fine vintage of Cuvee Rene (which is, after all, exactly what it is), so nothing particularly weird/interesting/different here than if you’d opened a great 1998 or 2000 Cuvee Rene. But still every bit as nice as those.
Bottle thanks to 4lo. Grana Padano share - pours gold white head - nose/taste of farmhouse horseblanket, orange rind, funk, lemon - medium body

Bottle shared by 4lo. Thanks Brian! Hazy, golden orange body with a thin cap that quickly fades to nil. Dank, musty funk, basement. Age has served this beer well. Super silky on the palate. Notes of strawberry, lemon, and kiwi. Delicious.

Poured from a bottle at DHVL. Aroma is very earthy and herbal with a light woody note. A light spiciness to it with moderate oak notes. Light acidity. A touch of citrus and a light cork note. Pours a fairly clear golden color with some copper hues and some orange with a medium small, thin white head. Flavor has a light sweetness with some light caramel and butterscotch notes. Some medium light oak notes. A nice herbal character with some earthiness and a bit of wood. Low bitterness. Medium acidity with light citrus and tropical fruit notes. Nice herbal, earthy notes that add a touch of spice. Mouthfeel is medium bodied with low carbonation. Low astringency and low alcohol warmth. Overall, a better beer than I was expecting. The beer is still lazy, but has great woody and earthy notes. A bit of a cork note, but not corked. Since I can’t try the Cantillon Loerik I thought I would drink this one.
The bottle looks good, the beer in the glass also. Starts much too vapid, artifically sourish, very light hoppy notes. Nothing special!
bottle, traded with MoritzF. Golden colour, large head. Grainy and malty flavours, slightly hoppy, alcoholy flavours also present.

Bottle - thanks pivnizub. Bready nuse with metallic bitterhop notes. Dark golden, low visible carbonation, low head. Chewy grain and bread base with a somewhat metallic hop counterweight. Surprisingly light and sparkly on the palate - Finishes on a aromatic hop note.

(bottle) Clear, golden colour with a short foamy white head. Sweet cara-malty, strong bready aroma with light notes of herbal hops. Sweet flavour; bready and strawy taste with a touch of honey and subtle notes of caramel; medium bodied, soft on carbon; medium-dry, malt-accented finish with a shy bitter hoppy blend. A bit unspectacular but drinkable, solid Festbier-Märzen.

Bottle (purchased at the brewery): Golden coloured with a small foamy layer; delicate honeyish-fruity and Tettnang-like hoppy nose; moderate o stronger bitter-sweet flavour, medium bodied; slightly lingering bitter-sweet finish with a mixture of honey and Tettnang hops in the aftertaste. A well crafted brew.........
0,5l on tap @ Kiev airport. Pours clear golden with a high head. Aroma is clean malts. Flavor is dry clean malts with some hops. Quite decent.

Clear golden. White head, two fingers, good retention. Medium carbonation visually. Watery texture with soft fizz. Aroma is grains, cereals, sweet corn, wet cardboard, iron. Taste is the same. Soft sweetness with soft bitterness at the end. Iron and cardboard notes in aftertaste. Alcohol well integrated.
Ocena wystawiona na podstawie wspomnieñ z degustacji w ramach uzupe³nienia profilu.
Bold and clear golden colour. Moderately-sized head. Smells like a dusty box. Taste is horrifically sweet malt.

1.0 bottle @ Consulate Lviv Clear, gold with a small, white head. Cheap, pale malt, bready aromas. Taste is sweet, malty, corny, DMS-y. Light, somewhat creamy, lively. Finish is short, basically the same. Overall, the beer seems to use its own flaws to its advantage. Patka likes it.

Das bekannte "Stare Misto"-Bier kommt von der Persha privatna browarnya in Lemberg und ist ein einfaches solides (Industrie-) Bier ohne Ecken und Kanten. Es ist leicht süßlich, was der Süffigkeit weiter zuträglich ist. Ein gemütliches Bier zum Essen.

Barwa z³ota, klarowne, piana bia³a, niezbyt obfita, umiarkowanie trwa³a. W aromacie s³odowe, bez wad. W smaku s³odowe, lekko chlebowe. Goryczka niska do œredniej, wysycenie w normie, cia³a nie brakuje, dobrze siê nawet pije. Ca³kiem solidny lager.
500ml embossed bottle. Crystal clear golden, it looks nice. Aroma is metallic and musty, soggy grain. Flavor is metallic and fairly tartish/spicy, nothing special.
Butelka 0,5 l. No niestety cieniutko i wodniœcie. Jedyne co ciekawe to piana.

Cask (handpump) @ Penderel’s Oak (JDW), 283-288 High Holborn, Holborn, Greater London, England WC1V 7HP. [ As Loddon Green Bullet ]. Clear medium orange yellow color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, white head. Aroma is moderate malty, toasted, pale malt, vegetables, baking yeast - bread, apple notes. Flavor is moderate sweet and light bitter with a average to long duration, vegetables - floral, pale malt, baking yeast - bread. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is flat. [20150810] 5-3-5-3-10

Cask @ Wetherspoons - Victoria Station (JDW), Vicoria SW1. Pours a clear pale golden color with a small white head. Has a fruity malty grassy hoppy aroma. Fruity malty grassy hoppy bitter weak tropical fruit flavor. Has a fruity malty grassy hoppy bitter finish.

Appearance: Pale yellow color with a white head. Some lacing. Aroma: Mild malty and mild herbal. Also a bit sour. Maybe something to do with the tap line. Palate: Medium body. Moderate sweet and a moderate bitterness. Soft carbonation. Taste: Mild malty, some yeast and mild herbal. Overall impression: Dull boring ale. Personal stats: On tap at Hamilton Hall (JDW) Liverpool Street Station in Bishopsgate/London, England
Cask @ Barum Top Inn, Halifax. Blonde with a thin creamy head. Crisp, hopped ale that’s not too stated in flavour, although there’s a small bubblegum sweetness in its nose.
From cask. Pours cloudy yellow with a small white head. Mild spiced, slight herbal. Smooth fruity. Grassy. Slight herbsl. Bitter, mild fruity and bitter into a dry finish.

Cask at Penderels Oak, London. Hazy pale golden with a nice offwhite head. Malty bready caramel aroma, fruity, bready, hay, some grapes. Fruity cardboard flavor, grassy, citrus, floral notes, some spices. Kinda thin.

Cask at Pilgrim’s Progress (JDW), Bedford. Straw, well-carbonated, with an impressive white head. Light lagery smell of lemonade, cereal and hay. Taste is much improved with the bitter hop making itself known. Long dry finish, a proper ’bitter’ bitter. Nice but short of incredible.
Cask, hand-pulled, Counting House, fruity, toffee aroma, clear lime, thin creamy off-white head, good film of patterned lacing, bit of pear, floral, green hop, oily, fruity aftertaste

Cask at moon under water jdw Watford. Clear light yellow coloured pour with a thin lasting white head. Aroma is pretty subdued, some tea leaves, light honey, light floral notes. Flavour is composed of semi sweet light grains, little earthy honey, tea bag, palate is medium light, nice cask cask condition. Nothing special but goes down pretty easy.

Cask@the avion, aldridge. Pale golden beer with small head and some lacing. Aroma if light malts and citrus hops. Taste is citrus, a touch of mandarin, some herb and a little light biscuit malt. Good.

On tap at Beer Bistro. Transparent bronze, with some head. Sweet aroma and malts. Starts off smooth, hints of spices, malts, pines and sugar. nice mouth feeling, nothing too bitter nor tangy here. gentle carbonation and finish. Quite surprised at 7%, not noticable. Not like other Abbey Tripels I’ve had, too soft and plain in taste.

On tap at Clybourn on 6/20/07: Transparent bronze orange pour has a wispy-lacing white head. Aroma of spicy clove and sweet Belgian malt along with some bready yeasty notes. Body starts fairly full, but not as sweet as I would expect, but with a finely dissolved carbonation and some light fruity esters. Also has some orange citrusy tartness toward a slightly thinner finish.

Date: 06/20/2007 Mode: Draft Source: Brewpub, Clybourne hazy orange, wispy off white head, drops of lace, sweet fruity aroma with a nice spicyness, big body especially for a tripel, lots os spicy flavor back up by the sweet fruity esters, Aroma: 6/10; Appearance: 7/10; Flavor: 6/10; Palate: 7/10; Overall: 12/20 Rating: 3.2/5.0 Drinkability: 7/10 Score: **/4

(Jun 07) Tap at Clybourn, served in Reserve glass: Slightly hazy deep golden hue with a small frothy head and some lace. The aroma is sugary with mango and pear esters, clove like hop spice, earthy and woody vapours as well. The taste is fruity sweet at first supported by a grainy midsection and a moderate hop spice finish. The mouth feel is warming and smooth, lush and dry finish. I found this quite good but just short of newsworthy.

This poured a slightly hazed golden amber with a modest white head. No lacing. The nose was sweet, fruity (citrus and cherries), and spicy, with a touch of PNW hopping. Fairly light bodied, the sweet pale malt has a nice blend of fruit and warm spices to back it up, the alcohol barely being present in the taste. It finishes on a sweet and peppery note. Better than GI’s previous tripels. Goose Island - Clybourn, Chicago, IL

Draft at GI - Clybourn. Poured a lightly hazy medium golden with a short cap of white head. Aroma was like a very good APA upfront with sweet candied grapefruit and pine.. white pepper and cloves accent and get stronger with warmth. The flavor had a great foray of sweet pine and grapefruit with white peppery spices and cloves washing over it.. heavier on the back-end with the spices taking over.. rather sweet overall with a long spicy finish. Medium-bodied with more sweetness on the front-end and more spices at the back-end.. decent balance.. some sharp notes at the finish.

Cask style at Clybourn pub, Chciago. I like porters but this wasn’t one of the better ones. Maybe a little too roasty for my taste and a little too sweet. A ssume the marshmallow refers to unfermentable sugars-- like a milk or sweet porter. I guess it was ok, but nothing I would order again.

When I saw the name, I feared this might be a cloyingly sweet tooth rotter, but it’s actually an okay Porter. It pours a deep mahogany body with a tan head that does some solid lacing. The aroma is vanilla, chocolate and some lightly roasted malt. Some dark caramel is added to the flavor. This really needs a more aggressive hop bill to tune the sweetness down a little, but at the time it suited me fine. Goose Island - Clybourn, Chicago, IL

Cask pint at GI - Clybourn. Poured a clear, deeper garnet-brown with a tall, creamy cap of off-white head. Aroma was of very sweet marshmallow fluff and vanilla with some toasty caramel and chocolate beneath.. very freakin’ sweet! The porter aspect of it was almost lost in the flavor with marshmallow and vanilla sweetness prevailing.. some lightly-toasted chocolate and caramel deep down, and that just increased the sweetness to an almost unbearable level.. lots of vanilla on the finish. Lower carbonation and creamy from the cask treatment.. some diacetyl at the finish.. too sweet.

column1: Rock Bottom Chicago A Mash Made in Heaven Saison
column5: On tap at the brewpub on 6/20/07: Pours a slightly hazy bronze copper with a thin-lacing white head. Slightly sweet earthy caramel malty nose has some floral hop balance. Body starts fairly full and toasty earthy caramely sweet with a touch of biscuity Belgian malt toward a drier, authentic bready finish. A pretty decent saison.

column1: Rock Bottom Chicago A Mash Made in Heaven Saison
column5: GABF 2007. 55 IBUs and 5.5%. The beer pours to a thin gold body that is extremely watery. A thin creamy white head. The aroma is spot-on-Saison-duPont. Yeasty, clean grains. The flavor is tart, yeasty, with tons of saison qualities. Grains meet yeasts. Tart. The palate is dry, refreshing, and tart. A superb saison. Creamy light mouthfeel. I had a bunch of this beer.

column1: Rock Bottom Chicago A Mash Made in Heaven Saison
column5: Light amber pour, lite white head. Traditional yeasty aroma, light white peppers and honey w/ hints of what i’m told are juniper berries. Avg pal. Odd sweet juniper a touch of tart in the finish and a hint of clove. I’m not a fan of this beer.

column1: Rock Bottom Chicago A Mash Made in Heaven Saison
column5: Name: A Mash Made in Heaven Saison Date: 06/20/2007 Mode: Draft Source: Brewpub, Chicago hazy yellow, fine white head, drops of lace, sweet fruity aroma with a spicy funk, flavor follows the aroma perfectl with a fruity malt flavor balanced by a spicy character, light funk adds complexity, Aroma: 6/10; Appearance: 6/10; Flavor: 6/10; Palate: 6/10; Overall: 11/20 Rating: 2.9/5.0 Drinkability: 7/10 Score: **/4

column1: Rock Bottom Chicago A Mash Made in Heaven Saison
column5: Sampled at RB in downtown Chicago. Pretty sure this is the first Saison I’ve ever tasted and I was pleasantly surprised. Spicy aroma, the juniper and coriander were definitely noticeable and well done. Sweet and tasty beer.

column1: Rock Bottom Chicago A Mash Made in Heaven Saison
column5: Draft at the brewpub. Poured a clear golden-orange color. Head was thin, white, and fizzled quickly. Smelled of clove and yeasty bread dough. Spicy on the tongue with banana and clove flavors. Not outstanding, but pretty good.

column1: Rock Bottom Chicago A Mash Made in Heaven Saison
column5: on tap at RB Chicago. poured a hazy yellow with a short lived white head and not much lacing. beers brewed with lots of honey have never done much for me, but this was an exception. floral and spice on the aroma with flavors more of the same with additional notes of pepper, juniper berry and some coriander. I’m no expert on this style, but I found it pleasant and refreshing.

column1: Rock Bottom Chicago A Mash Made in Heaven Saison
column5: On tap at RB - Chicago. Poured a hazy, medium golden with a short cap of white head. Aroma found spicy white pepper and coriander first with sweet floral and lighter caramel behind.. rather complex and interesting. Flavor found a blend of pepper and coriander spicage with sweet toffee and floral at the base.. spicy finish with very good balance all around. About medium-bodied with nothing really memorable on the palate.. some sweetness and some spiciness.. but only a decent flow. Enjoyed it overall.

Spisane z Notatek kiedy Ratebeer by³ w zeszycie. G³ówne poszukiwania nowych piw i smaków w tamtym czasie kiedy w Polsce by³y tylko koncernowe piwa odkrywa³em œwiat piw innych ni¿ tylko dostêpne w zwyk³ym monopolowym to by³y g³ównie piwa zagraniczne, Piwo wypite w 2007, Z notatek wynika ¿e by³o ca³kiem okej :)
Pours a foggy, yellow with sparse white head. Light Floral notes in aroma. A bit more watered down than one would like I do like the peppery finish. Test of 07.12.2007.

Laff hefiger Antrunk, in dem die Bananigkeit gemessen an der sonstigen Intensität stark erscheint. Danach verhält sichd as Bier allerdings langweilig und recht monoton, die vorhandenen Aromen gleiten nun aus, es mangelt an Spritzigkeit. Etwas malziger Abgang, der der allgemeinen Wässrigkeit unterliegt. Trinkbares Weizen, das vielleicht stark gekühlt im Hochsommer etwas Frische verschafft. 8/6/7/7/7/7

500ml bottle (Carrefour, Warsaw) Hazy pale orange, tight creamy head. Banana anad yeast wheat-beer aroma, but quite subdued. Simple wheat-beer taste, but again subdued. Finish is light and wheaty. Fairly pleasant, but a bit simple.
Sampled at GBF09 Hazy golden with a small, white head. Light, spicy aroma with papery notes. Pretty thin body. Some spicies in the flavour; wormwood and clove.

Sample (10 cl) at Gothenburg Beer Festival 2009. Hazy orange golden, medium white head. Banana and clove aroma with some cardboard notes. Light to medium bodied, medium carbonation. Ok balance, a bit sweet perhaps.

Bottle at "City Pub" Göteborg during the Gothenburg Beer Festival 2009. On June 11, 2009 Hazy yellow color, white head. Wort, fruity scent, sweet. Sweet, spicy, fruity taste, some alcohol. Medium to weak mouthfeel, low bitterness.

Bottled(500ml). -Murky yellow coloured, medium sized white head, strong banana and canned corn nose with notes of lemon. The taste is basicly the same; light yeasty, banana and canned corn with slight citric finish.

Bottle 50 cl. Courtesy of MiP. A hazy yellow beer with a creamy white head. Tart citrus aroma with some yeast. Medium body, again a tart citrusity and yeastiness. No real bitterness - just tart. A boring Hefe. 041009
actually one of better polish white beers, bit shallow taste though, very littel taste actually, the rest predictable as for a medium-class weizen ..........................

Gdañsk 27/7 2019. At the St. Dominic Fair where Koreb had a little stand. Somber Monk and a King on the label. They seem pretty preoccupied with being “Traditional”. The version I am drinking has an ABV of 5,6. Pours light brown with small white head. Settles as thin, patchy layer of foam. Looks more like Coca Cola than beer. Aroma is sweet and with Christmas spices. Cinnabon, hints of Ginger, brown sugar, Christmas cookies. Sweet berries like Blackcurrant rummaging in the background. Light carbonation. Thin, oily, almost flat texture. Flavor is very sweet. Followed by a medium strong sour bitterness. Aftertaste is sweet and stays with me for too long. It might be “Traditional”. But so is Public Hangings, putting people in stocks and beheadings.

Piwo ciemne, korzenne, ABV 5,6%. Nie by³o Ÿle, ale mo¿e poprzeczkê ustawi³em nisko ;) Smakuje jak takie zimowe, przyprawowe, korzenne piwko. Piernik w aromacie, nieŸle siê pieni, wysycenie przeciêtne plus. Nawet pijalne i rzeœkie, mimo ¿e trochu chemiczne, sztuczne. Mo¿e te¿ karmel w smaku, raczej s³odowe, goryczka na granicy autosugestii.
Prawie sie zrzyga³em po tym, trzeba by³o zat³umiæ petem ten chujowy smak nie wiem czy da sie upaœæ ni¿ej elo
Piany brak kolor herbaciany ciemny. Aromat korzenny piernikowy. W smaku s³odycz posmak piernika. piwo jednowymiarowe jest s³odkie i przyprawione przyprawami nic wiêcej. nie za te pieni¹dze.
Ocena wystawiona na podstawie wspomnieñ z degustacji w ramach uzupe³nienia profilu.

Butelka z dat¹ przydatnoœci 27.09.2018. Piwo w barwie miedziano-brunatne, wysycenie œrednie, piana znikoma. Redukuj¹c siê do opaski, nie zostawia koronki na szkle. W aromacie i smaku nuty korzenne, piernikowe, mo¿e trochê sztuczne w odbiorze, ale do zaakceptowania. Do tego karmel. Ca³oœæ s³odkawa, goryczki w zasadzie nie ma. Pijalnoœæ przyzwoita.

50cl-fles (5,6% alc.) bij Artibis te Wevelgem. U: Donkerbruin met een gebroken witte schuimkraag. G: Speculaaskruiden, karamel, melkchocolade en gist. S: Extreem zoet. Veel kunstmatige chocolade, karamel en lichte toetsen van speculaaskruiden. M: Medium body en medium carbonatie.
Overwhelmingly sweet. Hard to finish even half of the bottle. Has sone nice aroma, smells a bit like a polish gingerbread. Might be better when served hot.
Bardzo ciekawy i oryginalny smak. Ciê¿ko mi opisaæ te walory smakowe. Pasuje jedynie s³owo OKROPNE.
500ml bottle. I honestly don't see that much wrong with this, tastes liek a bitter pumpkin spice lager, not bad.

Tap @ Kyoto/Tadgs. Appearance: pours clear amber with good staple creamy off-white head and lacing. aroma/taste: barley, toffee, bread, light raisins, light alcohol and some light fruity notes. palette: medium malty aroma, average to light sparkling carbonation, medium to full body, medium to notable sweetness, somewhat balanced by a medium bitterness, average to long duration and an oily texture. Overall: Tasteful scotch ale

Served in my thistle glass, this bottle pours out a clear orange-brown beer with a beige fast-disappearing head that has a bready fruity aroma. Can a beer smell thin? I don’t know why but I got that kind of impression... On closer sniff, the beer has a fruity ripe peach caramel aroma. Medium bodied but sharply carbonated and it’s got a sharp finish. The taste starts intensely fruity: peach, apricot, stone fruit galore then gives you a toasted biscuit and caramel malt hit. Not what I typically expect from a Scotch Ale but a fun brew. Judging on the style guidelines, this is off in terms of a few points at first. But as it warms the malts come to the fore and really enhance the beer with breaded chocolate covered raisin notes and caramel. It really grew on me.
Bottle at Small World. Initial berry and cherry fruitiness and caramel. Taste is more fruity. Nice stuff. Little prickle. Interesting twist on what’s normally a fairly standard style.
Tap @ Tadg’s, Kyoto. Pours unclear amber with an off white lasting head. Aromas and flavours of tart fruit, caramel, orange marmelade and honey. Medium to full body, warming alcohol.

Can from World Beer Market (Sake no Taniguchi). Thin fruity nose, prunes, vinegar, and even something like funk. Copper/brown color. Sour plums, thin prunes, and a weird sort of light acidity. Possibly infected. The thin, sour flavors go nowhere. The Michael Jackson reference cited in the deScription is no longer apt. A real disappointment.
Draught at Molto. Sour caramel, plum, dried apricot, hints of oak and spice, dry finish.Doesn’t really match the style but still fairly enjoyable and flavorful.

Practically exploded once it hit the glass. First pour was 90% foam and the sour cherry nose screamed infection. Nose has additional funky hay and brett character. Starts with a fizzy body and lemongrass tartness without much residual sweetness. Finishes buttery oaky and acidic. If this were labeled as a sour ale, I might score it in the low to middle 3’s, but as a Scotch ale, this has no detectable peat or caramely sweetness. Overall disappointing.

50cl bottle. Enormous beige head atop cloudy dark amber body. Aroma is moderately sweet, lemon, funky. Taste is moderately sweet, Brett/wood, some lemon. Medium body, some effervescence. Have to assume an infection for a Scotch Ale to have these characteristics. The fact that it tastes ok is fortuitous.

On tap at Popeye’s Feb.2009. Pours clear golden. Aroma of prune, scotch whisky. Fruity taste. Apricot, prune, faint pineapple, dried fruit. No bitterness, a bit acidic - also in the aftertaste. Soft carbonation.

Bottle courtesy of bu11zeye. The beer has a foamy off white head and amber in color. The smell is funky, tart, fruits, wild beer like, brett, and different. The taste is sweet, funk, fruits, and brett.

On tap @ Rabbits Foot. Kind of on the light side for a red ale, but whatever. White foam on top. Pretty biscuity and somewhat floral. A little bit of a spicy note to it. Pretty toasty and grass. The flavor is pretty sweet and malty. A lot of bread and toast, maybe some grain. A light grassy bitterness on the finish. A bit of an apple note to it as well.

Sample at the Meadery. Clear amber color with a medium thick fluffy white head that recedes gradually. Small patches of lacing. Aroma of malt, fruit and honey. Light-bodied with flavors of caramel malt, honey and ripe fruit. The finish is sweet with a grainy malt aftertaste. Average overall.

Bottle. Pours crystal clear amber orange with a huge off white puffy head and nice lacing. Aroma is grain, caramel, honey. Flavor is light to medium sweet, caramel, honey, a bit of lime citrus. Minimal bitterness. Medium body, high carbonation. Not anywhere near as bad as the ratings.

Draught @ Rabbits Foot Meadery, Sunnyvale, CA Pours clear deep golden with a white head. Aroma has notes of malt, corn and honeycorn. Taste is light to medium sweet and light bitter with a honeycorn finish. Body is light to medium, texture is thin to oily, carbonation is soft.

On tap at the brewpub. It’s a clear, dark golden beer with an off-white head. The aroma reminds me of honey corn, with a little twist of caramel. Thin to medium body, dry on the palate, with honey corn all the way. Some bitterness though. Honey in the beers might be a good idea, in this one it’s just weird. 130808
This handcrafted red ale has hit the spot for me on numerous occasions. It is well made, has a nice medium body, and a fairly complex taste.
(500ml swing-top bottle, courtesy of boomer0813) Pours a clear yellow body with a medium white head. Aroma of caramel, earth, herbs, nuts, and honey. Flavor of honey, grain, caramel, and alcohol.
bottle thanks to boomer0813. amber with a cream head. nose is honey, vanilla, malts, and more honey. decent on the palate, flavors of honey, slight tartness, malts, and more honey.
(500ml bottle thanks to boomer0813) still, clear orange pour; very little bubbles here. Nose of corn, honey and cereal grains. Taste of cereal grains, corn, honey, and buttery.
bottle thanks to ericandersnavy.orang brown pour with no foam, aroma is sweet, nutty, vanilla,. taste is sour orange, vanilla, honey

It’s golden with a dense, white head. The aroma has notes of grain, flowers, straw and light bread. The flavor has a light sweetness and notes of straw, fresh grain, flowers and the finish is dry - lovely pils.

draft at Schiessl in Amberg, labeled Hopfen. sparkling clear pale gold body with a lasting foamy white head. clean nose but rough mouthfeel with harsh carbonation and malt, coming across like a vitamin / chalk-laden mineral water. pale and flavorless for the most part, and the hallertauer hops are nowhere to be seen, they’re covered. mild sweet cracker and toasted grain late with light grassy pungency from the hops, that’s about it. and a lingering residue of semi-sweet apple juice kills it.
Hopfen. Golden-straw with a thick head. Very bready aroma with strong herbal hop notes. Deep hoppy character with rich pale malts. Full body. Rounded, balanced character. Very nice example.

Billed as "Hopfen." Draft (?) at Schiessl. Pale bright golden with big white head. Fresh grainy aroma is sweet but in a good way, fresh. Clean, crisp and delicious flavors. Nice herbal hop ending with lingering herbal bitterness. What a nice hop.

Schiessl is a former Amberg brewery. After their closure Winkler started to brew their beers according to the original Schiessl recipe. bottle, bought at the brewery. Looks lovely, large creamy head, very hoppy noce. Intensive hop flavours, bitter, slightly malty. Very full-bodied with dry finish. Very nice indeed.

Looks like a light lager, not that impressive ... golden ... Minor head, carbonation ... The spicy aroma of a Belgian, but light and not harsh. Smell is bubbly. Mild, doesn’t try to bludgeon you. Creamy and bubbly feeling. A bit too sweet to counter the spicy taste; some alcohol/liqueur taste. Really pleasant, not hard to drink, although light on presentation.
Draught: A lighter golden honey color with a medium head. Smells of a hoppy bread with some sort of spice. I enjoyed, but it left the palate with a simple taste, nothing extravagant.

Pours a light golden color with a substantial frothy head. The smell is of wheat and a sweetness of sorts. Taste is very yeasty and full of wheat with a kind of light sweetness. Not too much to it really. The brew feels balanced but a bit doughy for me. Overall I was not impressed with this brew and would not get it again. There just is not that much to it at all. If you’re going to buy something from this brewery stick with the Black Chocolate Stout. Reviewed on: 06-28-2007
Draft. Pours a golden color with a mostly white head. Aroma is floral hops, citrus, and some spicy yeast. A good flavor of lemon lingers. A good choice.
Draft, This shit was just ok. Pale yellow color with yeasty sour aroma. Light tart sour flavors through out with a light malt profile. Again, just an ok brew.
Pours a golden yellow color with a white head. Aroma is banana, clove, pilsner malt, and a hint of bubble gum. Flavor is malty, banana, clove, some bubble gum, and a slight spicy finish.

Draft. Pours hazy medium gold with off-white head. Nose is heavy citrus, some funky yeast, and malt. Tastes very citric, crisp, spicy yeasty, with a lemony limey overtone that stays rather dry, with solid malt accompaniment. This one was very good.

On draft at Capone’s. Pours a light clear yellow with a small white head. Aroma of fresh yeast, slight funk, banana and spice. Taste of carbonated light funk, yeast with a bit of spice. Has a slight banana presence to it.

BBF 07. I thought i had this years ago at gingerman, but I guess I never rated it. Pours a mostly clear with a slight protein chill haze which clears as it warmed. Nice fluffy tight pure whtie hea and good lace. Aroma is doughy fresh pils malt, light cracker and some cereal, with a nice lemony citrus hint formt he yeast- more belgian yeast with some coriander and lemongrass hints. More doughy yeas tand pils malts, with a refreshing hoppy earthy zing, light citrus, lots of yeasty phenols clove and some vanilla. Finsihes clean aand refreshing. Great belgain ale. Has some chouffe and westmalle yeast characteristics which was a nice mix.
(Draught) Pours a hazy yellow body with a medium white head. Aroma of coriander, orange peel, pear, apple, clove, and banana. Flavor of light citrus, banana, cracker, coriander, and spicy yeast.
Poured a deep yellow color with a small off-white head. Aroma is light sweetness and a touch of spice, malts, some grains. Flavor was nice light grain notes, malts.
It’s warm golden with a creamy head. The aroma has notes of bready grain and fruit. The flavor is moderately sweet and slightly dry with notes of bread, grain and fruit, and the finish is fairly dry.
