Draft sample at brewery. Very, very light color. A slight Kool-aid-ish nose (grape specifically). Very light malt with a strong fruit start with a rather hoppy finish, but clean. Honestly a pretty aggressively thought out beer. Decent.

One of the better, more enjoyable beers I had at the Rivertowne. Lighter and more bubbly looking than a ubiquitous pale yellow american lager. No hint of fruit in the aroma. Very low carbonation on the palate. tho there are quite a few bubbles within the brew. Wow, quite interesting and unique, simply lovely. Fruity but not artificial. I like this brew, easy to like and easy to get along with. Reminds me a bit of another fruit beer I’ve had lately, festina peche or a flemish sour. Could drink this all day, a great session brew.

Sampled on draft at the brewery this beer poured a pale straw yellow color with a small white head. The aroma was light tangy and had a vague fruit element. The flavor was light, tangy and tart with a vague fruitiness that was indistinguishable as being pomegranate. I was rather disappointed with this one.

Draught sample at brewery. Fruity and cheesy aroma. Light tart nose with a bit of grainy sweetness and just a tad funky. Hazy pale golden with little head. Medium light bodied with medium carbonation. Starts with a good bit of honey flavor and a sweet fruity taste of what is presumed to be pomegranate. I’ve eaten pomegranate but have never just had the juice, so I’m not sure how close it comes. Light grainy notes with honey and mild hoppy finish. Smooth and fruity and not bitter at all. Clean sweet finish, with an interesting mix of flavors.
Hazy orange-yellow, whitish cover. Aroma is honey, sweet, light caramel. Taste is harsh honeycomb, bitter herbal.

Draft at Ragtime. Poured clear dark amber color with an average creamy off-white head that mostly lasted with good lacing. Moderate toasted nutty malty aroma. Medium body with soft carbonation. Medium balanced toasted flavor with a medium bittersweet alcohol finish of moderate duration. Drinkable brew that met my expectations.

The aroma has orange blossoms, honey and lots of fusel alcohol notes. The body is gold/yellow and holds a thinnish white head. Dry, spent honey notes in the fore with a big blast of alcohol. Very reminiscent of Orange Blossom Pilsner but with much more alcohol. Some light sweet fruit notes in the finish and vague hints of toasted wheat cakes.

From dusty old notes. Glossy autumnal colour and some hop notes but its the structure,balance and mouthfeel which makes this a gorgeously covers the inside of your mouth with morish restrained caramel, leaf and some dryness. MMMnmm.

Slightly hazy amber with some chestnut colour. Thin white head. Off-malt with some hop, slight pineapple, overwhelmed by grassiness. Mouth is citrus hops, with some sweetness, carame malt, some biscuity malt. Palate much sweeter, but unappreciable. Average, hides alcohol well.
Edinburgh Beer festival 07 ... Hazy amber ... sweet fruity hop ... sweet sharp citric hop ... some sweet malts background.
STBF07. Aroma is citrus hops, nutty and honey malts with grassyness comign in later. Taste is similal lots of grassy hop, well balanced.

I tried this stuff a few years back. If awards were given for beer that was so TERRIBLE that it was almost genius, this beer would have collected one. This offering was so bad that one just had to laugh…really it was hilarious! I don’t think that most brewers could come up with something of this caliber if they tried for 3 years strait, yet somehow the wrecking crew at Sprecher managed to pull it off! I tip my hat to you Sprecher, you’ve truly outdone yourselves. What will you come up with next? Not to give you master brewers at Sprecher advice or anything…but if you’re going to brew a fruit beer you may want to try using actual fruit! Keep brewing the beers that keeps us laughing in Chigagoland...Sprecher RULZ!!!

Pretty brew. Cloudy peach pour with a light pink head. Smells like a strawberry scented candle. Not as overly sweet as I thought it would be. In fact, it could be a tad sweeter. What really, Really, REALLY, REALLY kills this is the after taste of artificial flavor. This is obviously not all natural. There is a chemical in this that was rejected by Frankenberry! You’re better than this, Sprecher. Try again!!!!

Unfiltered peach color with a thin quickly diminishing off-white head. Aroma of wheat, strawberry and yeast. Taste of strawberry, candy sugar and sweet malt. Sugary and syrupy with a diet cola like finish. A touch too sweet but overall drinkable.
Horrible. Taste like bad cold medicine. Big head, no wheat flavor and seems like corn syrup was added???

16 oz bottle. Poured a slightly hazy and very masculine orange-pink color. Head was two fingers high and white with decent retention. There wasn’t any lace. Aroma was of buttery pancakes, yeasty bread dough, and liquid strawberry flavored penicillin. It was cloyingly sweet on the tongue with a malt extracty note (not sure if this is even an extract beer). Imagine strawberry frosting mixed into strawberry soda with a splash of vanilla syrup. Pour that mixture onto a bowl of Franken Berry cereal and that’s what this beer tasted like. I wouldn’t recommend running out to grab one of these from you nearest retailer.

Strong aroma of strawberry. Very aromatic, smells very sweet. Hazy Peach colored with a vey thin small fizzy head that was pinkish white. Head remained very consistant in size till the end. Left a light lacing on the pint glass. Taste is a very sweet Strawberry bubblegum flavor. Was like drinking strawberry bubblegum. Medium body, oily texture with average carbonation. The finish is liike when you finish strawberry bubblegum, when the flavor is gone and you get that gum aftertaste. This beer would be great on a hot summer day! It goes down smooth, and if you like your beer sweet you would really like this. Its something different and while I wouldn’t drink it regularly or add it to my favorite rotation I would not hesitate to drink one again, especially when it is hot outside. A nice beer, a nice change of pace. Served at 36 degrees in a pint glass. For those who like traditional beer I would pass on this one. But, if you like to try new and different beer you might very well like this one.

Courtesy SoLan. Pours a cloudy orange/red, with a small white head. Smells of bubblegum, maybe some mild banana, and very faint wheat characters. Sweet smelling, like candy. Tastes like huge bubblegum. Sugary, not really close to a strawberry flavor either. I cant drink too much of this as it would upset my stomach. It might be interesting for 1 or 2 sips as a dessert beer, but other than that poorly crafted.

Courtesy MrFacto. Pours a hazy pinkish salmon with just a bit of white carbonation. Strawberry candy, sunblock, subtle wheat, other light or tropical fruits, sweet incense, candle wax- aroma. Same flavor- more beer like. Too sweet. Medium body, balanced carbonation, sticky sweet. Juice box drink in a beer bottle.

16oz bottle discount liquors(milwaukee)-Cloudy orangish amber body with a small white head and an aroma of sweetness. Taste of sweetness and chewing bubblicious. Don’t get much strawberry just a funky taste.

16 oz bottle from discount liqours in milwaukee. Hazy light red-amber with tiny pink head. Very frutiy aroma with very sweet aroma. Flavor is like when you let a strawberry icee sit in a hot car too long and then you go to take a sip and all you get is dilluted syrup... yeah that’s pretty much what it tastes like, also... some wheat. Body is creamy but syrupy and light to med bodied. i was looking forward to this beer and was utterly dissapointed.
Cask Handpump at the Cask & Cutler, Sheffield 23/06/2007 Hoppy and floral aromas. Clear golden coloured and hoppy with a fruity and slightly bitter dry finish.
A Mes rate: Cask at the Fly in the Loaf, Liverpool. Pale gold with a good head. One dimensional. Dusty hops. Downable.
Bottled. Headless orange pour. Sniffs of sulphur and apple peel earthiness. Buttery malt, citrussy hops and a gnaw of Granny Smith’s. Big, creamy vanilla-malty afters. Tasty refreshment.

Clear amber with a white head, nice lacing. Mildly sour cherry aroma with wet wood and mild spicy hops. Medium body. Nice medium sweet flavors of pale malt candi sugar, spicy hop, earthy yeast, with faintly tart wet wood. Draft@ Naked City onestoppornshopandgaybar.

Pours a light amber. Malty and sweet, with not much of a yeast presence. Lacking crispness. This was a decent but somewhat bland tripel. Disappointing, but very drinkable. My expectations may have been too high based on their wonderful Mouton Rouge and Sang Noir.
Honeyed gold, tall temporary head. Wildflower honey on the nose, very sweet. Herbal, medicinal, aspirin on the back of my tongue. Liquid sugar up front.
on tap at Hayden’s, medium orange pour with no real foam, spiced aroma, good flavors of honey, peach syrup, light corn nuts and some Karo, finish is medium and well balanced, good beer
clear orange pour with a thick one finger head. belgian spices in aroma. bubblegum is what really strikes to me with a slight bitter kick to it.oddly enticing given its weird flavor profile.

Not this was a nice tasty tripel. Nose of cereal grains, sweet fruityness, sugary sweetness, a little dust, and some spicy yeast. Pouts a golden tone with a thin head. Nice sweet cereal grains, straw, dust, yeasty, fruity sweetness. Nice bubbly carbonation and a lingering dryness from the bubbles.

Tap @ Raccoon Lodge: Pours a light golden color with a nice off-white head and good lacing. Aroma is spicey and fruity with just a light yeast note. Tastes spicey and fruity with some sweet and tart notes. Oak aged hops, wth? This has a really mellow hop note with just a bit of citrus and florals. Light yeast and retains a crisp level of spices. This was different, but good.

Green Dragon Pub NYE 07 with Bikesandbeer and his gf Jessi. Draft. @ Green Dragon Pub in Portland Oregon. Guessing this is what this was, listed as Cascade tempter tripel. Pours gold with a bright white ring for a head. Sweet Yeasty Nose. Taste is sweet citrus with a nice body. Nice tripel.
Poured a hazy blonde-golden body with a tiny whitish head. Mildly tart with hints of oak tannins. Finished crisp and slightly sweet. Captivating and quaffable.

Draft at the brewpub (as Belgian Style Tripel Ale). Sweetish Belgian spice aroma. Bright golden color with a white head. Medium body with very smooth carbonation. Sweet caramel, low impact spice, touch of vanilla, perhaps floral or grassy hop. Leaves the mouth tingling. Should be a sipper.
Cask Handpump at the Ship & Mitre, Liverpool 14/03/2002 Copper coloured smooth and slightly rich on the palate with a hint of bitterness in a very malty finish.
Dark amber with almost no head. Sugary scent with a hint of flowers. Very thin, flat, sweet and very indistinct in the mouth.

Cask conditioned at Far from the Madding Crowd, 16-06-07. Poured mid brown colour with great clarity and small white head. Nice hoppy nose with some malt. Tasted initially malty with nice sweetness running through but finishes with a great flourish, lovely bitterness and hoppy character, this really was a very nice beer indeed.

Cask (handpump) @ Market Porter, 9 Stoney Street, Southwark, London, Greater London, England SE1 9AA. Clear medium golden yellow orange colour with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, sweet caramel, sweet grass, sweet fruit. Flavour is moderate sweet and bitter with a average to long duration, sweet candy fruity, honey ? Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20110617]

Cask@Market Porter, London. Deep golden colour, small off-white head. Aroma is fruity, malty and qite floral as well. Flavour is nectar, resiny notes, mild honey as well as some slight wood. A bit sweet and bitter in a strange way in the finish.

Cask at the Doric Arches, Euston, June 2011. Dark gold, thin head. Another English bitter, this one a bit stronger than in its previous internation. Malt, yeasty finish, English fruity hops. Not very exiting.

Cask. June 2007. Light amber with a short head. Sugar and toffee in the scent. Really bitter. Nice body with some sweetness and a slightly dry finish. Slightly sugary-biscuity taste, and a hint of citrus fruits but this is nearly masked by the overwhelming hops and bitter.

Cask conditioned at The Wheatsheaf, West Bromwich, W.Midlands. Yellow to straw with white head. Quite a thin body for the ABV, biscuity malt with a light flowery bittersweet hop note. Part of the Saints and Sinners range, which I am reliably informed are blends. Its ok without being spectacular. Lovely pub though to start our Black Country tour.

Cask conditioned at The Waggon & Horses, Tipton, W.Midlands. Gold with white head. There is a good depth to the body in this one, a biscuity malt with a drying, tartish character although there is a wet cardboard note too. Bitter, but not particularly hoppy finish. The Brewpub is worth a visit when you are in this area.

Cask conditioned at The Jolly Crispin, Upper Gornal, W.Midlands. Pale straw with white head. I think that Titanic have certainly improved over time and this is a classic example of what they now do really well. Lightly set up session ale, good malty body without being intrusive and plenty of hoppy bitterness throughout with a long dry finish. I appreciate that this is a rebadge, I will sort out the Alias bit when I can find out more.

Cask conditioned at The Jolly Crispin, Upper Gornal, W.Midlands. Pale gold with thin white head. Perfumed aroma leading to a thin bodied beer, very floral and a little chemical, soapy in taste. Dry finish, not really to my taste.
Cask Handpump at the Anchor, Birmingham 25/06/2005 Golden coloured and very hoppy with a sour taste. A hint of dryness and bitterness in a lasting malt finish.

Stinks of lemon and ammonia. Hairs-on-your-chest grapefruit hop bitterness with a long, sweet gust of biscuity malt after the swallow. Exemplary, quinine-bitter biscuity sessions sampled fresh at the brewery. Two completely independent extremes of flavour at once. Marvellous.

Cask conditioned at The Cottage Tavern, Ashorne, Warks. Gold with white head. Perfectly reasonable session bitter, perhaps on the top end of session. Crisp tasty biscuity malt with hints of flowery hops. Its fine.

column1: Zvíkov Zlatá Labu Svìtlé Kvasnicové Pivo 13°
column5: Aroma; fruit, dough, flower, wort, hops, mash, malt, bread. Look; good off white head, misty deep golden body. Taste; hops, bread, tuttifrutti, malt, mash, fruit, caramel, wort, and finishes pleasantly. Feel; good body, soft co2. Overall; very good beer. [tasted@ZlyÈasy April-2018] 7474'16

column1: Zvíkov Zlatá Labu Svìtlé Kvasnicové Pivo 13°
column5: Tap at brewpub, Malt,hay,dough and grassy aroma, Hazy dark yellow color, smaller lacing head, Sweeter taste, bitter finish, Medium body, soft carbon, Pleasant stronger beer.

column1: Zvíkov Zlatá Labu Svìtlé Kvasnicové Pivo 13°
column5: Vycap Richtar Jakub. Krasna zlata farba, pena bola sice biela, ale bublinkova a celkom rychlo opadla. Vo voni citit slad a najma kvasinky. Ako keby pivo nebolo dolezane. Chut je vsak lepsia, ovocna, osviezujuca, ale celkom presytena. Pivo pitelne, ale nieco mu chyba.

column1: Zvíkov Zlatá Labu Svìtlé Kvasnicové Pivo 13°
column5: On tap. Pours golden color, white head. Aroma is malty, fruity. Taste is medium sweet, malty, apples, fruity. Low bitterness.

column1: Zvíkov Zlatá Labu Svìtlé Kvasnicové Pivo 13°
column5: (draught) pours a hazy golden-amber colour with a frothy white head. aroma of bubble gum and herbal hops, with a hint of butter, yeast and peaches. flavour is quite buttery, with hints of straw, raisins and a herbal-hoppy finish. medium-bodied with soft carbonation.

column1: Zvíkov Zlatá Labu Svìtlé Kvasnicové Pivo 13°
column5: on tap at the brewery. golden with a faint haze and a bulbous and lasting white head; aroma of hay and butterscotch; rich and juicy malt profile, balanced with hints of vanilla and a herbaceous bitterness

column1: Zvíkov Zlatá Labu Svìtlé Kvasnicové Pivo 13°
column5: Tap at Hostinec Richtar Jakub. Hazy golden color with huge white head. Aroma of apples, yeast, malt. Nice nitter sweet taste, fruity notes, bitter hops. Long esrthy bitter finish. Easy drinkable beer. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

column1: Zvíkov Zlatá Labu Svìtlé Kvasnicové Pivo 13°
column5: Tap. Clear golden colour. Heavy white creamy head. Aroma of hops, grains, overripe apples, peer, minor caramel. Taste is medium bitter, medium sweet. light bitter-sweet finish. Very drinkable.

column1: Zvíkov Zlatá Labu Svìtlé Kvasnicové Pivo 13°
column5: Naprosto prumerny pivak bez chuti a bez zapachu. Zvikovsky pivovar nezabodoval.

column1: Zvíkov Zlatá Labu Svìtlé Kvasnicové Pivo 13°
column5: On tap at Zly Casy. Slightly hazy golden with a lasting white head. Biscuity malt aroma with a slightly fruity touch. Sweet biscuit malty flavour with some diacetyl present. Nice herbal hoppy finish

column1: Zvíkov Zlatá Labu Tmavé Kvasnicové Pivo 14°
column5: Aroma; roasted malts, prunes, wine, caramel, sweet liquorice. Look; beige head, about black body. Taste; dark caramel, grass, prune, sweet liquorice, coffee, roasted malts, soft hops, syrupy malts. Fine finish w awakening hops. Feel; good body, soft soft co2. Overall; very good dark beer. [tasted@ZlyÈasy April-2018]

column1: Zvíkov Zlatá Labu Tmavé Kvasnicové Pivo 14°
column5: Tapped. Very good tmave. Dark (very dark) color with a brownish head. Aroma contains some malts and light touch of coffee and cocoa. The body is not very sweet and rather refreshing than overwhelming (something like Matuska tmave if you compare body textures), thin tastes of caramel and a bit of coffee. Some hops in a dryish medium finish.

column1: Zvíkov Zlatá Labu Tmavé Kvasnicové Pivo 14°
column5: Tap at Hostinec Richtar Jakub. Aroma caramel, fruity, raisins, coffee. Very dark brown colour. Taste plums, raisins, small sugary grapes, roasted. Reminiscent more of porter. A bit of alcohol on the palate. Quite nice.

column1: Zvíkov Zlatá Labu Tmavé Kvasnicové Pivo 14°
column5: Handbottled from Hostinec Richtar Jakub, Bratislava. Very dark color with medium beige head. roasted malt, caramel, dark fruits, coffee. Taste, roasted, dark fruits, chocolate, coffee. Tasty.

column1: Zvíkov Zlatá Labu Tmavé Kvasnicové Pivo 14°
column5: on tap at the brewpub. quality ingredients as with all zvikov stuff - rich slightly shiny black with a firm and lasting beige head; aroma of fresh asphalt and stonefruit; light hints of chocolate pudding and porridge but with quite a dry finish.

column1: Zvíkov Zlatá Labu Tmavé Kvasnicové Pivo 14°
column5: An awesome beer. Only really availabe at the brewery/pub/hotel. Great micro-brewery, top fermented, strange but true! Take your own bottles if you want to take beer away. toast, soft carbonation, creamy, full body, long finish, medium bitterness, medium sourness, light sweetness,

column1: Zvíkov Zlatá Labu Tmavé Kvasnicové Pivo 14°
column5: on tap at the brewery. Very dark, nearly black colour, creamy head. Nose: malt, roasted malt and caramel. Not sweet, rather dry beer with hints of caramel, coffee and roasted malts.

Rated from notes. Served draft at the pub. Poured a cloudy strawlike yellow with a vibrant white foamy head. Aromas were definately of esters, giving me that banana smell I just love. Other sweet aromas and a bit of the typical wheat. Initial tastes are sweet, banana and clove, with orange zest. Aftertaste hangs pleasantly leaving me remembering the nice esters and refreshing nature of this brew (in my humble opinion). A nice light bodied summer brew in honor of the Cicada invasion of 2007.
pours cloudy gold, white head. the aroma is sweet and has a banana in it. the flavor is also sweet, and has a banana in it. a thin mouth feel, sweet finish. not a bad wheat; wheat is not my style.

On tap @ brewpub. Cloudy yellow pour with a white head. Aroma of banana, yeast and some light mint. Flavors of banana, lemon zest, light mint and yeast. Light body, yeasty/fruity with a somewhat fruity finish.

Had a light color and body for this style, and seemed a bit tame. It was more of a wheat ale than anything, but still had the qualities of a hefe. It was full of banana, clove, and even a slight vanilla character, but lacked the fullness I like in this style. It was drinkable, but average.

On tap at brewpub This pint came at about the same time as the Bride Ale. I opted to go for the other first so this one was my second sample of the afternoon. I was caught off guard by a brewpub doing a passable hefeweizen. Most of the ones I’ve had are lacking but this one is pretty solid. While I would not place it among the best examples of the style it is good enough that I would easily recommend it to friends. Aroma / Appearance - The bubbling golden body was glazed by a white head. Dried banana chips, raspberries and white bread were the strongest elements. It is summarized best as liquid banana nut bread. I prefer my hefeweizens to be a bit fruitier but this one isn’t bad. Flavor / Palate - Banana, chocolate chips, spices (orange zest and nutmeg) hit the senses after a brief delay. The aftertaste is firmly banana and hangs heavy in the throat. The total experience is creamy and filling but yet somehow just a bit dulled. I don’t know if it is because I like my beers more crisp and vibrant or this one just doesn’t stand out but I found it hard to get excited. It’s not bad by any stretch. I just don’t know that I would rush to try it again.

On tap at Flossmoor, 9/22/07. Cloudy yellow with bright white foam, decent lacing. Aroma is typical, banana with a little bit of citrus. Flavor is nice and wheaty, very nice yeast character, fantastic mouthfeel.

Draught at the pub, 6/26/07. Smells beautiful, full of cloves, vanilla cookie, and banana. Really an awesome Hefe from an American brewer. A golden pour, darker in the center. Very smooth silky mouth feel. The strong yeasty character makes this beer a standout.

Had this one on draught at the brewpub in Flossmoor, Illinois. Cloudy, nearly opaque dark yellow pour with a thick, foamy off-white head, very clovey nose with banana nut breadiness, very clovey taste with citrusy hops and a little orange. Might be the best smelling beer I’ve ever had. Delicious!

Draft at Radio Maria in Champaign, IL. Pours a pale cloudy yellow with a nice frothy white head. Light bodied with a nice refreshing texture. Nice estery aroma of banana clove. Flavor of light wheat malts, clove, and hefe yeast. Very moderate amount of sweetness and banana flavor. Not bad, but I prefer my hefes to have tad more body and sweetness.
On tap at the brew-pub. Very light, almost white pour. Looks like a Belgian wit. Some banana/bubblegum aroma. Flavor is spicy and estery (more banana and bubblegum). Good representation of the style.

The Fox and Hounds, Heacham (the brewery/tap). Orange gold with a slight haze and thinning head. Brazen grapefruit aroma punching with citrus and fibrous hop resins. Soft and earthy in the mouth with Oakham-like zest and pith aplenty, and a late flourish of softening pale malt digestive sweetness. Irresistable single-varietal hop freshness that disappeared in minutes. Refreshing and excellent.

Cask at Peterborough Beer Fest. Almost clear golden. Rich aroma of grapefruit and lychee. Sweet and medium bodied with bolde, rounded mouthfeel. Salty and hop driven, finishing really bitter. Leaning towards American pale ales.

A mid amber coloured beer with a weak white head. A strong biscuity nose, and a hoppy aroma, slightly citrusy and a touch piney. Dry taste, biscuity malt taste is followed by an orangey citrus fruit flavour. There is a hint of piney resinous in the background. A long dry finish. (Cask - The Fox & Hounds, Heacham, Norfolk).

Cask conditioned - handpump - Malt Shovel Northampton. A golden, flat looking beer. The aroma is very hoppy with lovely grapefruit aromas. The taste is bitter with more grapefruit flavours. Feels light in body with not enough malts to support the hop.

Spisane z Notatek kiedy Ratebeer by³ w zeszycie. G³ówne poszukiwania nowych piw i smaków w tamtym czasie kiedy w Polsce by³y tylko koncernowe piwa odkrywa³em œwiat piw innych ni¿ tylko dostêpne w zwyk³ym monopolowym to by³y g³ównie piwa zagraniczne, Piwo wypite w 2007, Z notatek wynika ¿e by³o ca³kiem okej :)

Bottled 500ml. -Nice amber coloured, medium sized off-white head that went away slowly, dusty caramel fruity nose. Sweet malty, fruity and some hops with notes of green apple and metal in the finish. Quite strong caramel presence. All in all above average strong Polish beer.

Bottled. An amber beer with a lazing beige head. The aroma has notes of malt and caramel as well as a light note of metal. The flavor is sweet with notes of malt and caramel as well as lighter notes of metallic alcohol, spices, and fruit. OK, but not really Belgian.

500ml bottle (Carrefour, Warsaw) Deep orange, persistent spongy head. Dusty deep aroma, a touch caramelly. Lively carbonation. Caramelly and sweet, rather simple beyond that - some mushroom, some aromatic hops. Some sense of alcohol, but not actually tasting boozy. Hard to believe it’s a Belgian Strong Ale - tastes more like a bock to me.
Sampled at GBF09 Amber. Medium,. white head. Arttidicial aroma; licorice and broth. Somewhat fruity flavour with alcoholic notes.
Sample (10 cl) at Gothenburg Beer Festival 2009. Clear dark amber, large off-white head. Sugary and slightly nutty aroma with alcohol. Medium bodied and smooth. A bit sweet with moderate bitterness.

Bottle at "City Pub" Göteborg during the Gothenburg Beer Festival 2009. On June 11, 2009 Clear pale copper color, off-white head. SWeet, licorice, malty, lactic, alcohol scent. Sweet, apple, grainy taste. Medium mouthfeel, low bitterness. Some alcohol aftertaste.

Bottle. Creamy off-white excellent mostly lasting head. Dark yellow colour. Light malty and moderate hoppy aroma. Moderate bitter flavor. Almost no fruit. very alcoholic. Licorice in finish. Oily palate.
Bottle.. Nice head with good duration. Color is amber. Aroma and taste are caramel, fruits, malt and yeast.

Bottle 50 cl. Courtesy of MiP. Clear amber golden with an off-white head. Aroma of roasted malt, yeast and burned caramel. Quite full-bodied with notes of sweet overripe fruit and burned caramel. Subdued bitterness. Surprisingly Belgian in style. 041008

Cask conditioned - handpump - Malt Shovel Northampton. An old gold coloured beer. Some decent hops on the aroma, but hints of greeness. The taste is decent citricity from the hops, and a good bitterness. Nice enough.

A Mes rate: Cask at The Old Market Tavern. Fairly light in colour for a mild. Amazing coffee character with a nice malty undertone balanced out at the finish by a lick of bitter hops. Not complex but very drinkable.

A Mes rate: Cask at the Fly in the Loaf, Liverpool. Brewed in celebration of the 100th Isle of Man TT. In all honestly they probably shouldn’t have bothered. Amber colour with a good head and lots of lace. Very mellow nose with tobacco accents and very little else to detect. Flavour is all cold tea and apple and is in all honesty not great at all. Thin and lifeless palate.

Plastic bottle shared at a tasting at Max’s place. Thanks Naama for this bottle! 9 days since bottle was filled. 4.5%. Cloudy yellow. Aroma of lager yeast, somewhat vegetal, some malt, a bit of graininess, and a nice citric note. Flavor has some crackery and bready maltiness, and a bitterish finish with a light citric and grassy note. Rather light-bodied. A rather pleasant unfiltered lager. A nice surprise.

At a tasting, thanks, almost no head, light cloudy yellow color, aroma of yeast with some honey androots and a citrus hint, bready malty flavor with a medium herbal bitterness. Really nice, clean and fresh.
Pours a hazy tan colour with a white head. Aroma is malt, fruit and some vegetable. Taste is sweetish of fruit leading to a slightly bitter finish. Not bad.

1 Litre PET shared by Per. Hazy, definitely unfiltered, even has a few particles floating. Dark gold. Aroma of fresh pale malts that are nutty, bright, natural, and invitingly rustic. The soft palate is also nutty with a balanced flavor profile. Unfortunately has some buttery diacetyl. Crisp finish is under-hopped and unrefined but is overall a pleasant surprise.
Bottle. Hazy yellow-tan. This has a lightly grainy aroma. Fresh mix of yeast and malts on the palate. Decent macrobrew.
Bottled, from Norman, St. Petersburg. Cloudy yellow, brief head. Fruity nose with some vegetables. Light bodied with clean, rounded mouthfeel. Notes of hay, slight bitterness.

Bottled, plastic bottle. Before reading the notes: it should be consumed within 5 days and the bottle I had was about 2 months old. Aroma is strong butter with cookies and citric. Cloudy, pale yellow color, white head, fair lace. Citrus, butter, citric start but sweet middle and quite bitter finish, even grassy. Flat and refreshing. When more fresh I imagine this would be a very refreshing summer beer. Thanks Savad!

2 bottles bought and consumed in Belem. Poured pale yellow-gold with a weak white head. Feel: watery light body with medium-high carbonation. Flavor: Very mild and slightly sweet flavor with only a touch of hops and a short-lived aftertaste. The aroma is also very subdued. O: too little hopping to be called a "Pilsen".

Bottle, January 2010. Pale straw color with a rapidly disappearing medium white head. Aroma is non existent, some skunk and very slight bready notes. Flavor is neutral, somewhat chemical and artificial. Almost empty with some very slight hay notes. Palate is light, typical tropical lager. Refreshing. Overall a common thirst quenching pale lager.
Sampled at vt brewfest 07. Pours a light copper color with a small off white head. Aroma of caramel, molasses, raisins, and some dried fruit. Flavor is similar to aroma with a nice dry finish.

6 ounce draught sample at the Vermont Brewer’s Fest (July 2007). Very little head sticks around atop the murky caramel body, little to no lacing....big caramel aroma, bit of cherry, blackberry and tobacco; not too dissimilar from the Weizenbock, I’d guess the same yeast and similar (barley) malts; and like that, it portends good things to come....which alas are not evident in the flaccid, sour and lactic body, which is a bit sweet at the front but quickly goes wrong; there’s also a "dirtiness" to it that strikes me as indicative of poor sanitation, in this case probably at the festival as all 3 of TR’s beers that I tried were off to one degree or another. Too bad, for once they were one of the breweries I was most looking forward to.

Thanks to grassrootsVT for this... Appears a semi-transparent burgundy toned brown with a small, off-white head that quickly fades into a mild cap and collar. Scattered spots of lacing are left around the glass. Smell is of molasses, brown sugar, raisins, syrup, caramel, toffee, and ripe fruit. Taste is of the mentioned aromas with toffee, and caramel standing out in the mix. Mouthfeel is medium/full bodied, syrupy, sugary, and a light booziness found in the swallow.

Poured a clear copper color, with a small light tan that left light lacing on the glass. Aroma of raisins, caramel, roasted malts, dried fruits, and smoke. Taste of more toffee malts, caramel, light raisins, with some peat, tannins, and alcohol in the finish.

Thanks to grassrootsVT for this aged beauty... I had this right after the Trout River Whitewater for comparison’s sake...phew, what a big difference. Appears a hazy, light gold with a 2 finger white head that slowly faded out. Scattered streaks of lacing are left around the glass. Smell is of tart lemon, pineapple, passion fruit, plastic bag funk, and earthy aromas...really addictive. Taste is of the mentioned aromas with a light, white pepper spice, and coriander coming through in the flavor. This went delightfully well with the sourdough bread, and mixed cheese plate we had. Mouthfeel is light bodied, citrusy, with orange and lemon grazing the palate towards a dry finish. More funk beers, please!

Poured a hazy golden color, with a medium sized, white head, that left light lacing on the glass. Aroma of leather, orange peel, brett, tropical fruits, coconut, bubblegum, and chamomile. Taste of more citrus fruits, vanilla, light toffee malts, bread, sweet orange peel, and coriander. Finishes dry, leaving prickly carbonation in the mouth.

Strong sweet citrusy/banana aroma, pours with frothy but short-lasting head, with a dark gold color. Tastes of clove and the Classic Weizen banana with a slight bitter note at the end. Solid but not spectacular for it's type.
50 cl flip top bottle. Poured into a Weizen glass. Sweet aroma with yeasts, fruity spicy notes and peppers. Taste is sweet. Medium bodied. Sweet, spiced finish. Fine hefe.
0,5l Bügelflasche aus Tübinge. Hefetrübes Gelb, weisser hoher Schaum. Klassischer Duft. Getreide, Hefe, Brot. Antrunk Zitrone, Banane, etwas Kork, Brotteig.
Draught at the Brauhaus. Hazy yellow with a medium head. Aroma of wheat and Clive. Flavour is banana wheat, a nice touch of pepper, sweet malt base. A bit thin.

100ml on tap at the brewpub, Tübingen. Aroma is bread, light yeast and very light banana. Appearance is cloudy yellow to orange with a frothy white foam. Taste is light bitter and just slightly sweet. Some dryness. Well balanced.
50cl swing top bottle. Pours hazy golden colour with a small off-white head. Aroma of wheat, many clove and yeast. Taste of wheat, sweet malt, clove and yeast, nothing special.
Tap at the brauhaus. Nose is banana, citrus, apricot. Pours hazy orange. Palate is nice banana, citrus. Decent weizen, but nothing special. Something local for Rating #150 :)
Tap in Tübingen. Hazy yellow color with small white head. Aroma is fresh yeasts, minerally, a bit fruity. Taste is the same, very dry (as usual for this region), medium carbonation. Ok.
On tap in Tübingen. Hazy yellow, small white head. Dominating cloves, fruity esters. Balanced sweet taste, medium bitter. Thin texture, fresh carbonation. Clovy aftertaste, malty.
Hefetrübes goldgelb mit reichlich Schaum. Sehr fruchtig, Banane, hefig, mild, süffig.
Draught at the brauhaus. Brown with a medium head. Aroma of chocolate wheat. Flavour is dry malt wheat, banana and cloves, dry chocolatly finish
On tap. Pours a brown color with white head. A wheaty nose and a wheat body. Thin finish.

100ml on tap at the Neckarmüller Gasthaus Brauerei, Tübingen. Aroma is malt with some vinegar-ish smell. Appearance is dark brown with a brown foam. Taste is light sour with a light bitterness. Drinkable.
The beer has got a cloudy mouldy brown colour with a steady head and medium body. Aroma of yeast . Taste of yeast, malt, citrus and dark bread. Dry finish.

Vom Fass at the brewpub. Pours murky brown with a thin white head. Aroma is banana with a little malt. Taste is banana and cloves but has a sour edge to it and a malt hit at the end. Decent enough but not outstanding.
Fresh from tap. Hazy brown color, fine beige head. Slightly banana, malty aroma. Sweet taste, medium bitter, light sour. Medium texture, fresh carbonation. More banana in the aftertaste, malt.

Sampled on draught@source, TÜ 03/2015. Muddy chestnut brown pour. Faintly caramelised banana and roast nut mix blandly blended into soggy Weetabix. OK at source, where they seemed to have chalky pipes. Hardly stellar for a brewpub focussing on Weizen.
tap at the brauhaus. cloudy dark, banana and cloves. a little roasted malt flavor. nice and very drinkable.
On tap at the brewpub. Ruddy brown. Caramel and banana aroma, semi-sweet fruitiness. Drinkable.
From tap at the brewpub. Pours hazy and dark brown with a small tan head. Roma is roasted malty and light estery. Dr and roasted malty into the finish.
Cloudy orange. Nose is flowery lemon, orange, blueberry. Flavor is a thing of lemon malt, berry. A bit of tannin. Fruity floral finish.
Docela dost vodovy èerný pivo. Dost zklamání. Aspoò o tomto pivu jsem si myslel že bude slušné.
The beer has got a deep black colour with a small head and thin body. Aroma of malt. Taste of malt and bread. Malty finish.

Nice black color, nice foam, lasts long enough for me. Caramel malty aroma. Malty, sweet, but rather bitter, it was good enough Earlier Rating: 8/18/2019 Total Score: 2.9 Perfectly made beer, bitter and roasted malty as a black lager should be. Nice black color, nice foam, lasts long enough. Had something confetti looking thing in the bottom of the can. It's strange, but the biggest mistake of this beer.

#3230 Clear, dark brown. Aroma of coffee, roasted malts. Taste is smooth, papery, watery, coffee, roasted tones. Light watery body. Bad. Earlier Rating: 9/17/2017 Total Score: 2.8 #1615<bt>Can. Reddish brown, medium beige head. Aroma of toasted malts, caramel, raisins. Taste is lightly sweet and bitter. Caramel, toasted malts, grains. Medium body and carbonation. Acceptable.

Can 0.5l. Clear, dark brown colored. AROMA- roasted malts, touch of coffee, chocolate, nuts, caramel and bread crusts, metal. FLAVOR- neutral, lightly bitter, strong cardboard flavor, metal, touch of caramel, roasty, bread crust. Light to medium bodied. Bad. Earlier Rating: 9/15/2017 Total Score: 2.8 Can 0.5l. Clear, dark red to brown colored. AROMA- sour cherries, black currant, dark caramel. FLAVOR- neutral, slightly bitter, caramel, cappuccino, light roasted flavor, touch of sour cherries. Medium bodied. Drinkable.
Taste - coffee, nuts, biscuits. Pours very dark almost black. Sweet taste too.
Dark color, middle foam size. Good beer, aroma and taste fit into the style. Earlier Rating: 5/28/2019 Total Score: 3.5 Dark color, middle foam size. Good beer, aroma and taste fit into the style.
Pale hazy yellow, good foam. Good fruity aroma intensity, banana. Medium body & complexity. Good carbonation & refreshing.
Milder Antrunk mit spät einsetzenden dunklen Hefenoten. Geringfügig herb, im Mittelteil zum Teil wässrig. Kaum würzig, zum Ende gar laff. 10/7/10/7//7

Draught @ brewery tap, Burggraf Bräu, Bensheim-Auerbach, Hessen, Germany. Hazy medium yellow orange color with a average to large, frothy, good lacing, fully lasting, white head. Aroma is moderate malty, wheat, moderate yeasty, banana. Flavor is moderate sweet with a average to long duration. Body is light to medium, texture is watery, carbonation is soft. (041107)

Draught at the brewpub Cloudy blond color; creamy head. Strange aroma, sour (rotten) apples, warm plastic. Same weird flavor, a bit sweet too. Weak final. Only the mosquito liked it: I found one in the glass ;-)
On tap. Quite malty, slightly dusty. The flavour is also malty and dusty. Mild but nice.
Recht bitterer Antrunk, kaum malzig. Im Mittelteil dann auch hopfig und leicht grasig, wenig süß hinter den bitteren Noten. Würziges Finish mit weiterhin intensiver Bitterkeit. 11/10/11/11//10

Draught at the brewpub Hazy golden color; creamy head. Some aroma of malt and flowers, mellow. Soft mouthfeel, some sweetness, very light sourness; not enough taste (malt) and not enough hop (aroma and bitterness). Too simple.
As "Helles". Light yellow with a white head. Aroma is moderate hoppy. Flavor light sweet, moderate bitter. Light to medium body.

Frisch herber Antrunk mit knackiger Bitterkeit. Während die Herbe konstant bleibt bildet sich der Hopfen weiter aus, die Bittereit folgt mit Abstand. Nachfolgend auf Hopfenbasis würzig. Langer frischer und bitterer Abgang. 11/12/10/12//11

Draught @ brewery tap, Burggraf Bräu, Bensheim-Auerbach, Hessen, Germany. Hazy medium yellow color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, toasted, light yeasty. Flavor is moderate sweet and light bitter with a average duration. Body is light to medium, texture is watery, carbonation is soft. (041107)

2011-05-24, draught at the brauhaus, 7-4-6-3-13=33 Cloudy deep blond color, with a generous, compact and persistent head. It has a quite pleasant aroma of malt and cereals, of moderate intensity. The body is lean and the mouthfeel is dry; there is some malt flavor with appreciated but mild crispy tones; the bitterness is quite strong, but the hop doesn’t come with adequate aromatic qualities. It’s a honest Pilsner, able to provide the necessary refreshment, although without thrills. 2010-11-28, draught at the brauhaus, 5-4-6-3-10=28 Hazy blond color; compact head. Quite strong aroma of butter. The mouthfeel is quite dry; there is not much malt flavor, but at least a quite strong bitterness, with limited hop qualities too; unfortunately the diacetyl is almost unbearable; the final is too bitter. Rough. 2007-06-13, draught at the brauhaus, 6-3-6-3-11=29 Cloudy blond color; creamy head. The malt/hop aroma (classic German) is light. The body, as the others, is soft, there are only traces of crispy malt and aromatic hops; it reminds me the many Pils brewed in buy-the-equipment-and-brew-by-yourself around Europe. Not bad, but too simple.

2011-05-24, draught at the brauhaus, 7-4-6-2-12=31 Cloudy orange-amber color; generous compact head. The aroma of malt and cereals is pleasant, reminiscent of cookies and freshly baked cakes. It has a correct body strength, with moderate malt flavor, light residual sweetness, quite evident buttery trace (diacetyl), and some alcohol presence. The bitterness is on the high edge for the style. Not completely bad, but nevertheless with minor flaws. 2011-04-28, draught at the brauhaus, 6-4-6-3-12=31 Cloudy orange-amber color; compact head. Light malt aroma and some malt flavor and other cereals; light residual sugars, with correct-to-strong bitterness. It’s served at correct temperature, but it’s also a bit too much carbonated. Not bad but nothing special. 2007-06-13, draught at the brauhaus, 6-3-6-3-12=30 Hazy deep blond color; creamy head. As for the Märzen, the aroma is mellow, sweet, but maybe here there is a hint of hop. Also the flavor is a notch better than the Märzen, still similar; soft mouthfeel, sweet, some malt taste, very light fruitiness from the yeast, some more bitterness. Drinkable.
On tap at the brewpub. Dunkel orange braune Farbe, geringe beige schaumkrone. Geruch ist mild röstmalzig, schokoladig. Geschmack ist angenehm röstmalzig, karamellig, schokoladig, gut!
Brown/black pour. Aroma of watered down roasted malts, coffee, some smoke. Taste is light sweetness with a decent hop bite and some roast.

Bitter röstiger Antrunk, fast verbrannt. Die vorhandene Süße kann hier nur bedingt ausgleichen, das butter bleibt bitter, milder aber erkennbarer Hopfen. Ab dem Mittelteil ausgewogener, die Röstigkeit ist nun deutlich bekömmlicher. 12/9/8/9//9

Draught @ brewery tap, Burggraf Bräu, Bensheim-Auerbach, Hessen, Germany. Clear medium brown color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, light beige head. Aroma is moderate malty, caramel, chocolate, butter. Flavor is moderate sweet with a average duration. Body is light to medium, texture is watery to oily, carbonation is soft. (041107)
Draught at the brewpub Clean brown color; creamy head. Light caramel aroma. Medium body strength, based on a mild caramel taste, correct bitterness. Drinkable, but not daring.
De minste van Bellevaux, het is in mijn glas een troebel witbier met bijna geen schuim en het aroma en smaak is bitter van de citroen. Voor de rest dun en waterig.

On tap in fall 2008: Pours a transparent dark mahogany with ruby hues and a frothy, well-lacing beige head. Aroma of lightly sweet and roasty dark malts with some grainy character and a hint of noble hops. Body starts with good fullness and carbonation with a grainy dark malty sweetness and some mild bitter balance. Has a lingering roasty coffee finish. Pretty true to style and drinkable.

On cask at the Shirlington location. Pour was typical for the style although the color wasn’t as deep and black as I was anticipating, more on the dark brown side of things. The aroma was chocolate cocoa and some licorice. The flavor followed the aroma with some cocoa chocolate, licorice and munich type malts mixed in underneath to the point where this pulled up just short of the depth of a schwarz, getting stuck in between a dunkel and schwarzbier? Mouthfeel was malty but semi-dry, fairly drinkable.

Cask at the Shirlington location. Clear, dark brown with a beige head that lasts to the bottom, somehow leaving no lace. Roasty and lightly smoky nose, a bit nutty. Mild flavor, roasty, light charcoal, caramel. A rather drinkable Schwarz, but nothing spectacular.

On draft at the 11th Street location in downtown DC. Pours a transparent dark brown with a whispy white head. Aroma of toasted malts, some fruitiness, grains. Flavor has more of the same, toasted grains, caramel. Thin on the tongue. Seems like a watered down version of their Prohibition Porter. It was drinkable and a decent session beer but nothing extraordinary.

Draught at the brewpub, downtown Dark brown color. It has some aroma of roasted cereals. The flavors presents as well roasted cereals, covering some caramel, in a rather dry mouthfeel. Unfortunately there is an undertone of burnt coffee and ashes too, that pollutes the final.
Dark Brown color with White Sandy Ring. Dark Malts..Rye Aroma. Toasted Malt Flavor..Light Rye Bread Notes..Dry Malty Finish. Nice, Not too Light and Quite Enjoyable.

(Capitol Hill) Hazy cola body with tan head, watery lacing. Aroma is medium sweet, coffee/roast, caramel, some nut. Taste is medium sweet, coffee, some roast, caramel, nut, chocolate, light earthy. Creamy light-medium body, light acidity.
On tap at Brewpub Pours out cloudy gold topped with a white head. a nice wheat beer. A little malt and some hop pretty nice.

On Tap at the Brewpub. Hazy light amber with a small off white head. Some lacing. Aroma was light basic wheat with some lightly woody malts. A touch of hops. Flavor was similar, a wheat beer with not much going on. Still, refreshing and sometimes, just what I like.
Tap at Brewpub :Cloudy gold, lasting white head.Light sweet nose. Clean, slightly sweet wheat malt profile with a brief hop finish

Tap @ Brewpub: Light hazy copper, nice head and lacing. Nose of light smoke and wheat husk, some palt malt, bitter dry boring hops, a bit floral. Still thin and boring, it’s an american wheat, my least favorite style.

Flora is the name for the house single hop brew. Mine was Summit. Hazy light amber colour. Light woody nose with a hint of lemon. Lots of woody flavours...it would appear that Summit is a great bittering hop, but not so much on the aroma as that part of the beer is AWOL. Judging from Jordan’s comments it would appear the structure of the beer - very scant pale malt backbone backing a big hop profile, is the M.O. and the only real changes are going to be the profile of the specific hop. And that’s how a single-hop beer series should be.
On Tap at the Brewpub pours out a ligth hazy yellow topped with a nice little head. A little floral hops on the aroma. pretty cool beer.

On Tap at the Brewpub. Another beer named after the Brewers dog. Light golden color with a thin white head and spotty lacing. Aroma is definately hoppy but a little "off" Couldn’t wuite get past it. Biter sweet malty flavor and a long hoppy bite at the end. Not bad.

Tap @ Brewpub: Golden titanium color, nice head and light lacing. Nose of bright pine and grapefruit, super sticky and "catty" with very little malt and moderate alcohol. The flavor is very herby and catty, spruce, grapefruit and alcohol, sticky mouthfeel and tons of dry hops. A Bit earthy in the finish. Ripe! Finishes creamy and moderate bodied but very little bitterness. Tasty, unique approach.
Draught. Dark brown with lasting white head. Aroma is roast with coffee and chocolate notes. Full bodied flavour, mostly malt with a hop edge

Draft at brewery. Dark amber, not black, do I concur with the choice of dunkel over schwarzbier. Roasty, smoky aroma. Taste adds some nutty character and done sweetness with a mild bitter bite to close it out. Well done!

Tap at the brewery. 4 oz sample. A: Mahogany color, thin creme color head. N: Charcoal, coffee, cocoa, brown sugar, touch of caramel, plenty of earth and loam, plenty of malt, and some pine. T: Bitter and smokey. Lightly sweet. M: Light body, no alcohol, spritzy carbonation. O: Big time dunkel. Lots of roasted flavors here, but I can’t feel like there’s something missing to bring this to the next level. Still, quite good.
Sampled at the GABF 2015 in Denver, CO. In the tasting glass was brown. Light tan foam. Nose of roasted matls with coffee mostly. Medium body. Flavor mirrors aroma. Light bitter finish. Simple and OK
Draft - Light toasted malts. Deep brown with a light brown head. Light toast and dark raisin. OK, but nothing great.

Draught at the Bend Brewing Co. in Bend, OR. Light coffee nose. Dark translucent brown color. Mild coffee and choco in initial / mid is much the same. Flavor don’t expand or change much throughout. Thin-medium body. Very light overall. Okay.
Lightly bready notes aroma and also in the flavor. Pours black in color. Notes: GABF ’09

From the Jug at the GABF, Colorado Convention Center Denver 16/09/2010 Some hop aroma. Bronze mid brown coloured and fruity with a blackcurrant flavour. A hint of dryness and bitterness in a malt finish.

Draught at the brewpub. Served with a wedge of lime on the rim. Dark brown color with some red highlights and an off-white head. Toasty and lightly roasty malt, and light corn in the aroma. Light caramel and roasted malt flavors and a clean lager feel. Similar to Negra Modelo bit roastier and dryer. Light body and smooth texture. Pretty nice.
Pronounced toasted malt backbone - somewhat chewy and bready -highlighted with a light smoke note and a very peaty earth character.

Pours dark brown with a light brown head that sticks around. Smells of sweet caramel, toffee, some licorice, peppery, earthy, some chocolate. Tastes of chocolate, caramel, some molasses, licorice, sugary, earthy, peppery, spicy. Nice.

Appears jet black, with no light passing through it. Minor head, light brown. Smells of light coffee. Mildly roasted malt, bitter and dark. Sweet cocoa at the tail end in the nose. Taste is more burnt and toasted than the aroma. Hints of mocha/dark chocolate, and caramel. Feels dry but smoothly finishes. A little chalky. It’s a nice balance of bitter and smooth rich cocoa and caramel. Really rich and dark. Delicious but too harsh for repeats.
Growler fill from a while back. Very dark pour. Some nice roasted chocolate aroma. Taste is sweet with some caramel and malt noticable. Very good Would buy again

on Tap at Brewery ( thanx Mark ) pors black, with nice beige foam. nose is choc, some anice, dried fruit, and almost maybe a little smoke? flavor is nice sweet malt, some nuttyness, choc, good roastyness . Good beer
Draft. Pours a dark brown body with a big coffee alcohol nose. Caulk and vanilla, sweet and malty. Nice fruity esters embedded in the alcohol sweetness.
Cask conditioned at Mahars. Poured a dark brown with good head. Aroma was roasted and pleasant. Flavor was a very nice balance of sweet caramel, roasted coffee and dry malt.

Tap at Hop Devil. Seems kind of baltic porter like to me (rather than IP), with some definite vegetal lagery notes. Almost a touch sour, with pumpernickel and roasty notes. Not very stout/porter like. Very drinkable.

Draft at HDG for Daze of the Devil II. Pours a deep dark brown with a small fizzy head. Aroma of dry chocolate and some floral hints. Watery body with fizzy carbonation. Slight chocolate flavor with perhaps a hint of dough. If this beer is brewed in celebraion of their 12th anniversary good luck on making it to 13.
Draft at HDG. Some chalkiness to go along with a cheap bittersweet chocolate flavor. Medium bodied with a somewhat sour cherry flavor.

on-tap in a tulip snifter at Hop Devil Grill’s "Daze of the Devil" festival, 1/19/08 A: As served, this beer is a roasty dark brown. Light does not go where this beer’s soul lies! A nice ample 2-finger beige head weighs in, and slowly dissipates over time, leaving a moderate amount of nice, sticky lacing. S: I was a bit taken back by how richly chocolate this beer smelt; I expected the almost burnt roasted aromas, but not the chocolate! A nice oaked character present as well. T/M: Big alcohol bite up front, quickly warms and gives way that roasted cocoa flavoring and a syrupy cherry-like finish. Alcohol remains present, but tight carbonation and smooth, velvety feel help make this an easy-drinker. D: Very easy to drink, especially after one’s palate adjusts to the slight booziness. 9% though, so not a session beer. Quite good, seek this one out.
Sampled at the Das Röhrl. Small nd lasting brown head. Cloudy brown color. Mild banana aroma and taste. Fine body and well fermented.
Ins Glas ergießt sich ein trübes braunes Bier mit schöner Schaumkrone. Geruch hefig, würzig, fruchtig. Geschmack hefig fruchtig, würzig, Röstmalz.

500 ml bottle. BB 25/05/14. From bierzwerg.de. Dark reddish brown colour with a big fluffy off-white head. Mild bitterness, some sourness even, wheat and yeast in the aroma. The flavour is yeast, wheat, mild caramel and some sour tones. Drinkable but quite uninspiring.
Bottled 500ml PBFVIII Clear copper color, small off-white head. A bit sour banana aroma. Medium-bodied. Citrusy banana, some cardboard. Sweetish finish.
bottle from Bierzwerg. Cloudy brown, fluffy beige head. Malty and wheaty with hints of chocolate and a yeasty fruity touch.
Copper pour with small tan head. Aroma of grains and caramel, slight corn too. Flavor of popcorn, some grain, hint of caramel.

50 cl bottle @ PBF VIII, BBE 26.10.2013 Aroma has roasted notes and ripe bananas. Flavour has ripe bananas, some toffee and hints of bubblegum. Palate is high on CO2. Quite typical dunkelweizen. Gets better with yeast added – it gives more toffee.

500 ml bottle @ PBF 2013. Pours a cloudy dark amber colour with a white head. Aroma of sweet malts, wheat, banana and grass. Flavour of sweet malts, grassy bitterness, yeast and banana. Medium bodied, high mouthfeel and soft carbonation. Finishes sweet and wheaty. Decent.

50 cl bottle @ PBF 2013. Pours clear dark copper color with a small head. Aroma of caramel malts, some faint wheat and mild yeast. Flavor of sweet caramel, yeast, mild wheat notes, some hay and goose berries. Strong carbonation.
Bottled@PBF VIII. Amber colour, small white head. Aroma is metallic, some wheat and mild rubbery notes. Flavour is quite similar with mild caramel. Dull.

(Bottle, Foersters Feine Biere, Steglitz, Berlin, 9 May 2019) Dark amber colour with lasting, off-white head. Malty nose with notes of bread, grain, apricots and herbal hops. Malty taste with bread, grain, toast and a balanced herbal bitterness. Medium body, quite dry. Tasty and well balanced. Quite nice.

500ml Bottle - Dark amber in colour. Sultanas, apricot, caramel and some bready notes in the aroma. Biscuity malt, caramel, marmalade and some slightly toasted and smoked hints. Interesting and enjoyable.

Orange, mäßig trüb mit schöner stabiler Schaumkrone. Dezent fruchtiger und malziger Geruch. Weicher Antrunk mit moderat eingestellter Kohlensäure. Typische Weißbieraromen (Banane, Nelke, Weizenmalz) von mittlerer Intensität vor leicht säuerlichem Hintergrund. Verhalten herb-würzig im Abgang. Kein Aromenfreuerwerk aber rund und durchaus süffig.
* Old rating, best before 23.03.11. Weizig-bananiges und leicht säuerliches Weizen. Süffig und lecker!

Bottled, from Landbierparadies, Nuremberg. Cloudy orange, rich head. Evident phenolic bandaid aroma. Dryish with soft, spriyzy mouthfeel and medium body. Wheay crackers, strawberry jam and bandaid. Low bitterness. Refreshing weizen without any banana character.
500ml Flasche. Trübe goldgelbe Farbe, schöne Schaumkrone. Geruch nach Hefe, Weizenmalz, Banane. Geschmack hefig, fruchtig bananig mit einer leichten Säuerlichkeit.

Bottle looks very simple, a bit like a cheap beer. Beer in the glass better, zippy, nice head. Starts malty-yeasty, modest sourish, fruity notes of apricot. Finish a bit drier, but still okay. Quite drinkable. Not bad!

Appearance: Hazy pale golden color with a big white head that leaves a fine lacing. Aroma: Wheat, banana and yeast. Palate: Medium body. Tad sweet and a moderate bitterness. Rich carbonation. Taste: Banana, wheat and yeast. Overall impression: Fresh mild hefe weisse. Personal stats: Bottle from a trade with Grima

(bottle) pours a murky golden colour with a frothy white head. aroma of wheat, straw and light herbal hops, with a hint of banana and rotten peaches. flavour is banana, sugar icing, vanilla and heavy clove, with some notes of wheat, roasted chestnuts and grass. medium-bodied with lively carbonation

500 ml bottle. BB 05/03/14. From landbierparadies.com. Hazy yellow orange golden colour with an average sized foamy white head. The aroma is quite mild with wheat, mild yeast, mild sweetness and hints of banana. Mild yeast, wheat, bready malt and some fruitiness in the flavour. Not bad.
Dobry pszeniczniak, wyraŸny w smaku, piana obfitai sporo siê utrzymuje, prawie do koñca picia, zmêtnienie œrednie. Ogólnie piwo zadowala.

Bottle by 07.08.13. Cloudy gradient yellow-golden with a jiggling, fluffy white head, nose is relatively neutral. In the mouth, yeasty-creamy wit faint bitterness and light sweetness, touch of tart, crisp with hug mineral character and some mild citrus. Medium body, this one’s all about consistency, mouthfeel.

Bottle 500ml. @ home. [ As Haberstumpf Jubiläumsbier Anno 1531 ]. Clear medium yellow amber colour with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white to white head. Aroma is moderate malty, grain, hay, sweet malt, vegetables, light cardboard. Flavour is moderate sweet and light bitter with a average to long duration, sweet malt. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft to flat. [20120517]

It’s hazy/unclear warm golden with a huge, creamy head. The aroma has notes of old baking-yeast, fermented fruit and malt, but it does get less terrible after a little while. The flavour is light to moderately sweet with notes of fermented citrus, malt, and the finish is harsh and bitter with a little sweetness and notes of yeast. Clearly this bottle is not right.
Light amber color with medium-pored head. Smells spicy grainyIt starts good spicy and very sour. The short-lasting aftertaste acidity harmonizes perfectly with the spicy flavors of this beer!

Bottled. Deep orange colour with mediumsized, creamy off-white head. Aroma is really strange, very acidic saltwater along with grassyness. Flavour is saltwater, some mild malts, grassy hops and paper. Not very pleasant.

Bottled Hazy orange brown color, creamy off-white head. Cardboard, tobacco, light caramel in the nose. First impression is sourish, maybe beer is a bit infected. Papery malty flavors, some hops in the finsih. Interesting to see from other ratings that this beer has been infected in every rating.
Bottle at the German beer festival at One Pint, Helsinki. Aroma of... puke! Taste salty. Hazy pale orange colour, small white head. Wow, what a bad beer.

Bottle (bought at the brewery): Hazy, golden, small firm, creamy head; fruity-estery and distinctive bitter nose; moderate to stronger bitter-dry flavour, a bit sourish, light- to medium bodied; lingering bitter flavour with signs of infection. Surely a good beer, especially when it is not infected..

(bottle) Hazy, orange colour with a fluffy, moderately persistent, slightly off-white foamy head. Yeasty slightly sweet and fruity (citrus, orange) aroma with a light herbal hoppy blend. Light sweet and faint bitter flavour, yeasty-fruity and soft malty taste with light herbal notes; light to medium bodied with a moderate carbonation; medium-dry, yeasty and slightly fruity finish. Although the brew is labelled best before August 2007 a minor infection has already started, a matter of fact that demands a re-rate.

Bottle thanks to ronnie. Alround rating. Lackin condition somewhat, however thats how i like my milds, and this is a mild not a dam porter! Roasty sweet malts, tasty chocolate notes, very drinkable indeed.

A Mes rate: Cask at the Wenlock with Rudiger. Lovely smoky malt and vanilla with heavy coffee, fruit and dark chocolate. Sure this was down as a mild in the Wenlock and if it was this is all I could want from a mild. Complex and downable. Lovely.

Pint pulled at The Wenlonk Arms in Islington (London), dark black with a bubble beige head. Aroma of sweetish roasted malt. Sweet roasted malt in the flavour too, deliciously smooth with a lingering burnt bitter finish.

column1: Heavy Seas Mutiny Fleet Hang Ten
column5: This is a backlog rating from 2012 from a bottle, from notes. When I had this beer it was average to below average for the style and not something I wanted to have again or I just didn't get back to my notes because of my technology at the time. Words to describe this beer are toasted malts, caramel, light banana, light cloves, hint off, some alcohol.

column1: Heavy Seas Mutiny Fleet Hang Ten
column5: At first I wasn't too into this beer, but by the last of the 4-pack, it grew on me somwehat. Definitely meant for sipping. Has a redish-brown cloudy appearance. Almost like an unfiltered cider. Fruity and wheaty aroma...on the sour side. Lots going on with the flavor....fruits, wheat, some caramel malt, and medium hops. There are better beers out there in this style (mainly imports from Belgian, etc.). But for a domestic microbrew and for the price, it really is a decent brew. I have enjoyed all the Heavy Seas, and am liking Clipper City.

column1: Heavy Seas Mutiny Fleet Hang Ten
column5: Catch up rating. Color is cloudy caramel-brown. Reddish orange hues, with a big foamy head sitting high. Tall head leaving sticky spots all over the top of the glass. Lots of fruits in the nose, mainly banana. Sweat malt and hints of clove and mild spices. Taste is sweet malt and bananas. Spiced alcohol, slightly nutty. Bitter hop twist and and alcohol kick. Booze soaked raisins as well.

column1: Heavy Seas Mutiny Fleet Hang Ten
column5: Bottle: best by feb ’08 Pours nearly clear, red-brown with a small tan head. Aroma is sweet...dark, ripe fruit, spiced wheat. Taste is also sweet, dark caramel malt, dark fruit, baked bread, yeast, a little booze. A little funkiness....raisin... thickly sweet. Very smooth...not too flat for such an advanced age of a specimen...still has a little tickle of carbonation....a little "agey" tang...but no oxidation or spoiling. Pretty impressive for such a relic.

column1: Heavy Seas Mutiny Fleet Hang Ten
column5: I must have seen this one in the store about a million times over the years but have never taken the plunge until now. It’s time to surf the waves dude!: Ap: EXTREMELY cloudy dark brown, with a slight hazy head, and moderate carbonation. Ar: It smells like some sort of ultra, ultra, ultra sweet caramel candy. A hint of banana adds to the funkiness. T: The overbearing sweetness is really hitting me hard upfront. I can only detect wheat if I really concentrate on it. The more I drink of it, I start to get a mild nuttiness. P: Kind of syrupy, with the alcohol burning after about the 4th or 5th sip. O: Not very....the sugariness is just way too over the top for my tastes. However, I’m willing to admit that this style just may not be my cup of tea...or beer.

column1: Heavy Seas Mutiny Fleet Hang Ten
column5: Refrigerated 2011 brown bomber poured into a weizen glass. Pours translucent medium brown at top which transitions to light brown at the bottom with small beige head. Little lacing, medium body, lighter carbonation, and rich dark fruit aroma. Taste is caramel, dark fruit (mostly raisin with some fig), roasted malt, nuts, some banana, and some alcohol. Pretty heavy but not in a real bad way, alcohol is not covered or I would rate this one much higher. Blind taste test and I would have said a dark strong belgian ale.

column1: Heavy Seas Mutiny Fleet Hang Ten
column5: Poured from a 22 ounce bottle into a Belgian style tulip. Pours a dark amber color with a very nice, creamy, beige head of foam. Nice retention. Aroma is big on the dark fruits and dried and candied fruits. Raisins and some plum come through. I don’t get much in the way of esters here, unfortunately. The taste is malty sweetness with more of the raisiny notes mentioned before. This beer is pretty good, but if a person had given it to me blindly and said it was a barley wine, I would have believed them.

column1: Heavy Seas Mutiny Fleet Hang Ten
column5: 25th July 2010 Hazy brown beer, no head. Very low carbonation. Semi soft and semi dry palate. Sweet malt with a little honey. Nice tangy fruits including cherry and raspberry. Milky sweetness. Finishes soft. Decent.

column1: Heavy Seas Mutiny Fleet Hang Ten
column5: Poured a dark brown color from the bottle. Aromas of straw, nuts, toast, earthy hops, wheat, and some dark fruit. Flavors re malt, with some spice added to it with a feint hint of oak and dates.

column1: Heavy Seas Mutiny Fleet Hang Ten
column5: 22oz bottle. Mostly hazy brown color, minimal off-white head. Some lace. Kinda light, crisp carbonation, little bite. Nice sweet and spice taste, not bad. Suprisingly drinkable for 10%... Pretty decent. Not bad.

column1: Third Street Aleworks Brass Parachute Barleywine
column5: From tap at the brewery. Clear amber copper color with off white head. Heavy malty aroma, caramel, bread, fruity, orange, dark dried fruits. Heavy sweet taste like aroma. Medium oily body with soft carbonation.

column1: Third Street Aleworks Brass Parachute Barleywine
column5: Draft @ the brewpub. Pours an amber color with a small off-white head. Has a fruity malty hoppy bitter caramel aroma. Fruity malty caramel hoppy bitter flavor. Has a fruity malty caramel hoppy bitter finish.

column1: Third Street Aleworks Brass Parachute Barleywine
column5: Poured up on tap at the brewpub where it exhibits a clear deep copper body that supports a tan head. The aroma offers up prunes, brown sugar and molasses. The taste delivers a pulse of cherry, dates and prune fruity sweetness leading to brown sugar and molasses. To midway a nice yet modest in strength kettle caramelization creates another tasty facet to the experience. This is a real nice English barelywine sipper.

column1: Third Street Aleworks Brass Parachute Barleywine
column5: [1/26/17] Draught at Third Street Aleworks in Santa Rosa. Clear reddish amber. Aroma of malt, caramel, toffee, vanilla, fruits. Sweet flavor with caramel, malt, toffee, vanilla ,a bit of alcohol, fruitiness. Medium-bodied.

column1: Third Street Aleworks Brass Parachute Barleywine
column5: On tap at the brewery. Comes reddish brown with a small off-white head. Aroma of fruit and caramel. Taste is dark fruit, caramel, malt, and alcohol. On the sweet side. Decent.

column1: Third Street Aleworks Brass Parachute Barleywine
column5: On tap at the brewpub. Pours ruby with a modest beige head and a fruity aroma. There is a hearty fruit-like flavor with a cola feel. Lots of carbonation.

column1: Third Street Aleworks Brass Parachute Barleywine
column5: On tap at the brewery. Pours a hazy copper with medium off white head that lasts. The aroma is caramel, raisin, candy sugar. Medium body, caramel, bread, raisin, boozy finish, decent.

column1: Third Street Aleworks Brass Parachute Barleywine
column5: Little bit more bitter than I like in barleywines, but still solid overall.

column1: Third Street Aleworks Brass Parachute Barleywine
column5: 2014 on cask. Garnet with fine low off-white head. Stupendous peach, dried apple, gummy bear, and cigar box nose. Intense fig and fruitcake flavor goodness is tailed by gentler pine and ginger notes. Finish is of a drawn out cola experience, with the low carbonation deceptively prominent. What a gem.

column1: Third Street Aleworks Brass Parachute Barleywine
column5: A mildly fruity aroma of dates. It has a brown color with gold notes. A relatively mild flavors slightly fruity. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Called Apricot Pale Ale. Light amber with a long lasting white head and decent lacing. Apricotty aroma and a bit of caramel, sweet and candy like. More apricot in the taste, herbal, creamy, moderate bitterness. Drinkable and boring. Fine carbonation. Doesnt resemble a PA except for the extra bitterness.

Pint on tap at Oliver Square location in Edmonton. Pour was a slightly hazy golden color with small white head and minimal lacing. Aroma was of apricots. Taste was lightly sweet with apricots and a light bitter aftertaste. Decent carbonation and a light to medium body. This beer was somewhat enjoyable and very easy to drink.

Light yellow. No head when pint arrived at the table. Served very cold. Hint of apricot in the aroma. Flavour has meaty apricot taste but not strong enough to command attention through the pint. Generic.

Draught at Falling Rock. Beer is nearly opaque dark brown with a tiny, frothy, light brown, totally diminishing head.The aroma is malty with a moderate note of roasted grain, light notes of toasted bread crust, toasted nuts; Hoppy with a light herbal note, trace of resin/pine, citrus zest. A little 1-D.The flavor is lightly sweet, lightly acidic, light/moderate bitter with a long, moderately bitter, lightly acidic, lightly sweet finish. Smokey retros.The body is medium, the texture is watery/velvety and the carbonation is lively.

tap at falling rock. black pouir with thin tan head. sweet, sour mah, nutty, hop, coffee and chocoa aroma. intense coffee bitterness. blance off. chocolate becomes present as it mellows a bit. Not a very pleasant drink.

This beer pours very dark with a thick, creamy head. It is nearly impossible to see through in a glass. It smells of sweet malt and the taste is much the same. It has a lot of good malty flavor with a little roasty chocolate and coffee flavor around the edges. The main complaint I have about this beer is that it left my mouth feeling very pasty.

Draught at Falling Rock. Head is fully diminishing. Body is black. Aroma is moderately malty (roasted grain, coffee, husks). Flavor is moderately sweet, lightly to moderately acidic, lightly bitter. Finish is lightly sweet, lightly to moderately acidic, moderately bitter, slightly husky. Medium body, watery texture, soft carbonation. Simple, husky aroma and a sourish flavor profile. Not very enjoyable.

On tap @ Falling Rock poured a translucent brownish black with a minimal amber head. Aromas of bitter chocolate, coffee, vanilla and light roastiness. Palate was medium bodied and smooth. Flavors of bitter chocolate, roastiness, light vanilla and light coffee with a smooth lingering bitter finish.
Poured from a growler on a hot day. Goes down easy. Maybe too easy. Glad I am not driving.
Draught keg at Head of Steam, Durham. Amber body. Medium white head. Nose is hops, alcohol, citrus, pine, spice. Bittersweet. Dry finish.

Thought I loved the Odell IPA so gave this a try. The hop nose was nonexistent. The color was cloudy. I can’t put my finger on it but there was an overall bitter flavor that I have to say did not taste like hop alpha lupulin. Tasted more like a soapy flavor. I really did not like this double IPA and I drink a lot of Titan by Great Divide, Arogant Bastard by Stone and similar brews by Epic and others. I don’t know if someone didn’t rinse the kegs or if the Mash temperature got over 170. There are lots of ways to goof up a batch of beer. My wife tasted citrus notes in this brew. This brew lacked the floral nose I was expecting, the sweet nectar of malt was not apparant because there was the other flavor I previously described. I am wondering if this batch or keg had a bacterial infection. The haze and off flavors tell me something went wrong. I’ll try it again somewhere before I put a nail in the coffin for Odell’s double IPA
Orange pour white head. Citrus aroma lots of malt. Same taste medium body..Lots of citrus lots of malt. Okay dipa.
Golden appearance with a nice citrus aroma. Strong bitter citrus tastes with a lite malt and bitterness finish. High ABV I blended well. I like.

Some carbonation, soft head. Slightly off white, settled fairly quickly. Aroma is very floral, with a lot of citrus influence. Almost sweet smelling. Moutfeel, Is medium, not anything to write home about, kind of slick. Definate alcoholic burn in this one. Taste is pretty bitter, and lacking in flavoring hops. Color is very nice hazy orange. Long lasting, bitter finish. Overall quite enjoyable. Almost notes of barley wine in there. Enjoyability: 4/5, would def drink again.
Lovely, well balanced and somewhat light weight for it’s style. Just wish we could get it in the Midwest...
Very smooth for an imperial IPA considering the ABV. Nice bitterness kick on the aftertaste.

Sampled at GABF on 9/17/2010. This Imperial IPA pours a slightly hazy gold color from the tap. Medium sized white foamy head. The aroma is grapefruity, fruity and sweet. A medium to full bodied Imperial IPA. The malts are fruity and sweet. The hops are grapefruity and citrusy. Lively carbonation. Lots of hop flavor without a lot of bitterness. Hides the alcohol very well. Mouthfeel is full and round. Finish is clean and crisp. Aftertaste is slightly bitter.
this beer was very bitter typical of ipa’s I think it was an ok beer but nothing I would buy again
tap. A heavy hue with a heavy body and a sweet aroma. Awesome with a sweet smell a tad bit better than the regular Salvation.

Draught at Falling Rock. Beer is cloudy, medium oxidized caramel brown with a small, white, frothy, rapidly diminishing head. Light lacing.The aroma is malty with moderate notes of toasted grain, shortbread; Hoppy with light notes of resin/pine, herb; Light yeast note of basement; Moderate miscellaneous notes of bourbon, vinous sour cherry and oak.The flavor is moderate/heavily sweet, lightly acidic, lightly bitter with a long, lightly sweet, moderately bitter, light/moderately warm, boozy finish. Big bourbon rets.The body is medium, the texture is watery/velvety and the carbonation is soft/lively. Would like more carbo to help float the big body.Mellowed nicely.

Draught, Falling Rock. Head is mostly diminishing. Body is murky medium brown. Aroma is lightly to moderately malty (caramel, cookie), with notes of vanilla, whiskey/bourbon, dried dates, wood, sherry, alcohol. Flavor is moderately to heavily sweet, lightly acidic, lightly bitter. Finish is lightly to moderately sweet, lightly acidic, lightly to moderately bitter. Medium to full body, watery/syrupy texture, lively/soft texture, lightly to moderately alcoholic. Good stuff; I ended up liking it a lot more than expected (seeing as how I dislike bourbon for the most part). Pleasant aspects in the aroma beyond the whiskey, and a decent sipping balance (it’s sweet, to be sure, but it didn’t seem to be too cloying).

On tap @ Falling Rock poured a hazy copper with a small lingering off white head. Aromas of bourbon, oak, carmel and a hint of vanilla. Palate was medium bodied and smooth. Flavors of bourbon, carmel and vanilla with a lingering semisweet finish.

Draught at Falling Rock. Beer is clear, medium/dark brown with a small, off-white, frothy, diminishing head.The aroma is malty with moderate note of toasted grain, light notes of caramel and biscuit; Hoppy with light notes of floral honeysuckle, herbs; Yeasty with a light note of basement.The flavor is moderately sweet, light/moderately bitter, trace acidic with a long, lightly bitter, lightly sweet finish.The body is light, the texture is watery and the carbonation is lively.Mostly in order.

Draught, Falling Rock. Head is mostly diminishing. Body is medum to dark brown. Aroma is lightly to moderately malty (toasted bread, caramel), lightly hoppy (herbs). Flavor is moderately sweet, lightly bitter. Finish is lightly to moderately sweet, lightly to moderately bitter. Medium body, watery/syrupy texture, soft carbonation. Not bad; it has the right characters, but none of them in quite the right amounts (meek aroma, too syrupy sweet, etc.). A good effort though.

On tap @ Falling Rock poured a clear reddish brown with a large lasting amber head. Aromas of carmel and fruitiness. Palate was medium to full bodied and smooth. Flavors of rich carmel and dark fruit with a lingering bittersweet finish.

8th Big Beers, Belgians, and Barleywines. Pours clear orange with a huge, creamy, off-white head, lasting with excellent lacing. Aroma is heavy malt (cookie, meal), average hops (flowers, grass), average yeast (horse blanket, barnyard, earth) with notes of light alcohol, banana, and vanilla. Full bodied, creamy texture, average carbonation, and a bitter finish. Average duration, moderate sweetness, light acidity and bitterness.

Draught at Falling Rock. Beer is clear, very dark, red-brown with a small, light brown, creamy/frothy, diminishing but mostly lasting head.The aroma is moderately malty with a note of roasted grain; Hoppy with a trace of resin/pine, light herbal note; Light miscellaneous note of boozy vinous cherry, moderate note of plantain.The flavor is moderate/heavily sweet, lightly bitter, lightly acidic with a long, warm, lightly bitter, lightly sweet finish. Boozy blossom at the end of the whip.The body is medium, the texture is watery/velvety and the carbonation is lively.Alright.

Draught, Falling Rock. Head is mostly diminishing. Body is dark brown to black. Aroma is moderately malty (roasted grain, cookie, husks), with notes of banana/gum, clove, alcohol, and diacetyl. Flavor is heavily sweet, lightly acidic, lightly bitter. Finish is moderately sweet, lightly acidic, lightly to moderately bitter, slightly husky. Medium to full body, watery/syrupy texture, soft carbonation, moderately alcoholic. Kind of crude/raw, but it’s not without some pleasantries as well. Ok overall.

On tap @ Falling Rock poured a translucent brownish black with a small lasting amber head. Aromas of charcoal, carmel, dark fruit and a hint of vanilla. Palate was full bodied and smooth. Flavors of roastiness, dark fruit, carmel and a hint of chocolate with a lingering, slightly syrupy sweet finish.

Draught @ Schuhbeck’s Check Inn, Flugplatz Egelsbach/Außerhalb, Egelsbach, Hesse, Germany 63329. Hazy medium orange yellow colour with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, white head. Aroma is moderate malty, fruity, pale malt, mash, light to moderate hoppy, fruity, tropical fruit. Flavour is moderate sweet and light to moderate bitter with a average to long duration, fresh and balanced. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20121001]

2010-09-05, draught at the brewpub, 6-4-6-3-13=32 Hazy deep blond color. The aroma, some hop and malt, is lighter than I could remember. There is a quite good malt flavor, with cereals tones; and correct bitterness. Pleasant but un-emotional. 2007-06-13, draught at the brewpub, 7-4-7-4-15=37 Hazy blond color. Very nice aroma, malt over all, but also a good hop, and traces of honey. Dry mouthfeel, with a very good malt flavor, crispy; also the hopping is quite good, and the bitterness is rising at the end. Well balanced. Very pleasant; dry and malty.

Rated as Dunkel: Der Antrunk ist malzig-trocken. Im Hauptteil wird das Bier vollmundig-malzig, sogar leicht röstmalzig. Der Nachgeschmack ist trocken malzig, aber irgendwie langweilig. --> ich weiß auch nicht, aber irgendwie ist dieses an sich leckere Bier zu langweilig. Im letzten Nachgeschmack wird es leicht süßlich. (Test vom 29.7.2008) --> 12,10,11,8,-,9 - 9,63
